I am willing to give this place one more chance to try their brunch. But I'll definitely pass on this place for lunch and dinner. Sorry, Cascabel, I did really really want to like you!

Stopped in for lunch today. Sat at the bar and got to order right away which was great. i was a bit rushed for lunch. Went with the 2 Chipotle Chicken tacos and added the half salad. All the food was really good. The salad was served on a tostada shell, had fresh, tangy dressing and also fresh lettuce, radishes, potatoes and pickled jalepeno. 

Tacos came out a few minutes later. They each had two soft flour shells and were overfilled with everything. The chipotle chicken was great, not real spicy but definitely flavorful. 

When I was done eating (sitting at the bar) the bartender was nowhere to be found. There was another dude waiting for a to go order as well. I sat for at least 10 minutes before he comes out of the bathroom(hope he washed his hands). He promptly cashed me out but I was already close to being late to get back to work. 

Pros: Great tacos, fresh salad, water with Mexican mint, quick service. 

Cons: Price, 2 tacos for almost $9 and the half salad was an extra $4. I understand it's Manhattan but almost $5 a taco is a bit steep. Also, the salad and the taco were served on mini metal baking sheets. Was a bit weird as I didn't like the metal texture but it didn't matter much with the tacos. 

I'll probably be back but it won't rank up there with all the other great taco places in NYC.
Great outdoor seating, good service, and tasty tacos, though not quite tasty enough for a fourth star. The Monday lunch special is a great deal, and the happy hour menu looked even more reasonable.

The food is good but the service, particularly the delivery service is extremely disappointing.  Seamless quoted 30-40 minutes and it took well over an hour to get our food. We called twice and on both occasions we were told "Our food just left and should be there any second.". We only live 8 blocks from the resturant so it should not have taken 20 minutes from the last time we were told it is on it's way 

Beside the slow delivery, we requested no onions on a dish. When it arrived it was covered in onions. If the resturant can not abide the request, I would expect them to call and explain that the dish can not be prepared as requested and give the customer the chance to order something else. Other resturantd have done this in the past.

I was in the mood for some Mexican food. I just happened to pick up this restaurant out of a hat by searching on my phone. I realized that there was nothing Mexican about this place. They didn't even have quesadillas,instead they only had little imitation of empanadas that had no flavor whatsoever. I have to give one thing to them and that was the wait time for the delivery. The food arrived within 20 min. But WOW. It was the most expensive yet simple ,small,and had no taste.The girl who took my order was very nice too. If you want to pay alot for fancy wrapping and service this is the place to be. But if you are very hungry for real Mexican food and did not find money on the street you would not be happy.

My fiance and I have walked past here many times since they opened. It is always PACKED. So last night we decided, let's try it out. 

Worst. Idea. Ever. 

The margaritas, while tasty, were certainly not worth $10 (hello, this is UWS, not the West Village). I can go purchase pomergranite hibiscus fruit juice and some tequila, too. . . Plus, draft beers were $7 (a high price for the neighborhood).

The food came out fast; however, they put all of the tacos on one plate, which was a messy feat in itself to get the correct food in front of you.

I ordered the Camaron Tacos (described as roasted shrimp, fresh oregano, garlic, chili oil, and black beans) only to received 2 tiny tacos of stewed baby shrimp (presumably from a can) in a sauce that tasted like chorizo. Excuse me, but if I'm paying $8.50 for 2 (miniscule) tacos, I expect there to at least be 3 full sized roasted shrimp per taco. And while the chorizo-tasting sauce was yummy, it was clear that it was used to cover up any shrimp-from-a-can flavor. 

My fiance ordered the Pescado Tacos, which were each about twice the size of one of my tacos. They were pretty tasty, but needed some spice (of course, there was no salsa to be found). 

The service was okay. Our waitress was friendly, but they kept trying to clear my plate, when I was clearly still eating our breakfast radish side dish (which uses "mexican herbs", aka cilantro). We ordered dessert, flan and churros. While the churros were 3 for a $1, they were also tiny, and the equivalent of having one, medium sized churro. HOWEVER, the flan was the most absurd rip-off. $4 for what was 3 bites worth of flan. That's about $1.50 per bite. And it didn't come in with a caramel sauce, it was floating on a sea of plain simple syrup. 

If you want AUTHENTIC mexican food (and more bang for your buck), I suggest Taqueria y Fonda around the corner. Otherwise, save yourself some money and make your maragaritas at home.

glad they made their way to the uws.  definitely a great addition to the neighborhood.  had heard great things about them from the ues, but didnt want to make the shlep.

guacamole  (hot)... wasnt so spicy - we added lime and used their yummy salsas to compliment
shrimp, chicken and vegetable tacos - all good street food
quinoa and frijoles - nice healthy addition but too much cheese, which made it salty

but hey - they have negra modelo on tap!  THANK YOU!

looking forward to when they have a license for outdoor seating....hopefully before end of the month.

all in all, will definitely go back.  good san fran-austin-ish vibe with good service.  great job for day 3 of being open!

I like this place a lot and I've been there many times but I can't give it 5 stars because, as some other reviewers have said, the tacos are just not great. I think 3 1/2 stars would be spot on, actually.

The tacos are good, don't get me wrong, but they are all missing a little ooomph. 

I get excited when I read the descriptions but when they come out they're a bit of a let down. The flavors are all a bit even keeled. No one flavor pops or sings. However, the reason I keep going back is because the Diablo sauce sitting on the table. It adds the oomph the tacos need. It is nicely acidic, smoky, spicy and well balanced. I've tried it on all of their tacos (but the fish and vegetable) and it's great. Love it.

The same let down goes for the pork belly (Gorditas Con Puerco) and the beef rib (Costilla de Carne). Both sound amazing on the menu and both aren't bad but they don't taste as good as they sound. The pork belly sauce doesn't have enough of the smoky spicy Chipotle to balance the sweetness of the honey. I love that combination but it's just not properly balanced. Too sweet for my taste. 

The beef rib (Costilla de Carne) sounds amazing, cumin and pasilla chile puree, lime creme and radish salad. Wow, sounds like an incredible combination. But the cumin and pasilla puree lacks power. I barely tasted cumin the first time I had it. The second time it was better but still a little weak. It's as though they are afraid to really let those flavors come out in fear of putting people off....? Same for the lime creme. It was more or less just creamy. It didn't have that acidic punch (balanced with cool creaminess) I was expecting.

Ok, now on to really good things. The Corn (Elote Asado), of course, and the radishes (Rabano) are superb as is the soup (Sopa de Tortilla). I also think their guacamole rivals that of Rosa Mexicano which is nearly perfect. And I like that the "chips" are actually a complete fried corn tortilla. Fun, and very nicely crispy.

The atmosphere is very nice. Lively and casual but not crazy or too loud. Sitting outside with their tasty drinks and the tacos with that wonderfully smoky Diablo sauce, like I did last night, is really good. I'll keep going back and would recommend it to everyone, but I hope they read this and bring out some punch in the flavors for some of their items.

I came here because my grandmother requested tacos. After walking in I realized I should have selected this place as my dinner option.

I went up to the counter inside to place my to-go order. I ordered two chicken tacos. While I waited, the bartender was gracious and very accommodating. He engaged me in conversation which made me feel as though I was a regular whose opinion he valued.

The tacos came soon thereafter and smelled delicious. I brought them back to my grandmother. Unfortunately she wasn't in the sharing mood, but man did those tacos look good. My grandmother sure looked like she enjoyed them, going off, in Spanish, as to how delicious they were.

Next time I'm in the city, I'm coming back and this time it will be for me.

I was excited to try the tacos because they had so many interesting sounding flavors. But they don't usually sell them a la carte and when I ordered, I was told that I couldn't choose 2 different tacos, I had to get both the same. Even though all the tacos are the same price. That annoyed me even more when I realized later that I had paid almost $25 for 2 veggie tacos and a margarita.

The tacos were okay -- they just come with what's in them and a slice of lime, no sides. The pom hibiscus margarita was a letdown. I love hibiscus, this was just eh. Plus, I thought based on other hibiscus cocktails I've had, that the flower in it would be candied. Sorry if you have trouble taking me seriously after I say that trying to eat a flower didn't work out so well but ugh, I really didn't think it would be raw.

I haven't been able to justify going back, mostly because of their prices.

For some reason, I enjoyed the food from the east side location better.  Perhaps, it's just memory faded or the west side is not as good.  Food was not very flavorful.  We had the Avocado-Pummelo Salad, the fish taco and one of the meat tacos.  All of the

I just moved to the UWS from Austin, so I immediately searched for quality tacos. First I was bummed that you have to get two (or three) of the same taco - no mixing and matching. Then I was pretty happy to know that I arrived during the final few minutes of happy hour, when I could order two single tacos. I got one carne asada and one pollo chipotle. Super tasty, y'all. The hot sauce was delish, and my tacos were served with grilled jalapeños. The staff are SO friendly. I came back a couple days later with a friend and gleefully got two carne asada tacos this time. We each got an order of churros, which met my standards. I think they would be excellent to take home and serve over ice cream, maybe with some dulce de leche. Big ups to Cascabel.

I have to preface this review with the fact that I had just left the doctor's office and had no sense of taste or smell. Also, keep in mind that I am one of those Cali Mexican food snobs. Still, I wasn't blown away with the food I ordered. I ordered a tortilla soup which in my opinion was a bit "busy."  There was a giant fried dried pepper on top, tortillas sticking out every which way and dollops of different things on top. It was bland, but again, I couldn't really taste anything. While I waited I had a iced hibiscus tea (I was actually expecting it to be hot tea since it wasn't specified on the menu) and the waiter brought out a tortilla seasoned with what seemed be paprika or chile powder. I snacked on it while I waited for my food. I also ordered the shrimp tacos. They were a bit salty and served on soft corn tortillas, but just OK. While the food left something to be desired, the extra star was a result of an amazingly friendly wait staff. At the end of my meal I was given two bites size churros still warm. The waiter said they make them fresh in-house. I might come back again, when I have working taste buds, and try their drinks and something else. For my whole meal, I paid $20.00 which isn't too bad for a starter, main course, and a beverage on the Upper West Side. 

Stars - 5 for excellent

Atmosphere **
Food **
Presentation ***
Service ****
Price ***

Considering how relentlessly mediocre the dining options in Morningside Heights tend to be, Cascabel is great for Columbia students who feel like having a relatively nice (compared to the dining halls) and relatively affordable (compared to Community up the street) meal. 

The $12 taco flight is more than enough to feed two people, especially if you order guacamole and chips as well. Be forewarned that they charge you for extra chips, even though there's not nearly enough to scoop up all the guacamole.

The food itself was excellent and a nice halfway point between traditional and modern Mexican; my steak taco came with crispy onions and oyster mushrooms, although the carnitas taco was more straightforward. I'd definitely return in the near future to try out some of the other options--the fish tacos at the table over from us looked fantastic.

I thought this place was good. I went for lunch and had the pollo chipotle tacos which were good. Not very spicy, which I like. They were a bit messy, but overall they were good and reasonably priced. I also had the guacamole, which was very moist and delicious. I would seriously consider going back for the guacamole. 

The service was good, but we ate outside and that particular day it was very crowded with students and our table kept getting bumped into, so that was kind of annoying. Also, there wasn't a lot of options on the menu, so that was a bit disheartening. 

Overall it was good and reasonably priced, I will likely go again.

business.full_address:
100 Westminster Street
DownCity
Providence, RI 02903
business.name: Au Bon Pain

reviews.text: I usually don't review chains or fast food, but I wanted to add this to my list of grab-and-go lunches in Providence. I'm sure I don't have to go into detail about the food at ABP - it's the same everywhere. It's a bit better than Subway but not as good as Panera. The employees here give about the same amount of shit as the employees at Subway though. ::shrug:: You could do worse.

business.full_address:
795 El Camino Real
Palo Alto, CA 94301
business.name: Sinha Ronesh MD

reviews.text:
Dr. Sinha is great.  Super nice guy and seems to really care about his pts.  He gets to the room very quickly but usually seems a bit rushed.  Also, I've had a problem that I felt should have been handled adequately by a primary care clinician but was instead sent directly to a specialist and had to incur a few more copays...

But do choose him if your plan sends you to PAMF and he is still accepting new patients!

Excellent doctor. Very thorough and patient. My 73 year old mother goes to him. The staff are very professional for the most part except for one assistant who refused to take her blood pressure with her home monitor. I took her in because her BP was high

business.full_address:
6128 Village Pkwy
West University
Houston, TX 77005
business.name: Le Peep

reviews.text:
Le Peep has always been a restaurant I was never able to go to, because they close so early (2:30pm).  Usually...I would be at work or in class during their business hours.  

The "hostess" isn't friendly.  It looks like she wants to blow the place up actually.  But I wouldn't blame her. Being stuck inside a dingy place would do that to anyone.  To give you an idea, it's as if you were to go to someone's grandparent's house.  The tables have an ugly overlay, the rails are a dark green, and the chairs are a run down.  But...that's not why I chose to give this place two stars.

I know most of us Yelpers don't really judge a place too much on decor (or at least rate them down for having an ugly lamp).  This place reminds me of a "classier" Denny's.  I hate Denny's - but I'll save that rant for later.  I was told this place has a good brunch, which is why I decided to go here in the first place.  But, to my own demise, I decided to eat a lunch meal.  

My best friend and I ordered two hamburgers: mushroom swiss and the blue cheese burger.  It's the standard type of burger you could find basically anywhere (around $8.95/each).  Here is my gripe.  The waiter (more friendly than the wicked witch in front) asked how we would like the burgers.  We both ordered medium rare.  Both burgers came back well done without a hint of....rareness.  Why ask if the cook is going to do his own damn thing anyway?  Oh, and the bun was a weird mixture of some cornmeal, wheat, and crap.  But...that was our fault for not stating wheat (he didn't ask).  The buns on both burgers were also drenched - I am hoping from the mushroom, lettuce, and tomatoes.  

The plus side to coming to Le Peep is they have a GREAT tomato basil soup.  

Maybe I am being to hard on this place, but the quality of food was just so...poor.  I had higher expectations and should've advise Yelp before coming here.  I've scanned a few other reviews and it seems as though the food is rarely made to how to order.  

Le Peep can keep the ugly decor, but give me good food.  Is that so much to ask?  It seems like it...

Waking up at 8am on a saturday morning? There better be a bad slamma jamma breakfast waiting for me! And with Le Peep, there sure was! yuuummmmy in my tummy! I had "the roost" which consist of two eggs any way you want it, with your choice of sausage, bacon or ham with an english muffun and grilled potatoes... I had oveeasy eggs, with sauasge and toast along with the potatoes! The portion is HUGE! and the prices were great! My meal came out to be about 9 bucks!

The staff was really great! Our waitress came and checked on us regularly and made sure everything was going spiffy! 

My friend had the feta feta which i believe is an omelete with feta cheese on top... She loved it as well,,

I will def. come back for more!

reminds me of a homier ihop

it was nice that we were allowed to bring in our starbucks coffee.  i thought it was also very thoughtful how an employee went to each table to make sure that their car was not being towed.

we got the migas (3/5). solid.  the one thing that stood out was how flavorful the charro beans were.
Cold eggs and rude waitress.  The floor was also full of crumbs and old napkins.  NOT a fan.  There are way better breakfast options in the Rice Village area.  Skip this one.
Service is always good. For some reason their OJ never tastes fresh :( They have good coffee and their food doesn't disappoint.

I have nursed many a Sunday morning hangover over one of Le Peep's Lumberjack breakfasts.  The food is better tasting than Ihop, and (slightly) less greasy than Avalon or 59 Diner.  My friend's prefer Le Peep because they're pretty flexible about making their standard dishes healthier (egg white omelettes, sides of fruit).

The food comes out in a timely manner and the prices aren't bad.  There is usually a wait on weekend mornings, but the hostess is friendly and the staff knows how to turn tables.

No matter when I come here, there is always a full house. 
I love the Lumberjack here!!! You get a taste of everything: egg, turkey sausage, potatoes and pancakes!!! whooaa.
It is a good plate to split with someone and have a taste of all the things I want. 
The French coffee is better is also a plus.
Food a Le Peep is above average. Service definitely left something to be desired, but overall a good experience. Pancakes are quite good.

Was craving breakfast and I thought this would be different other than going to IHOP. I ordered the lumberjack breakfast which includes a little bit of everything: eggs, meat, hashbrowns, & pancakes. Loved the pancakes! Everything else was okay. I didn't

There's just something about breakfast that cheers me up. 

Okay, so Le Peep's decor looks like it got stuck in the early nineties, and somehow that doesn't bother me . . . maybe it's because it makes the place feel more personable. 

Their breakfast burritos are easy to share, and their Roost breakfast is the perfect breakfast combo. I can't help but treat myself to one of their delicious eggs benedict (when I can deal with the guilt), and every once in a while I will ask them to make me a grilled cheese croissant with bacon . . . they never complain and make me the most amazing sandwich ever... Did I mention their croissants are awesome? 

I like their chicken salad, but I personally think it has too much mayo. I'm sure you could ask them to go lighter on the mayo, but I haven't tried. 

I really, really love their waitstaff. I recently had a hard time walking due to a minor accident. The waitstaff noticed and brought me a chair for the wait and sat me at the closest possible table.

I heart Le Peep.

If you did not know anything about this place, you would not think that this is a chain.  The food is great and does not taste "chainy" at all like other large chain restaurants.  Plus they have an amazing dark roast coffee.

I was there twice over a family weekend in Houston.  I had their biscuits and gravy on one occasion and their three cheese omelet on my second visit.  The food was fresh, hot, and great tasting comfort food at its best.

I finally tried this place after my sis recommended it and I wasn't all too impressed.  

The three stars are for the great service, everybody that works there is really nice.  

I had the huge blueberry pancakes and they were alright but nothing special.  The orange juice was also alright as well, but I feel like some boxed juices I've had taste pretty similar.  (but I'm sure theirs is probably fresh)  

I'd go back there again if a group of friends was going, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine at Le Peep.

It's no secret that I'm a fan of omelettes. I can't get enough of them, and I'll contentedly eat one for breakfast, another for lunch and have a sensible, omelette-based dinner. Because of this love of eggs and random stuff, Le Peep has served me well in the past. But this location? AVOID.

First of all, the service was terrible. I don't think the waitress could pay attention if you sat her down, tied her to a chair and forced her to look at you. I -maybe- saw her a grand total of three times during the entire meal--when she took my drink order, when my food arrived a bit overcooked and under-seasoned and when she wandered through the section but didn't stop at any of her tables. In fact, the manager had to bring my BF and I our check and bring back the card I paid with.

For anyone who's worked in food service, this isn't just insane, it's a crime.

I may go back to Le Peep, but not this location. When neither the food nor the service can even be considered adequate, I don't give second chances.

i headed over to this location for breakfast with my mom on my birthday. i had never eaten le peep, but had seen their signs around town. my mom swore anything on the menu would be yummy, so i went for it and ordered french toast, eggs, and bacon. let me just say that it was some of the best french toast i've had in my life. prices were moderate, and the place was packed, so i guess it's a pretty popular spot in west u. there was, however, no wait, and the sevice was great. only bad thing was parking...but you have to expect that in the village.

Sweet Le Peep is so Le Good!  Yeah, I know, cheesy, but come on...a name like Le Peep needs some sort of goofy Le Review!  This place is awesome!  My favorite breakfast spot in Houston.  I'm quite picky, needing egg whites and whole wheat pancakes.  Le  Peep has them both!  HOORAY!!!  It's a really great food at a really great price.  Also, the staff is super friendly....bonus!  :)  Oh, and the coffee is yummy, too.  Nice dark French Roast!

My husband and I get every other Friday off (lucky for us!) and for a while, we got into the habit of coming here for breakfast on those Fridays- the crowds are a lot less than the usual Sunday brunch mania, and its still just as good!  I prefer this location over many of the other- I've always had fantastic waiters and food.

Le Peep

Le Peep peep

Peep peep peep

OK (have no idea what that was about) so I went to check out Le Peep one Sunday morning for a close bfast place. After looking on our dear Yelp I decided to try this place out.

We get to the parking lot and it's pretty full. We get inside (a little after 11am) and this place is packed. The good thing is even though there were a few people ahead of us, we were able to get a seat within 5-10 minutes. The place itself reminds me of a diner, but a little nicer than a diner you would find on the side of the road.

Food wise, what you would mainly expect from a diner. I did try the banana-pecan pancakes. These were amazing. Plus they give you three and boy was I stuffed after two. Prices here aren't too bad so I can see why when we left around noon-ish there were a bunch of people waiting outside.

So if you want good diner type food and don't really want to go to an IHOP, then come to Le Peep. Another bonus, they leave the coffee pot for you.

Love Le Peep! Awesome breakfast place. The parking can be crazy at times and they usually are packed for weekend breakfast, but oh so worth it. I have had the Almond Cranberry Pancakes, Banana Walnut Pancakes, and the Spinach Bacon Omelet that comes with spinach, bacon,  mushrooms, cream cheese and hollandaise. Yum. They also have really good coffees like caramel nut. Their lunch food looks good too, just haven't gotten the chance to try it yet. Just a great place to go so check it out.

Awesome place to grab a delicious breakfast for brunch! Well worth the price and any wait you may encounter! The eggs Benedict are always tasty as is pretty much everything else on the menu I have tried! I would highly recommend Le Peep for a lazy weekend breakfast outing!

business.full_address:
1105 W Adams Blvd
South Los Angeles
Los Angeles, CA 90007
business.name: Adams Family Dentistry

reviews.text:
I went here once and will never go back. I moved to the area in May and was due for my 6 month cleaning. When I came in, I waited about an hour to go back. First I had X-Rays done, which took a while, before the actual dentist saw me. She proceeded to tell me that my bottom teeth had shifted since I had braces and that I should get them straightened out. I told her I wear my retainers every night and she said they can still move during the day (which does make sense). She said I need to fix the bottom and top (which my top teeth are perfectly straight) with Invisalign which would cost me about $2,600 with my insurance. And this is only to fix a few teeth on my bottom row. Then she wanted me to have her put a fixed retainer in so my teeth wouldn't move anymore........ 

After all this she then tells me she doesn't have time to do my cleaning which was the whole point of me coming in, but she does an exam of my mouth and says that I have a cavity and I will come back later to get that filled as well as the cleaning. When I go out from to make that appointment, the lady at the front desk tells me that I owe $50 to secure my next appointment - $30 for the cleaning and $20 for the cavity. I thought this was strange because my previous dentist NEVER made me pay for those things, let alone PAY for them before even getting them done. Whatever, I paid the money and left. 

When I got home, I called my other dentist, and they confirmed that my insurance completely pays for all cleanings and cavities and there should be nothing for me to pay for. So I decided I no longer want to go here,  I go back to the dentist to cancel my appointment and get my money back. They told me I can keep the money there and use it towards my next appointment. Which was fishy because how do you know what I will need next time I come (even though I am never coming back)?! 

Next time I went back to my home town, I asked my dentist for a second opinion, and I never even had a cavity where the other doctor told me I did. Keep in mind.. I had been going to this dentist for 9 years before I moved and I completely trust their PROFESSIONAL opinion. So pretty much.. they were trying to charge me money for work I didn't need!

After coming here for nearly six months, I've received an excellent  Phi Beta Kappa Dental Service; from Dr. Khalili.  And for being a USC Dental School Graduate, this cultured damsel is not in distress; however; she did her homework and it shows. The equipment she has in her office utilizes the latest modern technology.  In addition, Dr. Khalili is a sweet charming meticulous perfectionist--trust me.  And she has plenty of debonair, while articulating her Profession of Dentistry.  Dentist may come and go; but this one is a keeper.

The dental work Dr. Khalili had performed in my mouth is living proof of her expertise.  And besides, the Best Man for the [job] is a Woman!  And, she's no exception--rain or shine.  Great manual dexterity, Dr. Khalili!  You're one tough cookie!!!  Rebel with a Cause!  Along, with a great sense of humor and pride; most men, like myself; also--love the beauty and a smile on a cutie!  Yes, indeed; it is a sex appeal!  Transmutation at its Best!  What can I say?  I'll put my tooth under the pillow for the tooth fairy any day!

Dr. Khalili is honest and trustworthy; and above all, she has a great personality.   Make an appointment; and go and check her out.  Why be in pain?  She has a convenient location; not too far from USC; complete with free parking, and you don't have to walk much or take an elevator to get to her office.  All in all; in my humble opinion, it was well worth it in getting my teeth refurbish.  Great Dentist--Dr. Khalili; and, a Great All Girl Staff--Sonia, Arianna & Cynthia.  You can't get more female than that.  My hat's off to all of you.  Your services are well appreciated.  This place Rock!  Thumbs up!  A++++

Although the staff was friendly, I found this place to horrible. I feel bad to write such a review, but at the same time, I want to make sure that people who are searching for a dentist get real feedback. Dr. Khalili seems like she knows what she is doing, but i feel like she was trying to push products on me that I didn't really need like teeth whitening--and told me that I needed to have a lot of uneccessary work done on my teeth. maybe because she knew I was an SC student she figured I had money to burn.  She told me that I needed to get approximately $5,000 worth of dentist work done on my teeth! I went to go get a second opinion with another dentist, and they told me there were only two things I needed to get fixed (which would only cost 500 bucks)

I would never suggest anyone to come here. I've given this place many chances, but it is poorly run and I found unprofessional.

The first time I went, I had set up an appointment just for a regular cleaning and check up. The assistant that came to get me opened the door with gloves on. When she asked me to sit down and began to get all the equipment--she didn't change her gloves. She began to reach into my mouth. I was disgusted! That door handle must have been touched by many patients....When I got home I rinsed my mouth with listerine  5times.

The second time I went, I set up an appointment to be the first patient in the morning. I arrived 5 min early, and ended up wating 40 min before anyone showed up at the office to open the door! I'm sorry, if someone has an appointment at 9 am in the morning, you better be there before the patient. Then when they finally opened up the door, I waited another 15 min before they saw me. I was pissed...

The third time (yes I know, i shouldn't have gone back, but I'm a big believer in giving second chances, I mean maybe something happended to make the dr late), I waited 3 hours....yes 3 hours just to see the dentist for 15 min to review my x-rays---This was even after I repeatedly asked the receptionist if I could just come back at another time. Everytime they just said it would only take another 10-20 min and promised I would be next.....

I'm nost sure who this Art O fellow is, but I would not recommend anyone to come here unless they have to

after getting fillings here i went to a family dentist back home that i have been going to since childhood. he told me that most of the fillings werent even necessary. not only that, but one of the fillings I did receive started deteriorating only after a couple months. the doctor doesn't seem to care that, once you drill holes in your teeth, there's no going back. she's like a car mechanic that will ruin your car so you have to pay and fix it. i do not recommend this place to anyone with teeth. honest? ha, right....

business.full_address:
300 N Pleasant St
Amherst, MA 01002
business.name: Amherst Veterinary Clinic

reviews.text:
"Searching for a great vet in the Pioneer Valley"

Take 3...

Okay some people may  be a little over protective about their kids.... I might be guilty of similar behavior with my animals.  We moved to the area last year and I've been on the hunt for a good vet for my cat and dog ever since.  We've now tried and canned two other vets in the area.  One because they seemed clueless and the other because their prices were competitive with SF Bay spas.  So at long last, I decided to try Amherst Veterinary Clinic despite the fact that NO ONE on yelp has commented on AVC or Dr. Rosseel.

From my first call, I was sold.  Dawn, who answered the phone, was super nice and able to fit me in (thank you!).  My dog has Cushing's Disease so I was interested in a vet that not only knew about the condition but had experience treating it.  I found Dr. Rosseel to be very familiar with the condition and how to treat it.  His staff were fantastic and very gentle with my old girl.  The cost of my first visit didn't break the bank and was about $200 cheaper than my last visit at another vet.  Additionally, they had great follow-up communication with me regarding test results and next steps.  

If you are looking for a knowledgeable, kind, reasonably priced vet in the area, I'd highly recommend AVC.

Great vet and staff. We moved here four years ago and I just picked them out of the yellow pages. They were terrific with my geriatric dog until the end and now they are my new (rescue) dog's best pals. Knowledgable, friendly, responsive and their prices are very reasonable. Excellent vet.

business.full_address:
Berkeley City Club
2315 Durant Ave
UC Campus Area
Berkeley, CA 94704
business.name: The Dancers' Den

reviews.text: So, first let me say, I am normally very shy in new situations/gatherings and was both excited and nervous about going my first time... However, once I got past the initial nerves, I had a lot of fun!  If you are someone who likes to dance already, you will love this venue...and if you are like me, a true beginner, and thinking about trying it...you will love this venue.  The lesson for beginners went slow enough for me to get it (well, almost get it!), but not so slow that it was boring...the instructors are great!  Their love of swing is quite contagious, and they are fantastic dancers to watch!  The regulars who attend are also very patient and supportive with the beginners, which made me feel even more comfortable.  I am glad I gave The Dancer's Den a chance...and hope you do too!

Awesome building, awesome people, and most of all, awesome location!  There are a lot of Berkeley/East Bay swing dancers and it is about time that we make the San Franciscans do a bit of the traveling!

Let me join the chorus of praise for Dancer's Den... great space, classy venue, very reasonably priced, near public transit, friendly crowd. What more could you want? A cash bar? Check (but nary an imbiber to be seen). Lessons? Check, with great instructors. Live music? Well, maybe someday? 

Word seems to be getting out, and this place is reaching critical mass and attracting a wide range of dancers, beginners to experienced, college-age to old-timers and in-between. :)

Kudos to Jolie, James, and others for getting this off the ground! I hope it has a good long run.

I am so excited that that we finally have an indoor dance space in Berkeley!  As much as I love Lindy on Sproul, doing turns and swivels on the concrete can get pretty taxing on the knees.  Enter Dancer's Den- The building is absolutely gorgeous, and best of all, the floor is SUPER sprung and smooth.  Oh, and I love the music/djing- energetic, musical, and it still has that funky Berkeley vibe.  I'll be here every week, so if you're reading this, you should ask me to dance!
  
I should also mention that the main instructors, Jean and Bromley are AMAZING.  Not only are they incredibly knowledgeable and articulate (they taught me everything I know), they are super inclusive and friendly which makes them great teachers for beginners as well as advanced dancers.
 
BTW- THERE ARE STUDENT DISCOUNTS! $12 for lesson and dance and $6 for dance only- that's cheaper than a movie + popcorn and way more fun!

Pinch me. A great swing venue 5 blocks from my apartment???? Surely I must be dreaming!!

I love everything about Dancer's Den! Lots of great dancers, great DJs, and I only pay $6 because I'm a student! 

But when I do pay the full $12 for the lesson Jean and Bromley make it well worth it! I like how they break up the lesson into intermediate and beginner so nobody gets lost or - on the flipside - bored. They teach at a great pace and have both a professional and encouraging demeanor when conducting lessons. 

Congrats to all the people who put in the hard work to make this venue a success! It was great to see tons of happy people swinging out on the dance floor tonight! I'll be back every Wednesday that I'm in Berkeley while my legs are functional!

A swing dancing venue in Berkeley ?! Brilliant! In a charming ballroom designed by Julia Morgan?! Super-Brilliant!! One could write an entire essay about just the venue - but you can find more about it elsewhere or on the Berkeley City Club web site. But what most lindy hoppers would love to know is that this ballroom has the best natural ventilation of all the venues I know in the bay area. Serious lindy-hoppers know that how much more pleasant this makes the dancing. And if that were not enough, the ball room also opens out to a beautiful terrace where you can soak in the moonlight and cool off between frenetic dances. The venue is just a few minutes from the food-district around Telegraph Ave near the UC-Campus, if one wanted a post-dancing fix.The best part, that should draw anyone to this venue, is how friendly the crowd is.

Great new venue in Berkeley!  Beautiful historic building with ballroom upstairs.  This room cries out to be danced in!   Dance instructors Jean & Bromley are awesome!  And the place is full of friendly dancers.  Also the dancing starts and ends earlier which is good for a weekday.
The Dancers' Den is one of my favorite venues in the bay area! Great vibe, beginner-friendly atmosphere, good DJs, and a decent floor make for a fun dance :)

East Bay Lindy Hoppers REJOICE! For there is finally a spectacular Lindy venue in Berkeley, with a beautiful ballroom in a beautiful building, with excellent instructors and just a really great bunch of social dancers.

I've gone to a handful of "swing dance" venues in the East Bay, and most of them tend to be attended by an older set, with more of an emphasis on arm's-length East Coast Swing. So I've really been craving a local venue that has all the style and energy that someplace like The 9:20 Special has in SF. The Dancers' Den really is that place. The instructors, Jean and Bromley, really know how to teach the moves in an easily understood way, and they make it really fun. The dance floor is great, the decor is beautiful, the dancers range from beginner to veteran, and the atmosphere is unbelievably friendly.

The venue is new, and the goal is to make this a weekly event until forever comes along. But since they're just starting out, there will be a handful of weeks early on where the Dancers' Den will be closed due to previously-scheduled events at the venue. But, as time goes on and we continue to support the Den with our dollars and our feet, they'll surely become a weekly staple for the local Lindy Hop community. So check the website (currently a Facebook page) and get your butt to the next event!

business.full_address:
301 N Harrison St
Ste 50
Princeton, NJ 08540
business.name: Quiznos Subs

reviews.text: The catering sub tray is awesome. People loved it.

Very fast service and they definitely don't skimp on the meat here, which is much appreciated.  I got a large chicken carbonara and took home half.  Yes, it is more expensive (slightly) than Subway but the sandwiches are actually flavorful and not meat-deprived.  Plus, they have Mountain Dew and gigantic cookies.

I ordered a $5 sandwich.  I wasn't allowed to have mustard on it instead of mayo.  No mustard.  What's that about?  Is mustard expensive compared to mayo?

Not going back.  Word of note - there's honey mustard on the side.  Stupid.

I've been a regular at this Quizno's for a good six to seven years now and I've always been very pleased. The quality of Quizno's has gone down in general now that they've expanded so much but I can't say that of this particular shop. The food has been consistently good and the owner's a great guy who sees to it that his customers are always happy and well taken care of.

business.full_address:
4926 Edgewood Rd
College Park, MD 20740
business.name: New York Deli

reviews.text:
As an executive assistant for a small company, I've used this restaurant as a catering resource for multiple events.  Their food has always been a hit with both our employees and our clients and their quick delivery service has always been punctual if not early.

I recently finished using them for a 3 day conference and as always, will use them again.  Their wide lunch menu provided me with enough options that allowed me to use them for several meals without repeating the same menu. Their pricing was fantastic.  For the previous conference I had used another fancier competitor with more of a "foo-foo" menu.  Not only were the proportions insufficient, it cost us twice the amount.  

I've never eaten in the dining room but been there plenty of times to order and pickup to see enough.  True it has a "greasy spoon" feel but it's always been clean and the food fresh.  While some of the previous customer's may have not particulary liked what they ordered, I feel it's not an accurate reflection of their service overall.  It's quiet and the food comes quick and fresh, which it just the way I like it.

If you're looking for a place to grab a quick bite and allow a few minutes to think, this is the place for you.  If you're an admin asst who needs a great catering option, consider NY Deli, especially if you want the most bang for your buck.

SO GOOD! I literally just finished eating my crab cake sandwich at work and the next thing I wanted to do was to tell yelp how awesome it was! 

I order delivery to work for a late lunch and it came within 30minutes. The food was hot, and not all sloppy like you might expect with some deliveries.

The crab cake and fries were so extremely delicious. For the price,  you can't beat it!

Definitely a new-found fan.
great breakfast sandwiches (pastrami, egg on a grilled bun), but the coffee was awful (note, I am a coffee snob). Fix that and I'll have a new favorite greasy spoon breakfast spot.

We used a groupon to initially go as it's located where you'd never know it existed or would ever see it. 

The food is EXCELLENT!! The portions are large and the price are regular to low for a deli.

A double club sandwich is huge!! Be warned!
Best sandwhiches in the area- I used LivingSocial's takeout and delivery and they were at my house with a hot sub within 1/2 hour! yum!

I've driven by this corner a million times... curiosity got the better of us. Perhaps there's a good reason why no one has ever reviewed this place. It's a nondescript college town sandwich/hamburger greasy spoon restaurant. Ordered two sandwich specials at included steak fries and jumbo sodas. The fries were the best part of the whole meal. The Rubin & pastrami... it was nothing special to write home about. Soda and lemonade were both flat.  Would have done a whole lot better having lunch at home.

We ordered subs for a lunch event. I got a grilled chicken sub, which came with a pickle quarter and a tiny handful of chips.

The sub was incredibly bland. It consisted of a texture-less roll with an excessive amount of mayo, this was topped with one thin layer of lettuce, two tomato rings (ill explain this in a second), and two pieces of utterly flavorless "chicken". At the very least they could have added some kind of seasoning, salt would have been a great start.

On to the tomato rings. These were sliced from an unripe run of the mill large size little flavor tomato. It was as if someone had scooped out the innards of the tomato in an attempt to hide something. The insides of the tomato are the best part, especially the gelatinous ambrosia that surrounds the seeds. There is never any good reason to do this, it should be a crime.

The sandwich was a complete disappointment, and furthermore the 8-10 chips which were included in the Styrofoam container were soggy when I opened the box.

Don't waste your time with this place.
Yummy stuff!  Their "Brisket Deluxe" is melt in you mouth delicious!  Sure wish their hours were a little more friendly to those of us who work...

tried this deli out and it was great the food was excellent the service was very good the staff were very friendly. i have worked and owned a few delis in my time and this was a very nice place to eat. they have very good quality food and fresh. i would  .definitely come back next time i am in the area. keep up the good work guys
chef rob
fauxfooddiner.com

There is nothing wrong with the pastrami sandwiches at this little place. The pastrami is good with crisp cole slaw on rye bread if that is how you like it. 
 (You can also get pastrami and cheese on rye if you like that better.) We have gone there twice so far and plan to go back. We have even used the groupon deal here. Don't let the little off the beaten track strip mall appearance put you off - go on in.

business.full_address:
9200 Monte Vista Ave
Montclair, CA 91763
business.name: DJ RudTek

reviews.text: That's My right hand man. Dj Rudtek always opens up my Big events because I know he will bring the People to the Dance Floor. Dj Rudtek has one of the largest Music collection I have ever seen that makes it a Plus to hire Dj Rudtek. Great Job, keep it up...DJ INDAMIX

Rudtek is a professional DJ with experience in every type of party and can be counted on to be punctual, professional, courteous, attentive and will satisfy you with quality equipment and music selection. Book this DJ!!

Great DJ.  Has all songs to play to all kinds of crowds.  He sets up early and always on time.  He's played for us many many times.

Feel safe he will deliver and do a great job for you.  Real good guy.
We have had 2 events by DJ Rud Tek....awesome every time! Prompt, courteous,and PROFESSIONAL!! All our guests had a great time!! Highly recommend him for your event!

Have had Mr. Rudytek(lol!). DJ for many family functions ,from teen parties to kick back family bbqs,always a BLAST!!

Always has the crowd movin from the kiddos to the older Crowd!!

Always has what u want to groove to...if not he WILL find it!!

business.full_address:
Sunset Blvd
Los Angeles, CA
business.name: Hot Chick Bartenders

reviews.text: This is a great service for anyone planning a private event and needs experienced bar tenders and mixologists.  And just because they're hot, doesn't mean they're not super nice and way more intelligent than my local pub's bartender.  Definitely recommend, they'll immediately class up an event with educated and experienced bartenders who will bring a fun entertaining atmosphere to any event.
Hottest, most professional bartenders I've ever hired, I actually used this group of girls before the new web site went up. We have very high end clientele and they were perfect hosts. Thank you!
They were hot, chicks, and bartenders. What more can you ask for?
Great, professional, punctual, and of course...hot! They brought a lot of life to the party.

business.full_address:
4008 Spruce St
University City
Philadelphia, PA 19104
business.name: University Pinball

reviews.text:
I took my boyfriend here a few months ago for his birthday.
I had a blast. The air hockey table wasn't keeping score correctly, but i was okay with that because it made me look better.
Decent selection of games, and i'm a sucker for useless nickel prizes. 
A fun place to empty out your change jar.
A little arcade usually filled with college and high school and elementary school students, this was the place to waste an afternoon's worth of quarters and have a bit of fun.

Don't be fooled by the name.  There are only two pinball machines here: a pretty good new-Batman-movie-themed one, and a rather lame Family Guy game.  Both have reasonable tilts and reasonable but challenging replay scores.  50 cents per game.  But the rest of the place is filled with the usual video game and skeeball crap, so two stars for false advertising.

They also have air hockey & I saw a sign that Guitar Hero is coming.  My favorite pinball is the Batman game.
My 11 year old loves the place.
You get all kinds of people in there, including neighborhood, but if you've led anything other than a cloistered existence you'll do just fine -- I've made many acquaintances of all ages, races and callings.

What's with people subtly being snide about "neighborhood people"? What exactly is a "neighborhood person"? If you are saying what I think you are saying, I think you might be saying something NOT COOL AT ALL. 

Anyway, this is a fun place if you want to play some Guitar Hero and Skeeball before your dinner reservations while on date night with your hubby. That's what we did, anyway. We won tickets and spent them on Sour Patch Kids and a cool switchblade comb.

this place is fucking amazing. STREET FIGHTER 4 FOR ONLY 50 CENTS!

they have EXTREMELY rare games. I have no idea how they get them. definitely check it out.

They have a variety of games to choose from.  They have a lot of fighting games (like street fighter IV), racing games, guitar hero, air hockey, skee-ball, etc. I had a lot of fun here with my boyfriend on my birthday.  It is a nice, family-friendly kind of place, so there is no drinking here. Just some new and old games that are simply fun. I did not get to play on some machines because some people were hogging, but whatever. Simply fun!

There are many games at University Pinball.  They have: pinballs, fighting games, and most importantly skeet ball.  I love skeet ball.  When I was a child my father would take me to the city and drop me off at the arcades while he went to his weekly meeting.  Most of the games were too big for me but I could play skeet ball with the best of them. I'd spend so many quarters there. I miss my dad.

Cant really knock this place since it's one of the last remaining arcade landmarks in the nation. it's been closed down now for what I think has been a season due to fire damage so I wonder when it'll open. I'd like to see more fighting games next time it's open though. Some snk fighters would be nice. Fighting game enthusiasts are really what keeps that place grounded IMO.

Immaculately clean, possessing games that are definitely hard-to-find and awesome. I am a pinballer, and even thought there is only one machine I will play (out of two), it does have tournament mode and it is in good condition.

OK I had to take one star away because of a bad experience with a birthday party. Unsupervised kids interrupted my game, even tried to steal my bike helmet. If a birthday party rolls in, UP should have someone there to keep some semblance of order. A minor flaw.

This used to be a fighting game haven, and to a point it still is. At one time there was every last 2D Fighter you could think of, but after the fire they cut back and now it's pretty much just Street Fighter IV, Mortal Kombat 9, and Marvel Vs. Capcom 2 & 3. Only one golden-age game in Ms. Pac-Man/Galaga. A few pins incl. Rocky and Bullwinkle, Family Guy, Batman, and a few others. And they seemed to be in decent shape. The rest of the games are newer redemption bullshit with a few basketball hoops. I think they axed the pool tables they used to have in here, not sure though.

The biggest problem is the area its in. Me, I wouldn't feel safe around here at night. The crowd is pretty much all hardcore 2D fighting guys, not your average arcade crowd. And they're pretty serious players, they sit there for quite a while. Not easy to get a turn on a new game.

To sum it up, if you like 2D Fighting games, you'll like it here. But if you're looking for other arcade games, look elsewhere.

If you don't mind getting beat by a girl in pinball you should definitely hit this place up. Actually, you should go regardless. It's sweet. I just wish it was still connected to a laundromat. You know, kill 2 birds...

-PINBALL ALERT!-

Overall I could give here 3 stars, but I'm curving to 4 because when it comes to Timeless old school video arcades in Philadelphia this is the only one that really still exists (and it's kind of sad to say it).

For a fairly small arcade it has a fairly balanced offering of games to enjoy. They have new school games like DDR alongside old school games like Mrs. Pacman, 3D fighters like Soul Caliber alongside quirky Japanese 2D fighters (and plenty of sharks that are waiting to school noobs in VS mode for each), and a couple of shooting and racing games. They even have a pool hall towards the back and and plenty of games where you can win tickets for prizes. But most importantly they have Pinball! they only have newer one's like Family Guy, Pirates Of The Caribbean and The Simpsons (at least since I last checked). But they were all pretty well maintained at least.

While it might be filled with plenty of tweenagers on certain occasions, I'll take an old school spot over somewhere like Dave & Busters any day of the week!

I have occasionally visited University Pinball before and after the remodeling due to the fire or water damage, and although the purchasing power of the tickets won from the games continue to diminish, the rotation of arcade games is fairly decent. Most o

what a strange little place!  They've got a ton of neon and arcade games and pinball obvs.  When I went the crowd was a bit intimidating.  A mix of students and neighborhood locals neither of which I am super fond of if I'm honest.    They did have a crap load of games without going to Dave & Busters though.  (You do have to go into West Philly so I guess it's whatever you dislike the least).

honestly.. you only get 4 stars because I love playing all the old school arcade games.. and I have fond memories of this place.. .the upgrade.. looks exactly like it did before.. oh wait no I think they removed the pool tables. but I can't tell.. bc I typically only play a couple games... all old school baby! I am seriously annoyed by all the younger children in here but maybe that's bc I'm an asshole.. yeah .. that could be it..

business.full_address:
605 W State St
Ithaca, NY 14850
business.name: FedEx Office Print & Ship Center

reviews.text: Perhaps this Kinko's is a little far from campus to be much use to most students, but it has a parking lot, computers for pretty much any simple job you need to get done (at $0.30/min), lots of copiers and Kinko's full range of copy, print and FedEx services. Staff here was attentive, helpful and friendly, and the store looks pretty good inside. I was just visiting town so I was really grateful to find this place to get some much needed business done.
Good Place to get copies made, excellent help, sometimes understaffed.

The staff was polite, but STAY AWAY from the MACHINE BY THE WINDOW that looks out onto State St. It took me 34 MINUTES to print ten 8.5X10 jpg photos from a USB. You had to do it one-by-one (even though they were together in a folder by themselves), and it took 2 minutes for each one to load even though these were normal file size off a Canon PowerShot. I guess it uses a dial-up modem or something?  When I said something about it, the guy there defended the machine. He said I should have had them all on one file....What!?!?! That's called a folder!

business.full_address:
The Collection
732 Filbert St
Shadyside
Pittsburgh, PA 15232
business.name: Paul Michael Design

reviews.text: I recently went to Paul for an engagement ring , and it couldn't have been a more pleasant experience!  He took our ideas and molded them into reality... he made what i was dreading into a fun, creative experience!  He was super flexible as far as making himself available for questions and concerns and the drafting/design process... a  consummate professional and artist!  Paul's design are on the cutting edge of fit, function and aesthetics.  You'll be hard pressed to find an artist and jeweler of the same caliber in this area.. so if your bored with the jewlery box stores that are becoming the norm and looking for a piece  that is "you" get dahn  to Shadyside and see Paul! I highly recommend and ill be coming back!

I recently commissioned three rings from Kerry Cohagen and was very pleased with the outcome.  The rings in question were an engagement and two wedding rings, very important.  Kerry listened to what we liked in terms of design and worked with us to fashion something unique and distinctly 'us'.  He used the idea of a mobius strip to create an interlocking engagement and wedding ring set for my sweetie and the result was elegant, organic, and truely a one of a kind.  My ring was simpler but elegant as well.  

We were so happy that he was willing to melt down old scrap gold and jewelry for us (including a few gold teeth) to form the jewelry as we wanted to minimize our impact on gold mining.  We came away with an amazing product for a really really reasonable price and couldn't be happier.  I would highly recommend these guys for any project.  They are artists of the highest caliber and really listen to the customer.

business.full_address:
42 Northfield Dr E
Waterloo, ON N2L 6A1
business.name: Keg Steakhouse & Bar

reviews.text:
This restaurant is one of a small chain located in Canada, with a few select cities in the US.  I have visited their Waterloo location several times during business trips.  After my first visit, I decided that this restaurant met most of my needs, and from that point forward, I made it the destination place for dinner during each of my trips.   I simply think that this is a great restaurant for dinner.  The atmosphere is conservatively presented.  It has a dark warm appearance.  There is a variety of music that is always being presented in the background. If you do not wish to dine in the dining area, you may dine in a bar area, where there are multiple TV monitors located about. During the winter months there is a fireplace with a warm roaring fire to dine near.  During the summer, a rather large patio area is available for outside dining.

What about the food?  Where do I begin?  The Prime Rib is excellent. Also the steaks are very good.  Even their chicken and salmon is very tasty, especially for a steakhouse. If you like salads, I recommend the Caesar. And finally wonderful well presented desserts are available that include such items as Crème Brulee and a Mini Cherry Cheese Cake.  I highly recommend the Mini Lemon Blueberry desert.

Hostesses and very friendly, and efficient.  It is a restaurant that is memorable and worth returning to multiple times.

Prime Rib and soup is where it's at. Although the missing star is the fact considering the price, it's not exactly up to its worth.

At least the service is good. The environment is a bit dark though.

Well I never thought I would give a keg a 3 star, but here it is.  When I attended, the place was pretty buisy, but the service was still fairly reasonable.  The waitress I had was new and still in training, but she did a great job. I had ordered the NY peppercorn strip with fries.  While waiting for my food, I was treated to a bowl of homemade chips which were delicious, and then their standard bread ( which unfortunately I can't eat ).  The food was a little slow coming out, and when I did get it, my steak was a little over done, and not much peppercorn sauce, as far as flavor it was still good.

I feel that it they still want to keep their higher prices, they can't let the quality slide.  But besides this experience I've always had good luck with the Kegs in the past so I would still recommend trying it.

So. Not. Worth. It.

Really, save your money and have someone fire up the grill. 
K/W needs to nut up on their restaus. They are SEEEERIOSLY lacking.

Mediocre Caesar salad
Tough sirloin

business.full_address:
825 N Central Ave
Ste A
Upland, CA 91786
business.name: AAMCO of Upland

reviews.text:
Another trip back to AAMCO. Every time I go in, it is a pleasant experience. I have never had an issue with work or price. These guys have always been fair price and faster than most with return. I had a blown head gasket, had to get the sent out to be resurfaced, all spark plugs cracked, needed a new water pump, etc... They had the truck back to me within the week. Shaun is a great manager- Very friendly, and even offered to come pick me up if it was raining to bring me to the truck when it was done.
I have moved further away from this location but still keep going back. It's tough to find honest, fair, and quality mechanical work, but this location has it all.

I had been having progressive trouble w/ my manual transmission (clutch). Although I didn't know it at the time, ...luck would have it that when it became undeniably serious enough for me to exit & limp off the fwy; knowing something was majorly wrong --  that I would find myself here at this AAMCO in Upland.

Being vaguely familiar w/ the area, I stopped first to formulate a plan & to browse local car repair places on my phone. This random AAMCO was 1.5 miles from my location; I had never even known of it's existence, & so based mainly on proximity,  I made my way ever-so-slowly w/ my hazards on, creeping along in my poor disabled vehicle. 

I must say that I am so glad that I did, & that it turned out that way, because I had the most positive, smooth, uplifting, & excellent 'car-repair experience' that exceeded my expectations from the minute I walked in, to the time days later when I picked up my car & walked out.  

The center manager Sal Manzo is who I dealt with, & was so polite, courteous, attentive, & so thorough in his listening to my tale of auto woe & subsequent examination of my car. 
I don't know much about car repair at all, but I do know a lot about vibe, & even more about customer service! 
Although my clutch was the culprit & I did have to replace it to the tune of $784.00 -- (comparatively priced, as my research showed) -- I was so thankful that all my concerns were addressed, that the place was absolutely immaculate & customer-friendly. --  There weren't any surprise/hidden costs, it was ready when promised, they arranged pick-up w/ Hertz down the street, & I felt like all my concerns & questions were addressed in such an outstanding way, that it put me at total ease! -- & warranted this stellar review! 
=)

business.full_address:
4200 University Way NE
University District
Seattle, WA 98105
business.name: Professional Copy 'n Print

reviews.text: Came in for passport photos and was helped within ten seconds of opening the front door the Indian guy was taking my picture....service is pretty friendly. Took only two mins to print out my photos and for only 8 or 9 bucks for two....that's relatively cheap compared to other places for passport photos although these pics weren't that great in quality....oh well! still pretty good!

It completely depends who's working. I've had great experiences with a couple of the guys who were really professional, which convinced me that this place is better than the other copy shops on the ave, and so I've always returned here. However, there's a guy who's often there in the morning who's really inattentive and apathetic towards customers, and everything takes ten times longer with him.

My only interaction with this place is picking up lab/course manuals for school. They are professional and no nonsense, and get the job done just as well as the other print shops.

The man who usually works the counter can be terse, but he's just getting

The service at this shop was excellent. My team members and I were at UW for a Business competition, and the people at the store were very helpful as we needed to print out posters, business cards and brochures for the competition. Arthur was especially helpful, reformatting our designs and posters and printing samples so we could see what our designs looked like. I had a very good time with them and would recommend them. Plus, they are open till 10pm, meaning you have a lot of time to go in and get your work completed.

I've learned from coming here several times that it matters who you get help from, one man in particular that works in the morning is completely rude. Get help from the younger woman, she's the best out of all the workers.

Oops, I wrote this review and posted it on the PC&P in San Fran...I meant for it to be for Seattle...

I am glad Kinko's printers were down and waiting for repair. I gave PC&P a shot at printing and the image quality was great. Much better than Kinko's. I worked with Amer and he went out of his way to help.

I had business cards printed there and the whole experience was dreadful. First they had very limited paper options, so I had to get my own and come back. When I was leaving, they asked me to leave my artwork and I did. When I came in a week later with my paper, they had misplaced my artwork, actually asking me to come behind the counter to help look for it - through drawers of disheveled papers and miscellaneous CDs. After about 15 minutes, I left and it wasn't until later on that they called and said that they had found it. When I went back in for the third time to place my order, I asked for MATTE finish on the color and explained that this was crucial. They said this could be done no problem and I even had them write it on the work order.  When I picked up the cards, the printing was semi-gloss. When I showed them they said that it was matte. The cards were obviously not matte and were almost glossy (on matte paper which looks stupid). Then he said there was no way to print without a slight gloss, which is not true (I've had cards printed for 15 years). When I called him on that, he said that he his printer only printed gloss and non-glossy and he would show me that he pushed the non-glossy button on the printer, like that would make me happy. Anyway, I paid and took my cards but am totally unhappy with the finished product and will never go back again. The final product was EXACTLY the same as what I rejected at Office Max a week earlier. I only paid here because this seemed like a owner-run business and no a franchise.

I can't say anything about the copy portion of the business, but there were seemingly happy UW customers in there, so I guess they are good at copying.

Excellent service. Affordable prices. Professional standards (they truly live up to their name). 

Instead of giving your money to big-box cookie cutter chain mega-stores that don't give a flying fork about you, support these guys. In fact the owner Amer has known me for years and always asks how things are going.

For some reason, had always chosen to go to Professional Copy n Print over the other printing places on the ave - probably because the shop is new and it is really clean. I've had pretty decent experiences the last couple of times and was served by a young indian guy. He was helpful. 

A couple of weeks back, when i had a major project due and needed to print a proposal real quick, it took a whole hour before the guy (an indian guy in his 40s or 50s) decided to pay attention to us. Despite telling him countless of times that we were in a hurry since the deadline was approaching, he didn't do anything about it. He refused to communicate with us. Instead, he chose to serve customers who had just came in and whose printing needs were much simpler than ours. We used the computers available to print parts of the proposal and enquired about which printer to select. When done, our pages never printed - all he did was to ask us to try again. He finally decided to take out thumb drive and help us but was still extremely slow. After a good 2 hours, we were out of the shop, with only half of what we intended to print. 

If they want to retain their business, they'd better start brushing up on their customer service because from what i see, they don't care about their customers at all.

I used to go here all the time to print out readings for my class - the space is nice and new, and it's pretty conveniently located near campus.

I stopped going after a bad experience though - the service had always been a little bit lackluster, but this time it was downright bad. I printed my readings off of the computer (which I'd used for all of ten minutes), and brought them over to the counter - the guy there was different from the one I usually interacted with, unfortunately, but he was enough to make me decide I wasn't going back. He charged me for use of the computer (I had never been charged before), so it was a total of about $7 and change (very expensive for the amount of paper I actually used), and then only gave me a few coins as change. When I asked for the other two dollars he need to give me, he moodily grabbed it out of the cash register and tossed it on the table! It gave me the impression that he knew what he was doing and was upset he got caught.

In summary - I think this place will try to cheat you if they can (at a minimum by charging you for things you shouldn't have to be charged for) and their service and amenities are really not worth the risk. Go to Ave Copy instead.

I went here to get a visa photo and told the guy helping me I needed 35 by 45 mm. He took my photo, I waited a few minutes and then he printed a page with my photo on it 8 times. I told him I needed it cut so I actually had 1 photo by itself 35x45. He said I could cut it myself. That was not the kind of service I was looking for so I hesitated. He then went over to a cutting board and started cutting the photos himself. That would have been good except he wasn't cutting them out square and 1 photo I pointed out was not near the 35x45 dimension. I ended up leaving without buying because I didn't want to spend money on a photo that didn't meet the visa requirements and risk having my application rejected. They should offer to cut the visa/passport photos without having to be asked and be able to consistently cut the photo to the proper dimensions. Otherwise this service is not worth $8.

Horrible customer service from the Indian man working behind the counter. 

All I was doing was picking up some materials I needed for a class. I asked for the materials. He grunted, and threw down the materials on the counter. 

After running my credit card, he also just threw that down on the counter. Literally. I know it may seem like a small thing, but it seemed like he literally did not a give a shit, at all. I saw him treating other customers in the same fashion. I wouldn't go back unless I needed to pick up additional materials for a class.

I've been here to have posters and flyers printed for a clubs I am part of at the UW. The service lacks a bit though. Every time I have come in, the man working behind the desk is on the phone which ends with me sitting there trying to wave down his attention to have things printed.

I once went  here an an hour and a half before closing time and the man ignored me for a good 25 minutes talking on the phone. Then when he finally got around to helping me, and realized what I wanted to get done was going to take 45 minutes (150 mini flyers printed in color with 7 cuts) he complained that I was taking too long and was pushing his closing time.

I don't go here anymore. Head down a block next door to the Ram, the service is way nicer and the people a lot more accommodating.

business.full_address:
Harvard Square
14 JFK St
Harvard Square
Cambridge, MA 02138
business.name: Russell House Tavern

reviews.text: So the man and I decided to give this place a go last night. We found a parking spot immediately, which in Harvard Sq is a reason to celebrate. This time we dined downstairs, The place was not too crowded, but we still were seated at a small table for two, wedged in between other parties. Our server was pleasant, I loved the Rose Pinot Noir on tap (a deal at $5) and I remembered to ask for a proper wine glass, and the mojitos were excellent. My husband ordered the 8 oz steak frites, and I the chopped salad.  We waited patiently for our food, amongst the rather mundane conversations of Harvard med students referring to themselves as Dr this and Dr that, in the 3rd person.  Our food finally arrived, my salad was huge and my side of veggies were decent but not sure they were worth the $6 price tag. The disappointment was my husband's steak. Now I am a seasoned Weight Watcher, so I am pretty good at recognizing food weights/amounts. There was NO way my husband's steak was 8 oz, more like 3 oz. It was tiny. The fries were good, but a very small portion. I saw the man sitting next to me ordered a burger with fries, and his plate was over flowing with fries. He must have gotten my poor husband's portion. For $21 he expected more. They also have raised their prices and have neglected to change them on their website. Boo. We will probably be back to have drinks at the bar, but will not be running back for dinner.

Found myself here twice this week, and both times were pretty pleasant.

The first time was a Friday after drinks.  We wanted some late night snacks and was happy to see that Russell House was still serving food.  We were promptly seated downstairs, which was pretty full and lively.  

We ordered a few drinks as well as the assiette de charcuterie as well as the serrano ham.  Both were delicious and just what we needed.

The second time was for Oktoberfest.  They've got a pretty sweet beergarden.  The bratwursts our group got was delicious, although it seemed to be a special offering for the event.

All in all, this place is a fantastic addition to Harvard Sq and a great replacement for that disaster that was Zsquare.  

Pretty good place if you want more sophisticated bar food.  Wish I had known about the $1 oysters, or we would have been all over that!
Good drinks to go along with a great atmosphere. Menu makes it look like they are trying to hard. Downstairs bar is spacious and doesn't get too crowded if you go the right night.

This review should be taken with a grain of salt -- I came here as a group of 4 after running the Cambridge 5K Oktoberfest at Kendall this Sunday.  After an undetermined number of CBC pale ales, I can't promise my recollection is on point.

First off, I should say that our server was very tolerant.  Seeing as we were decked out in running gear (my boyfriend wore a flattering two-piece camouflaged underarmor body suit) and on the better side of tipsy, I thought we might be relegated to a remote corner of the basement.  Luckily we were seated upstairs quickly and given brunch menus as if we were normal human beings.

I ordered the "anti eggs benedict"  - think normal eggs benedict but with garlicky sauteed spinach and sausage.  The poached eggs are coated in panko bread crumbs and fried.  That is the "anti" part I believe.  Unfortunately my server forgot to note this and I got anti-anti-eggs benedict.  Can't complain though, she comped me my beer (Pretty Things Beer & Ale Project) and the fried eggs might have been overly rich.  I enjoyed my meal; I might ask to reduce the salt if possible next time.  This seems to be a trend here.

Anyway, the group as a whole enjoyed their food and (unnecessary) drinks to top off a rainy race morning.  We lingered a bit while one of our group hit on a pretty girl sharing the end of our long table and never felt rushed or unattended.  Expectations exceeded!

This review is relevant to Restaurant Week 8/2011. 

Went there for lunch today. Have been to this restaurant for lunch a few times and for drinks and apps a few times. It's a nice space, good menu and the food is usually very nicely prepared. But something typically goes wrong during my meals there -- either with the food, the service, but it's unfailing.

Today, I went in for a 2-course restaurant week lunch menu. The menu offered two options for each course. Starter (oysters, corn cakes -- both excellent), entree (parpadelle, chicken confit), and dessert (which we skipped). But they didn't have the parpadelle! So the only entree choice was fried chicken. Which was tasty, but not my idea of lunch (three large pieces of thickly fried chicken with a heavy biscuit and slaw). The biscuit was still cold in the middle too and had been microwaved in haste. 

They hadn't run out of the parpadelle, but rather, it wasn't ready yet. This was at 1:15pm, not sure when it was eventually ready. The couple that came in a few minutes later and sat next to us got the same answer. It was really poor. 

Complains from previous visits include underdone fish (still slimy, unintentionally so), a 20+ minute wait after being seated before a drink order was taken, and generally slow or uncommunicative service. They seem to run out of things or not have a dish on the menu fairly frequently (twice before this visit). 

All of which is a real shame, because when they get it right, this place can be delicious, but I have come to associate it with disappointment.

Meh - Not overly impressed with this place.  

I don't drink beer or wine, so that leaves me with cocktails if I am planning on getting a drink. And it seems like they feel the need to avoid anything common at this place, but what is wrong with things like, oh...I don't know... Bacardi or Absolut? Half their alcohol I had never heard of before, so I just grabbed a vodka and coke, usint the house raspberry-infused vodka.  It was nice, nothing to write home about, but hey this is Yelp, not home.

Only a handful of items on the menu called out to me at all, which I never perceive to be a good sign, but it was starting to get late and it was either eat something now, or eat everything later. Cha Cha recommended eating the little now so I don't pay for it later.  So I got the crab cakes, which i admit were pretty good.

Despite their only being about 15 of us seated at the bar, it seemed hard to get the bartenders attention when we needed it

So overall, not a place I would suggest off hand, but not a place I would refuse either.

HOLY.CRABCAKE.SANDWICH. 

Came here for brunch with a couple of friends and had an AWESOME time. They take reservations for brunch, which is such a win in my book. I'm slowly learning that I need to expand my horizons and cross the river more often. The best brunches I've had in recent memory were all in Cambridge, particularly the Harvard Square area. 

The food was awesome, and the head chef is on twitter and actively responds to posts, so if you're looking to engage him, have at it-he's super nice. The service in general was spot-on, and made some great recommendations.
