I had the unfortunate opportunity to live just a few blocks away from here almost 5 years ago during college.  

First of all, this is the only grocery store where you could feel unsafe at.  Drug addicts, gangsters, homeless... whatever... they all frequent this place for various reasons, and I suspect that they weren't in the Safeway to grocery shop.  

One of the reviewers mentioned that this is a great location to go for the 'experience'.  That's definitely true.  I can picture myself, years from now, bringing my kids here and saying, "Kids, this is the worst Safeway in the WHOLE WORLD!  Cool huh?" 

For big grocery runs, we'd drive down to University Village Safeway/QFC to shop.  If you needed some meat, or vegetables, or fruit, it was just better to go elsewhere... more often than not, you won't find what you need at the Safeway on Brooklyn.

All Safeways are NOT created equal.

As far as grocery stores go, this one's really pretty bad. They have most of what a Safeway should, but the selection is subpar and the store is tiny. Perhaps most notable is the lack of a bakery and a limited selection of deli and prepared food choices. It's pretty obvious this store caters to college students, and the selection and products seem to reflect that pretty well. Even as a student, I'm come across situations where they didn't have something I needed and was forced to go elsewhere, and I'm not exactly cooking gourmet meals.

The location is convenient for UW students, but Brooklyn seems to be a bit sketchy at night and I would not want to walk here alone after dark.

As the other reviewers mentioned, there is a guy that sells Real Change outside the doors, but he's really not that bad and always wishes passers by a "Good Day Sir" or "Good Day Ma'am." Really an artifact of the neighborhood more than having anything to do with the store.
Surprise surprise, 1/29/10, Safeway actually remodeled this store!  self-serve check out lines, bigger produce department. wow

It's easy for everyone to be down on this Safeway because...well, it isn't very nice.  I even think it's a bit ironic that it has the word "safe" in the name, since this store seems anything but; very sketchy location both inside and out.  Icing: if you go there after 9pm, you'll probably be in line for at least 30min.  They restock so seldomly that I get a mental picture of some manager passed out in his office with a needle in his arm.  Its only saving grace, to me, is that it is within crawling distance of some people (ahem) and open 24 hours.  But, if you don't mind a bus/car ride or a decent walk, the QFC at the U-Village doesn't make you want to bathe in hand sanitizer like this Safeway does.
Of all the grocery stores I've been to in my life, this is the only one where being shived seemed more likely inside the store than outside of it.

this is absolutely the worst safeway ever existed.  there is this chain smoking attendant person with badge saying 'kathy', no teeth, is very offensive and authoritarian everytime go there.  there will be no checker available and she will be along side having extended smoke break.

another offensive individual by badge jae possibly moslem is always screaming at top of his lungs that everyone is required to donate and not a dollar or two, he screams aloud ten and twenty dollar increments.  those donations by definition are voluntary, why does he have to make a public spectacle of himself so much? 

also if you are trying to get something done at customer service dont bother, another person with badge 'heather,' extremely rude takes literally hours to do the simplest task, dont even try to get refund on stale merchandise.   by time you finally get service your veggies will be considerably more stale and of course after making you wait so long, she will turn you down.

this disgusting store doesnt rate a single star, isnt there a zero star category?

EVERYBODY in the U-district knows which safeway is "the sh*tty safeway" it's the one you go to when you're too lazy to go to "the clean safeway" 

I would NEVER buy meat there

the line is always crazy

someone should do everybody a big favor and just blow up that safeway and jack in the box  some night...
The deli made me a sandwich with stale bread. When i went back for a new sandwhich the deli staff was very rude. Poor customer service at this location.

I wholeheartedly agree with the previous reviewer who said that they felt more likely to get shivved inside the store than out. 

...but I still come here and like it a lot. If you read my other reviews, you'll see that I frequent places that are creepy and and also frequented by vagrants, hobos, potential zombies, etc. Something in me is just attracted to extreme sketchiness. This Safeway does not disappoint, at least in that regard. (Their selection is supremely disappointing, but whatever - like I shop with a list anyway.)

I will not be going back to this Safeway...and I should have checked Yelp for this too.  I mean, I assumed that going to a grocery store would be fine but I guess it's gotten to the point where I need Yelp to warn me about stuff like this...and that's just sad...

Pulling up to this Safeway, I not only notice that the parking lot is ridiculously small and the stalls for the cars are all pointed at a very bizarre angle but more importantly - there is a contingency of degenerates taking up 3 - 4 parking spots in the corner (sitting down - don't think for a second that they have vehicles) and several more creepy characters emerge from the (not-so)Safeway triumphantly showing off their spoils as they take off their shirts and begin to chow down in the parking lot.  What is wrong with this picture?

I'm a larger guy and I certainly know how to handle myself...but this scene strikes me as rather problematic and makes me a little uncomfortable, to say the least.  I guess the (unarmed) security guard inside the store (posted at the door) also felt a little uneasy about handling the situation too, as it was clear he had no intention of going outside.

I shopped here once - in the evening.  I won't make that mistake again.  If I go back, it will be in an emergency and I won't go back at night.  I agree with previous postings...easily the worst Safeway in the United States.  I used to shop at the one in Tempe, Arizona and it was great...what's going on Safeway?

Not all Safeways are the same, contrary to what some people may say.  Some Safeways are huge and meant for regular people who have to eat a moderately healthy diet in order to not get sick and have a wide selection of products.  This Safeway is the opposite of all that.  This Safeway is designed for late teen/early twentysomething college students who can eat crap all day and feel fine.  There's a reason they call this the Beer & Pizza Safeway.

I can spend a half hour roaming the aisles here and come up with no dinner inspiration.  If you have a family to feed, or if you yourself insist on eating healthy, it's worth it to go out of your way to Roosevelt Safeway or University Village QFC.

Ah, this reminds me of my old days shopping at the various crappy Safeways in DC...the Soviet Safeway and the Shootout Safeway. At least there are enough carts at this Safeway - the Shootout Safeway only had about 5 carts in the entire store, so you would actually have to fight over them when they became available. 

It's nice to see that the fine Safeway tradition of saying "screw you" to people who live in cities is not confined to our nation's capitol.

Safeway practically gets away with murder for being the only traditional grocery store in the heart (liver?) of the U-District.

To be fair, Safeway is always there for me in a pinch. Open late and conveniently located, I'm a bit embarrassed by the low score considering all the times it's bailed me out when in need of a specific ingredient or beverage.

But terrible produce, no bakery, and a barely-existent seafood section make me go the extra distance to Trader Joe's, QFC or Whole Foods fairly often. However, if you are going to the store for "only one or two things (and when aren't you?)," and/or late at night, then Safeway Will Suffice.

I go into this Safeway store and I brought my own bags. The employee bagging my groceries looked at my bag, and started bitching to his co-worker that I had the nerve to bring a bag from Trader Joe's into THEIR store.

Really? Does a job as a Safeway bagger pay SO much that you must voice such strong store loyalty, or are you just too thick to understand never to badmouth customers that ultimately pay your salary?

I wasn't expecting much from this tiny U District store, just a fast run in for chips  and dips and soda that Trader Joe's does not carry. But Christ...

Lots of college kids frequent here.
Okay selection.

But I gotta tell you, this Safeway wouldn't have a lasting impression on me if the "Real Change" man wasn't in the front, advertising.

Yeah, most aesthetic things and environmental factors surrounding this store suck, as is adequately covered in reviews

But this is not my biggest problem. Does anyone realize how much stuff costs here?? You can recognize their absurd markup when stuff goes on sale like 92% off.

You'd probably spend less grocery shopping at Pike Place Market. Safeway has to have the worst value-per-dollar of any grocery store I am aware of (with the possible exception of QFC, which costs more but is owned by the same conglomerate - ie same suppliers different packaging).

Its not like there aren't other stores nearby. Any student whose little rational economic man allows them to shop here should not be allowed to graduate.

As others have said, this store proves that not all Safeways are created equal. There's no meat counter, the selection is pretty poor, and there is almost always a line to check out. I will say things improved a little when they remodeled and added the self checkout lane, but I've still had to go to another store on multiple occasions after I couldn't find what I needed here.

If you live in the U-District you'll probably find yourself trying to avoid this Safeway, but the location definitely comes in handy if you just need to swing by and grab something.

anyone who has spent at least 10 minutes in the u district has surely stepped into this safeway to buy booze- it's a fact.  and it's a horrible scary place.  there are homeless people, drug dealers, and jack-in -the-box-eaters dirtying up what is already a filthy college hellhole.  i spent about 5 years in that neighborhood, to varying degrees, and feel lucky for the fact that i was never stabbed, robbed, or car jacked at the brooklyn safeway.  once i had a car, i was all over the roosevelt safeway; same low prices, but no stench of urine.

but in defense of the u district safeway, it does provide a huge selection of beer and wine- consumption of which is a given if you plan on spending the night in this neighborhood.  what they lack in comfort, cleanliness, and order, they almost make up for with cheap beer prices.  approach this place like a big convenience store- not a grocery store.  and try to avoid it at night, but that's almost impossible.

and don't buy food here.

Totally sketchy and sparse.

But this kid made it awesome:

"Attention Safeway shoppers. You know when it's 2 AM... and you just wanna go home? 

(Pause) 

...Yeah."

This store needs a remodel inside and out. It's still the early 90's store, which the others in the area stuck with this are Factoria-area shoppers at Factoria Mall (who have a nearby QFC) and poor Othello area shoppers (who have no other grocers, only more Safeways ) to choose from.

Go up the street to Roosevelt, down the road to U. Village or somewhere else that has a renovated "lifestyle" format Safeway. Your experience will be 100x better.

Worst Safeway ever! This statement is backed by the fact that they had to have security guards posted at the entrance every Friday and Saturday night. My car got keyed in the parking lot and that was sooooo not cool. It is also the smallest Safeway known to man.

...and this must be why I shopped there for two years.

Product is decent. More expensive and I'd rather go to Whole Foods (similar price level but way better food), Trader Joe's or Fred Meyer in Ballard. But it's decent and convenient and the hours are good. 

However the reason for two stars is the service. There are quite a few good people who work here and are nice and pretty regular but there are some real rude ones. Many times I've been tempted to call in and make a complaint (to corporate of course because apparently some of the people in charge could give less of a shit than the certain buttholes that work here). 

Bottom line: If you have other options, go there. But if this Safeway just works better at the time, then sure.

I was excited to have a Safeway within walking distance of my apartment. It didn't initially strike me as being one of their better stores, but after several months and shopping at their other locations, I've concluded that this place isn't much more than a glorified convenience store.

The place is very small and crowded. Their selection is quite limited -- definitely targeted to the college/dorm demographic. You'll find the essentials here, and generally the sales are on par with their other stores, but if you're looking for something specific, you'll often be disappointed.

The produce isn't very fresh....I picked up a package of raspberries once that was completely covered with mold. Ick. No fresh-baked bread to speak of. Don't bother with the "deli."

It should be noted that the employees are very nice and helpful here. Too bad they're stuck in Safeway's black sheep.

If you're in a pinch for toilet paper, milk, juice and frozen pot-pies, this place will suit you fine. For big shopping, go to the Safeway by U-village.
Great place to buy groceries from. I like those people always ready to help especially Ashley... She is so nice....

I really love Safeways in general, but this one is just lacking in so much.

It is so tiny and so cramped everywhere, I'm constantly running into people when I shop and I find myself shimmying around. They only have a deli section, but I'm not sure how good it is. They get meat/fish and bakery goods delivered, but the selection is minimal. This is a very bare-bones type of grocery store, I only come here for the very staples (milk, eggs, cheese, boxed dinners), but they don't even carry all cupcake flavors and some normal boxed dinners aren't available. 

Yea the crowd can be sketchy outside, but I have never once been harrassed or begged by them, and I find they keep to themselves. And also, that area of the Udistrict is sketchy in general, so I don't know what some people are expecting. 

Overall this one will get the job done in a pinch, but if you need anything other than generic food items, go to the QFC or Safeway in Uvill or to the Trader Joe's just a couple blocks away.

This is the worst Safeway I have ever been to. The only reason why I shop here is because it is the closest grocery store to my apartment and I do not have a car to get to a non-ghetto store. 

The store is a bit better now that they remodeled it and the employees have always been nice to me, but that still does not make up for what this Safeway lacks - food (which makes absolutely no sense for a grocery store). On multiple occasions, I just wanted to pick up a package of a couple chicken breasts, but they never have that. What grocery store does not have chicken?! That is one of the most simple things a grocery store sells! They are usually out of the things that I need or just never carried them in the first place.  

I also do not like that, being in the sketchiest area in town, you have to deal with the sketchiest ave rats. I must say I love the Real Change man that sits out front (Real Change! Real Change! Have a good day sir! Have a good day madam!); however, sometimes I would just like to do my shopping in peace without being hit up for money or jeered at. Lately, there have been a lot of young people sitting outside that I am pretty sure have been doing meth because they have sores all over their faces, their teeth are rotting, and they don't seem to be all there. If one of them asked me for food, I would gladly go into the store and buy them a sandwich or something, but they always just ask for money or junk food, which I know will not help them. I don't want to sound insensitive (I am a Psychology major that has studied homelessness and understand that it is not as simple as some people think it is), but the Safeway store should really try to prevent loitering around their store and direct the homeless kids to the youth shelter that is a couple blocks away.

i never really liked this location much. probably because the parking lot had too many psychos and weirdos that bugged my friends and i. another reason was that the lines become insanely long. from their beauty/body care section to their frozen foods aisle- everything is unorganized and placed in strange areas. the produce section is small and irritating, there's never anyone in the bakery or hot foods section in the evening and all the cashiers have a big stick up their arse. i loathe Safeway!

First things first: yes, this Safeway is total bullshit compared to the other Safeways. The selection isn't as great, and you might have trouble finding items you're used to. And yeah there are people hanging out front panhandling, but you find that almost in front of every store - not much they can do since it's public property. No fish selection to speak of, but that's fine since there's a seafood market a block down.

But seriously - for affordable staples and a solid produce department, you really can't complain too much about this store. Yes, sometimes it strikes me as an extra large convenience store, but the staff is generally friendly, with the Manager Jai being particularly proactive and helpful. Plus - it's close to the University, and I hate to say it but students aren't particularly known for meal preparation. So of course this Safeway has more grab-n-go and convenience foods: they know their market.

There's a Trader Joe's a few blocks away if you simply MUST have a supremely attractive and homogenous shopping experience and are willing to pay for such privilege.

Classic situation: one or two checkout lines open, 10+ people in each line, manager looks on cluelessly about why everyone is impatient and frustrated.  (Or rather, manager is happy that he's keeping payroll low, knowing that people in the UD need a place to shop after 9 PM -- when TJs closes.)

Produce and fish/meat at this Safeway seems to be older/less fresh than other Safeways/QFCs.

I shopped here for three years when I lived in the U-District, and this place gained one star over that period -- when they remodeled.

Unfortunately, while their signage may meet corporate policy now, the cashiers are still jaded they've been working most of their life there, the stock is inconsistent, and you're still hassled to buy Real Change or just plain give money to a homeless druggie every time you walk both in AND out of the store. Also, just *try* buying packaged meat here that isn't chicken or beef.

Unfortunately, it's the only grocery store on the "poor" (read: not u-village) side of the university district. So if you don't have a car and/or aren't willing to walk a huge hill with bags upon bags of groceries, this is what you're stuck with.

There's a reason locals call this one the Ghettoway.

Not the cleanest place I've ever been. 
My wallet was pick pocketed here once. 
They tend to be out of decent produce. 
Lines can be kind of crazy on weekend nights with all of the college kids buying beer.
There is security, but he does nothing to get rid of loitering crazies outside.
Once i was chased and yelled at by a couple drunk homeless guys and had to drop a box of soda to get away. 
It is RIGHT next to my house and I still go to the one up Roosevelt because it is so much better.

Safeway usually has better prices than QFC and it is open until at least midnight, which is nice.

Deli section: Rude staff. Recently I wanted to order a breakfast sandwich but there was no staff at that section. It was around 9am when I was there. I had to walk over to the other side of the deli section and asked a middle-aged lady with dark hair, "is anyone making breakfast sandwiches over there now?" She looked at me annoyed and said in a threatening voice, "OF COURSE THERE IS..." And then she went on and on mumbling for like 30 seconds. I was going to ask her, "wait, what?" and before I was able to do that, she said, "What kind do you want?" I was so confused the whole time. I wish I was quick enough to record her or at least her threatening voice as a proof. I really do not understand why she had to respond that way. And by threatening voice, I am not even kidding. I have received bad service before and seen staff having a bad day or something, but never ever have I seen anyone threatening me for wanting to make a simple purchase. 

Another time, I ordered some Asian dishes (chow mian and stir fried dishes) from the deli section and OMG they are so tasteless. I didn't know anything could taste worse than Panda Express. But Safeway wins on this one.

Selection: They do carry a good but basic selection of everything. That means, if there is a particular flavor or brand you are looking for, you will have to go to another Safeway.

They do have two parking lots on each side of the store, which is nice.

I am not sure if I will come back to this store as often. I will probably only stop by for a quick snack or something in the future.

I actually finally complained after a checker didn't use a cupon that was on an item I bought, he said since I didn't present it to him he didn't ring it up with it.  The customer service person said the manager was busy, I told him he just said sorry, didn't ask my name or number for her to get back to me.  I then felt that he wouldn't bother to tell the manager so I wrote them a note, the manager never responded to my complaint and so I did go to a different safeway.  To all you yelp people I got much better treatment by staff at the safeway at rosovelt location so if you want one close by go to that one.  Its bigger, cleaner, friendlier staff and I think I'll go there when I go instead of the other one to Safeway.  Just really sad the service at this store, don't waist your money and shop somewhere else.

This place reminds me of my urban, poor NYC roots. It somehow manages to feel shittier than the C-Town where I grew up in NYC; and as a previous reviewer mentioned there is an air of "you gonna get stabbed" in it, though it is mostly neutralized by the fact that I'm in Seattle and every single person is SO FREAKING NICE at the Safeway. Including the dude who sells Real Change outside. This is the only reason it gets two stars.

But when you think about it this place is SO FREAKIN OVERPRICED real poor people who live in the ghetto wouldn't even loiter there, much less shop there.

As others have said this is one of the worst Safeways I've been in. Probably not the worst (and believe me I've been in over 100 in the past 6 years) but bottom 5%.The older, overweight, late-night cashier is rude as he11 and I sometimes forget that I'm the customer and he's the employee when I go through his line. I only see him when the self-service kiosks are closed. He reminds me of the 'Soup Nazi' from Seinfeld except he's selling groceries so we just call him the 'Grocery Nazi'.

In the daytime there's usually the guy out front saying 'Spare a 'lil change" both when you enter and then again when you exit. I've seen him pull out a wad of cash on more than one occasion while I was scraping by to not starve. At night it's usually street kids hustling for change. If you see a girl, she may very well be spare changing for her boyfriend like a hooker/pimp relationship.

If you need cookware, buy it at Goodwill or Target or Value Village and save $25 on a pot or frying pan--save $50 if you need both. I've waited in line 20 minutes for a 6-pack and still had so many people in front of me I just had to not make the purchase.

Two stars and not one because this store is open until 2am. It's somewhat conveniently located and they do have to deal with a lot of lowlifes.

business.full_address:
680 Stanford Shopping Court
Palo Alto, CA 94304
business.name: Brookstone Company

reviews.text: Great customer service associates trying to sell mediocre products at outrageous prices. This Brookstone is no exception. Still. It's a great place to sit down for a massage after a long day of shopping.
Friend bought a gift here that came defective. Had a gift reciept and tried to return it and the guy wouldnt do it because it was opened. So BUYER BEWARE.
I really don't get these stores that have the touristy mall electronics. Who buys this stuff?

On Black Friday, I went in and bought several Full/Queen Blankets for Christmas presents.  The transaction was complex as I had a discount code, gift card, gift receipts, shipping for two of the six items, etc. . . . However, the store manager processing this transaction was extremely helpful, patient, and kind.... which was much appreciated.  Definately five stars!!  Thank you.

Am trying to get someone - anyone! - at Brookstone Corporate to listen to me about the horrid customer service I rec'd at the Stanford store by the store manager and her minions but to date, after a phone call and an email message, no response.  Agree wit

What a nightmare!!!!  I bought my husband a laptop pillow desktop for Christmas.  My husband said he would never use it and to return it.  I went to the store today to return the item with the receipt in hand.  The man behind the counter asked me what was

I wish I could have give this place a fat zero.  Went here last weekend with my kids, niece, nephew and husband to look for a docking station for my iTouch and ended up with a bag of crap and two bags of rudeness.   I understand that they don't let kids under 18 try their massage chairs but you don't have to be a snappy crocodile about it.  It took everything in my power not to tell this lady off.  We walk in and no greeting what so ever and one of the sales associates was a total snot.  I love shopping at this mall because of the customer service but this place takes the cake for crappy service.  .

So as we were walking out, I say let's go because nobody has greeted us.  The sales associate that was mean to my niece and nephew sighed loudly and said "ok".  Unbelievable!  I won't ever be buying anything from here...EVER!  

Now I don't want anyone to lose their job (thats why I didn't mention any names here) but seriously, after reading a few reviews, it seems like failing customer service seems to be an issue.  Maybe some training in greeting and putting a smile on your face would work.  You may not have to mean it, but sheesh...fake it for a paycheck.

RUDE RUDE RUDE!!!!!!

I bought 2 products and neither of them worked. The heart rate monitor ring ( I know, duh, I should have known better ) doesn't work at high heart rates, just shuts down...I had to call customer service who told the store to refund me...as the store tried to say it was a non-refundable "personal care item"...read your receipts. Then , I bought a "Rise &Shine "alarm clock. Neither I nor a friend nor a sales clerk could get 2 of theses clocks to alarm..that didn't stop the manager from insulting me by saying he was sorry it was too complicated for me (I'm a critical care RN ). Since he didn't know how it worked, a better reply would have been to try it himself. The stiff plastic buttons would likely break for the zillion times they have to be hit. I told the 800 customer service that there are  a number of customer service issues posted for this store...I gave 2 stars instead of one, because the sales CLERK totally got it...

I dedicate this review to the Brookstone small chair massager. Actually, I definitely would not be writing a Brookstone review if it were not for that chair massager...

I have recently started to go to fairly intense, time-consuming, expensive physical therapy for annoying back pain. While I hope that the PT will help, I am almost positive that the $35-$40 chair massager will help! I set it up on the floor (nothing scandalous and Sex-in-the-City style though, sorry!) and let it work out some of the major knots in my back. It's amazing! Incredibly powerful and soothing at the same time!

You can buy a lot of stuff you don't need at Brookstone, but, this massager, you definitely kneed (stupid pun intended...)!

I will never shop at this place ever again. You can thank Pete for that. The name tag says Store Manager, but I think it should say Sales Inhibitor. 

You'd expect above average customer service of stores in Stanford Shopping Center because if its usual clientele, but Brookstone sure did their part to meet the low end of the bell curve. 

Was trying to return someting bought online because it wasn't exactly what we thought it was. Went in on a nice Sunday afternoon, instead of receiving the usual no question asked return procedure most stores have in Stanford, we were treated to a lecture of not knowing what we are doing and we should do more research or call to ask before we buy......... repeatedly. Then Pete made the process as long as possible, to what I preceive as "teaching us a lesson" because they "don't get credit for the sale". 

Ok Pete, the Sales Inhibitor. Since Brookstone products are so "complicated" I better stay away all together! I really wish I kept receipts for all the Brookstone products I bought so you can spend all days processing my returns. As far as your concerned, I'm a Brookstone customer. Either tell me I can't return it or get it done..... with courtesy that I deserve when I buy products with at least 50%+ mark up!!

YELPERS UNITE! Boycott Brookstone!!!...... well just Pete if nothing else

thank you brookstone man for helping us with our picture scavenger hunt! we needed a picture of a stranger giving our team a message, and you helped us. we needed to find hammocks, brookstone has them. you let us help shine your shoe. you even told us  to go mcdonalds to find a girl with braces. brookstone man, youre awesome!

Shopping can be oh so tiring....might as well pause to enjoy some free massage action.  At Stanford you have 2 choices: Brookstone or Sharper Image.  Brookstone was our pick because I wanted to experience that weird vibrating plate I was too shy to try at

Wow. Deserving of 0 star. It's obvious the management here had been scraped from the bottom of the barrel. Where do they find these people?!? Needless to say, I will NEVER purchase anything from this company ever again. 

Came here to return an item purch

The pen massager from Brookstone isn't fooling anyone.

Really?  

A pin point 1/4 inch head on a massager that fits discreetly into a purse?

I am sure this thing is worthless for soothing sore muscles but for "stress" relief, it looks like it gets the job done.  

Much like Jergens, this product has multiple uses.

I do like Brookstone though.  

The problem is, I walk in, browse for 25 minutes, and, outside of Valentine's shopping week, I walk out empty handed.  

Adianoeta.

A friend purchased a comforter for us in Full and we needed King, so I brought back the comforter to this store yesterday.  The store manager asked for receipt and I told him I didn't have one, but all I wanted was to exchange and pay for the upgrade.  He told me Brookstone is sold in other places and without receipt, no exchange.  I didn't understand this since it was a brand new item never out of the bag with Brookstone tags, and all I wanted was to exchange, not a refund.  Obviously the store manager is  either not trained to use his brain and common sense, or the company policy is to make sure they don't think.  What a terrible service and they lost a customer.

So my husband and I decided to jot down to Stanford Shopping Center after going to the Menlo Park Art Festival. We walked around and decided to visit Brookstone, a young gentleman was playing around with an RC helicopter and my husband was hooked, so we decided to buy the two for $50.  We got home and put the batteries into the helicopters and tried relentlessly to get the helicopter to lift off the ground, but couldn't so my husband decided it was best to return the item.

We end up going tonight to return the product and was told, "the item is not returnable," Our reaction.. "What?" The sales person states, "We can't resell it," we told him, "Well it isn't something that should be sold as the item is broken and can not be used anyways."  He then shows us the policy and we ask, "Where does it state on the receipt that it is not returnable?" He could not show us exactly and I was able to read that "Some Items can not be returned." So we moaned and groan about the policy and the fact that we could not see information that the item is returnable.

The gentleman excuses himself after my husband asked for their corporate office number. He leaves the floor for a good 3 minutes during that time I'm looking over the policy to see where exactly it states it is not returnable.  After a while he comes out and says, "I called my manager, and she doesn't want to give you corporate's number, and I'm just doing my job but I'll just return your money." 

Money back in our pockets.

This evening we decided to call Brookstone's Customer Service line and ask about the return policy and ask if this was an item that is a returnable item and why the store would say it wasn't.  Well the customer service stated, "Yes it is returnable, and one of the reasons why the store could have said it was not returnable is cause they didn't want to take the hit." So my husband replies back, "What their sales are more important than the customer's satisfaction.  The person on the other line went quiet, but in a way stated, 'yep' that is about it. 

Moral of the story, Brookstone at the Stanford Shopping Center is not a place to go to for your electronic gizmos. Think we will hang out with the kiosks at the Great Mall or the Valley Fair for the helicopter! 

We are definitely never visiting Brookstone again!

business.full_address:
50 Exchange Terrace
DownCity
Providence, RI 02903
business.name: RiRa: The Irish Pub & Restaurant

reviews.text: I'm torn. Its a nice big space which is great, bartenders are always friendly, but there is a cover and you never know what kind of live music you'll get. Crowd is iffy so if you're there with a lot of friends it could be a good time but if you're there just with a friend or two - prepare for some amazing people watching.

Hey we had a few great times here hanging out with friends and listening to the live music. I heard they have slamming food but never got a chance to eat here. You usually have to pay for parking in the lot which sucks but it's worth the good time. 

Drinks are plentiful and the bar tenders are true Irish-men, they are generous on the hard stuff...trust me.
Below average food for a pub and high prices for the wine served. I won't be back.

What do I know about Irish culture? Nothing, that's what. Thus, I hardly feel qualified to judge Ri Ra, and readers may want to look elsewhere for a more informed opinion. I went on a Sunday night with a regular and found that I liked the soda bread, the bangers and mash, the live Irish music and dancers, the Guinness, the kind staff, and the pictures of James Joyce scattered about. I did not like the dessert selection (I don't understand why traditional desserts are not offered), the Disney-esque simulation of an old-fashioned pub, and the soccer (excuse me, football) game on TV. Would I come back, though? Yes I said yes I will yes.

Excellent Guinness BBG burger and superb onion rings.  Decor was okay.  I was disappointed that there was a cover band on a Sat. night.  Some good Irish would have been better for my nickel.  Kind of tucked away place.  This Ri Ra is mostly imported from County Mayo.  There's a pretty old, gold harp in a display case.  How about some O'Carolan to go with it???  Planxty Burke.  Will have to try it on a Sunday night in the future.
Can't wait until they are in Vegas! Good beer. Good Chips. Great service.

We stopped in for a restaurant week dinner.  way too much food oye!  So first of all restaurant week is amazing 3 course dinner+ a beer for less than $30! Insane...  

My hubs got the mussels for an app, which unfortunately I don't like mussels and can not review but he really enjoyed them. I got the warm goat cheese dip, which was delicious. 

For dinner he had the shrimp and steak which he also enjoyed but felt his steak was slightly over-cooked.  I had the scallops which were interesting, they were spicy and zesty and covered in blue cheese and bacon.  Oh my! I have never had scallops prepared in this manner and I think they might be on to something. 

I was too stuffed to even have my dessert so I ordered the Irish Soda Bread pudding to go, what a nice treat that was the following night! 

Our server was funny and cheerful and made our evening even better.

When working in Providence I often end up at Ri-Ra after a long evening of walking around downtown. Good food, decent mix of music, Smithwicks on tap and friendly staff people. It can get crowded earlier on, but I usually get there at 10pm or so when things are more relaxed. The crowd seems to vary with business people early on, to local and college residents later in the evening.

So I have a friend that went for drinks and thought they were expensive, but I went for just food and thought it was average priced. This place is pretty awesome considering its location. It's not snooty and the food is pretty delicious, especially the pretzel and sweet potato tots!! I will most likely come back here.

We came here on a Sunday during our stay in Providence, and were pleasantly surprised by the half off burgers! I got the smokey burger and he got the one with 4 different cheeses - they were great! Fries were nothing to write home about, but a bit sad we didn't try the sweet po-tator tots. Great beer selection and Sunday night karaoke!

Super nice staff and great food. I wish they'd bring back some of the Irish favorites like boxty. The menu was on the smallish side and well thought out. Everthing came to the table perfectly done. Great place for friends and lunch and burger fare. I'm going to add this one to my rotating Saturday lunch spots. I've heard they run some great specials too.

Since it was one of the only places open for lunch on Saturday during Winter Restaurant weeks, I was a little hesitant because I'd only been here for Guinness but I was pleasantly surprised.  

3 large courses for $13 was a huge bargain, and all of the food we had was great: potato leek soup/potato pancakes, corned beef sandwich/burger w/ candian bacon and baileys mouse/apple tart.  Yes all this for $26..for two.

Not sure what if any of this you can get on their regular menu, but I wouldn't hesitate to get a sandwich or burger to accompany my Guinness next time I'm here.

Usually.... I invest a real effort to make my reviews interesting/humorous to trick you into continued reading. No sarcasm, no hyperbole this time, but a true 1:1 scale outpouring of emotion.

This...place...sucks+bites+blows+et cetera. I will NEVER come

Here's the thing - for just sitting at the bar, it's an alright spot, the decor in the bar-proper is wonderful and the Sunday session can be really good, but the priiiices. My goodness. If you knocked a dollar, dollar fifty off everything on the menu, I would go here regularly - as it stands, I literally cannot stomach getting a beer and a burger and having to drop 18-20 dollars after a well-earned tip; the barstaff is all great. 

It also always seems empty - which might be because one pays foodie prices for really drab fare. I find myself there because of the session every once and awhile, but never any other time and I spend money grudgingly.

A lot of crappy reviews for this place. May the lords of the emerald isle smite you with potato wedged swords!

This place is fantastic. I walk in and I hear a fiddly diddy playing over the speakers. The whole atmosphere is tall dark wooded ancient irish forest. I felt like I was on a leprechaun slave ship sailing across the seas of famine on a rainbow of crying irish eyes.

No I'm not tripping. But seriously, place looked cool. The music that caught my interest led me around the corner to find a group (This is true btw) of 8 people with fiddles legit playing irish music. Age range from 10-65 in the group. They were amazing! I don't know what the hell was going on but the ambiance was great!

Move into the next room and find an open bar and plenty of seating for the large group I'm with. We order our beverages from a nice woman with an irish lilt in her voice.

The reason this place gets 5 stars instead of 4 is (everything after this sentence is alleged and may or may not of happened, feel free to message me if you're the manager to edit it out)
They went above and beyond! It was a Sunday night, and eventually our group of 12 dwindled to 3. We realized we had no beer for the hotel, every place we went stopped serving growlers after 6pm. Shmoozed a bit with the staff and was able to come out with a trashbag of beers (at the higher price of course around 3 bucks a can) but desperate times call for desperate measures! And so accommodating of them to help me out on my friends birthday.

I bet if I needed someone killed I could come here and get the full service for that too!

Thank you Providence Yelpers for suggesting RiRa for a group event I ran tonight. We had over 100 people here and the food and service were fabulous. We ordered platters of Banger Bites, BBQ Meatballs, Chicken wings, chicken skewers, shepards pie, and a fruit.cheese platter and a Crudite platter. The food was top notch. The restaurant was a dream to deal with, and everything ran smooth as glass. Dozens of people came up to me and complimented us on how well run the event was. Ri Ra did a fabulous job and I am very grateful to them for a wonderfully succesful evening !!
Nice spot near the basin, walking distance to the mall and to most of central Providence. Good place to grab a few beers.

Cool bar and the live bands on the weekends are pretty good.  It can get really crowded, so get there early.  The food is not that great, so I don't recommend eating there.  I had the Crab Cake Caesar Salad a couple years back....ehh not that good.  Maybe they have changed their menu recently, so look elsewhere for a review on thei food.
This is a pretty good bar.. there's a live band usually on the weekends.. the only drawback is that this place gets so unnbelievably crowded which just makes it annoying!

I have eaten here a few times for dinner during all seasons, and I recommend visiting during the summer.

They have an outdoor patio, and suring the summer it is fantastic. It is not on a main street, so it is relatively quiet. They also have great summer specials.

During the fall/winter, they don't have any specials, but the normal food is still good. The atmosphere is great, and the servers are always friendly and attentive. We went during the Xmas season, and there was a big office party in the main dining area. Our host told us about the party, and asked if we wanted to be seated somewhere else. It's that little extra effort that keeps us coming back.

If they had non-summer specials year-round, I would definately give Ri Ra 5 stars.

I was here for a hosted party, and it was pretty awesome. (Although, I won't lie, it was weird when the general public were being let back in; it brings a weird crowd).

Their fish and chips were amazing. Maybe I was starving, maybe the chips were actually pieces of potato shaped into chip like things. The batter wasn't anything to rave on about, but did I mention that the fish was real. And it was real tartare sauce! Amaze.

I've always been a fan of a good Irish pub.  Reminds me of Ireland. lots of wood and pints! I've been to Ri Ra's a handful of times and have always enjoyed myself.   Love the live music-especially Emergency Broadcast System!  it's a good set up. stage ,dance area and some tables.  We have only had appetizers here, and they were good.  We usually just go for the music and cocktails.  Love the area of Providence-especially during Waterfires.  Hint-hit Ri Ra's first then head over to the view the Water fires after most of the crowds are gone .Much more beautiful and peaceful at midnight!   I'm counting down to the spring! :-)

As always,a 3 from me means I will go back, but it was not fantastic.

    I like the area at the former train station complex, where Luxe Burger, Union Station BrewHouse, Ardeo and others are.  We have never been to the WaterFire which is done nearby, I bet the area is even more fun then.

    The beer selection is pretty good.  I do enjoy a nice Smithwick's, and I tried a new ( for me ) draft, a "KilKenny's", which I liked as well.

    I ordered corned beef and cabbage.  I think it is one of those dishes that one likes the way one's Grandmother made it, and all subsequent plates of it are measured up against that.

    The best way to serve the cabbage is I think, boiled in the meat water, but that I suppose would be a pain in the a** to pull off in a restaurant.  I loathe it when the cabbage is boiuled in plain water.  In the case of Ri Ra, it was "braised", in butter I think, and was pretty tasty.

    The meat was too fatty for me.  The way I like it, all the fat has boiled off into the water, one does not get any fat blobs to spit out into the napkin.  The parsley sauce that was on it was ok, subtle, but it hid the fat blobs so I could not cut them out in advance.

    Service was excellent.  I felt like one oyster even though the menu only offered them by half a dozen minimum, and they did me up one with iced plate and all.

Try visiting this place on a weekend and you will get lousy service and get beer spilled on you from the overcrowded interior that houses some of the worst food and bad tasting beers you can find. This is an overrated place that sits in a nice part of downtown close to some of the fancier restaurants. this is not one of them. The inside is trying to be a classic Irish pub with a dark interior and badly decorated walls with nasty furniture. There is a unnecessary lobby area, that packs in college kids and has a bar in a bad spot. Then there are the bad hostess and waitstaff, that have no idea how to seat people and treat you like you are doing them a favor. The menu is a scattered mess of trying to be Irish foods that taste like TV dinners and the warm nasty beer they serve is not enough to wash this garbage down. The prices on top of all this hassle are high and not worth the aggravation you have to put up with to get into this place. Skip this one for sure, it has ot be one of Providences worst places!
great place. the staff was nice. the bar is one long bar that wraps around so there are 3 sides to the bar. the live band was great. i do wish that there was more tables

This Irish pub really was everything we needed it to be during our visit.  We've been walking around looking for a cool spot to seat, eat and drink before the WaterFire show.  It fit the bill perfectly!  There weren't very many people around since it was still early evening, but the seating the in bar area was great.  The server was a super friendly Irishman that spoke a lot with his hands.   His recommendations for food were fantastic.  I had the BBQ chicken pizza and loved every bite of it.  I think that must have been the 3rd time I've ever had BBQ chicken pizza so it's not usually on my list of things to get.  As for my bf, he ordered the fish and chips.  The battered Hake fish was really good!  Plus, the beers on tap were all decent.  This place may not make the grade for most folks, but on our visit it was perfect.

I have been to Ri Ra many times over the years and it really hasn't changed at all.... which is a blessing, an Irish Blessing, naturally!
It's decorated as a rustic-y (is that even close to a real word?) pub, down to the walls, exposed brick and beams, the art work, etc. The drinks are good sized for the price, they have a pretty awesome selection of Irish whiskeys and what really gets me everytime, is the shot menu. I usually go for the straight shot variety so I fon't need a menu, but a bar next to the Capitol Grill encouragin shots? Amazing! 
The bartenders are knowledgable, typically have good sense of humor and work quickly.
When I was there last Saturday there was a pretty good live band that did everything from Bon Jovi and Michael Jack to Third Eye Blind. I have no complaints. 
The crowd was a little strange. There was a group from a wedding- they were "wedding drunk" and a lot of fun, there were a couple of dudes sporting Ed Hardy (maybe they couldn't get into Vue?), a couple of college aged kids and everyone else seemed pretty casual early 30's. There were no fights and everyone seemed to be having a good time. 
There is outside seating and people go out to smoke. 
I didn't eat here this time, but in the past I have and the food is quite good.
I recommend Ri Ra if you are around and want a relaxed, good time.
always a treat
Excellent authentic Irish fare.  Cheap beer...$3 pints of Harp, Stella, Smithwick's and more.  Highly recommend!!!  Went back the next night after trying this place.

I don't think I have visited this place enough to write a review but I have to mention that "Shepherd's pie fries" is f-in' gorgeous. I think it's the greatest fries creation.
Nice beer selections. It gets absolutely packed during water fire season so if you want to relax and dine, avoid those time.

Can one find salvation in a bar?  If so, Ri Ra is my personal Jesus.  I was out in Providence with my mom and grandmother on the annual "see all the relatives before they kick off" tour and, after 10 hours of visiting, I needed a stiff beverage...or 5.  This, being the only place in the immediate area open until 2:00AM on a Sunday (a blessing for someone still on west coast time), heeded the call, in spades.

Praise Ri Ra!

This place is a sham of an Irish pub. 

To me and irish pub should have 3 qualities. 
1) Know how to pour a beer 
2) Good bar food
3) Tables and seating should be close to allow for a public house (where people meet to drink and talk) atmosphere

I came here because I was writing an article for an online magazine on Irish pub food. When I first walked in the place had a nice vibe to it. It was dark, wood tables, hell even a dart board. I didn't like how dispersed the place was. If I wasn't thinking twice I would think I was drinking in a warehouse. 

They had a nice selection of beer. A large selection of Guinness fusion beers, so I order a Black and blue (Guinness and Blueberry Beer). It came out with a perfect head. So we started off on the right foot. 

The food was probably the worst food I've had in Providence. Maybe I'm being too harsh, but this is Providence people. Only New York City has anything on us when it comes to food. My two friends order a personal margarita pizza and the blue burger with fries. I ordered the 2 1/2 apps, fried pickles and potato cakes. 

The Margarita Pizza:
I purchased better, much better, pizza from the freezer at my grocery store. It was as if they picked up a frozen pie and threw basil and tomato on it. It was luke warm too. The crust was the best part, but it was still a little too chewy for my tastes. (not warm doughy chewy, like dry soft chewy). Most damning of all my friend said " I could do the same thing with an Ellio's pizza."

The Blue Burger:
Was whatever. My friend said it was pretty dry and just came with blue cheese, no sauce no veggies. Kinda weird right? The fries needed a heavy hand of salt. I'm guessing it wasn't the worst, but not what you want to hear for a 10 dollar burger.

Fried Pickles:
When done right they can be the best appetizer on the menu. These had potential, the batter used was solid and crispy. The dips (horseradish and spicy mayo) were on. It was just too thick of a cut on the pickle. They were so big by the time you bite into them the middle was cool. 

Potato Cake:
Cold disgusting gruel in pancake form. Not wasting my breath on it. 

Ok Ri Ra, please stop calling yourself a pub and just say "You know what I'm an Irish Themed dance club after 9 pm." I won't be back unless Ri Ra becomes a cool spot for 20 somethings. Meaning never.

Apparently there are a handful of these on the East Coast.  It is a lovely pub in downtown Providence that actually reminds me of Fado. Kind of.  While it may be a chain (kind of) they all have interior from pubs in Ireland. The Providence local shop bar began life in its original location in Lavin's Pub in the town of Swinford, County Mayo on the west coast of Ireland in the year 1889. Pretty cool.  Beautiful interior. I had the boxty and it was above average. The best thing listed on the menu is a pint of Guinness. Listed as an appetizer.

Notta-bad-sandwich!  So RiRa in my mind will always be a late night, awesome cover band venue however...they have food too!

I've never had a big entree here but have had a few sandwiches and they were very good and very reasonably priced.  Lots n' lots of beer available and outside seating.

If you're not up for a fancy-schmancy dinner but want to be downtown I highly recommend RiRa for a sandie!

I love to eat out however, I will never eat here again.
#1 Out of many beer varieties on the menu.
#2 Server said she could split up the check and then was unable to do so. After a aggravating conversation with other staff we were able to split it up. (we had a large party)
#3 There was dollar charge for french fries that was not disclosed on the menu!!!
#4 Food was good but the above ruined the experience.

Pretty fun place to go on a Friday night. They have live music which is always a plus. Bar tenders are friendly and relaxed. But for some reason they have an obsession with removing the tables and chairs in the place...my guess is so they can let more people in the door and not violate fire codes. Cover is usually $5 drinks are reasonably priced and good beer selection.

sure it's a chain dressed up in the guise of authenticity - but what can I say? I'm a fan.  It's not necessarily a place that I seek out now that I've moved away and become a "grown up," but Ri-Ra has been graced by my elegant (and sober) presence a few times since my departure from my beloved Providence.
If you're into Trivia - they run a great night here - better than most other venues in the area. If you're a single lady looking to meet some yuppy guys, here's a tip - they seem to swarm and lose all inhibition on trivia nights (I was never down, but who knows, some girls like the smell of money).

Decent pub offerings, spacious, good place to bring the family or your friends - great selection of whiskeys too. One of the few places where you can find Paddy's this side of the pond.

Oh come on, you have to like RiRa!  It has a fun atmosphere great food and great drink.  I love the inside of the place, the patrons for the most part are personable and friendly.  

I personally enjoy stopping by here on a Sunday afternoon after working

This place is pretty close to my ideal kind of pub. It's really quiet even on a Friday evening, before it gets closer to entertainment time. The weekend afternoons are also nice and relaxed. I don't bother with going during live music hours; I need a place where I can drink a beer and have a coffee (which they serve very well, in a personal plunger) and read a book in peace. The bartenders are perfectly friendly, and they serve Kilkenny.

I'm a vegetarian and they have great options. The centerpiece would be their very interesting white-bean veggie burger, which is not really a veggie burger at all; the "patty" is really a kind of white-bean paste that's blended with other stuff. It may sound gross, but it's very delicious. There's also really good cheesy spinach-avocado dip served with toast, and of course the Irish leek&potato soup. They also have a portobella burger but I haven't tried it yet.

I'm not giving it a five because the atmosphere could be a bit cozier. I'd also rather see the bartenders just wear whatever they like instead of being limited to the black shirt/pants deal.

I'll miss you, The Idle Rich of Dallas, but I'm getting along with Ri Ra.

This is a typical Irish Pub located in Providence near the waterfront. Lots of other restaurants around and close to downtown proper. Decent food and drinks with Irish staff. This place stands out because their COVER BANDS are awesome. They also have darts!
Half off burgers on Sunday night!!! Who could complain!!! Burgers were delicious and obnoxious karaoke was hilarious! Two thumbs up from a Bostonian.

I was here a while back when I was an intern down in the Jewelry District and I would wander over here for $5 burgers for lunch on Wednesdays. 

You know, it's a pub? It is what it is and I sort of love it for exactly what it is. I always feel like I have to go on here and respond to other people's reviews, which is sort of funny because I'm really not all about "internet debating". 

Regardless, when I was there, the staff was nice and the food was good. I didn't have a beer while I was there because I would go during the middle of the day on Wednesdays and I think coming back smelling like booze would have raised some flags with my supervisors.

Stopped by RiRa last night for an impromptu burger with my man.  

We sat outside on the patio, which was nice.  But I am starting to realize that outdoor dining really means "Smoking Area Dining".  Oh well.

We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip as an

SMITHWICK'S ON TAP! WOO HOO!

My favorite beer from Ireland, now owned by Guinness (which is fine), on tap - already I like this place.  Plus, TATOS - yes they are potato chips, but I've only had these in Ireland.  All kinds of Cadburry candies sent straight from the island as well.

Great menu, even had a vegetarian option (portabella burger) - I KNOW!  Didn't expect that honestly, didn't hate it either.

Of course, there's the typical Irish spirits - and the food/beer/spirits are authentic.  I know this because the owner, and half the staff are straight off the boat - honestly.

The crowds here were the trashiest I've seen in months, but after getting over our initial disgust we had a blast. Very crowded, but great drunken-yuppie-people-watching (I have seen more popped collars and backwards hats in one room than I care to ever see again), bad dancing, and good music (for dancing, not really what I care to listen to), aside from that absolutely REVOLTING cover of  "Closer" the band did... wow.
Brief frightening moment when one of those barely conscious yuppies approached me to tell me the song playing was written about me.... though it took me half an hour to figure out what the hell he was trying to say. Good times, good times. Drinks were also good.

The decor is decent -- paint-textured walls, Irish quotes painted on & more wood than you can find in a forest.  I went there on Saturday night with hubby, my brother, & another friend.  We were seated in the back in a roundabout booth - very cool for hanging out, but not so good if you actually want to be involved in whatever's going on in the bar.  They had a waitress, which I thought was a bit odd since it was a Saturday night & there was a band playing....but that's just me.  She was ok - nothing out of the ordinary & though we were really only grabbing one round, seemed like she got the hint & let us do our thing.

Unlike most trips out, I did not get a chance to check out the bathroom - so no details about that.  Definitely a place I would probably check out again for a drink - if I'm ever in the area again.

Ri Ra is a fairly enjoyable spot, especially on nice weekend days/evenings/nights to grab a few drinks and relax. 

The view of providence from the outside patio is nice, and they pour a good Guinness. I went here often for the World Cup this summer (when the place was absolutely PACKED) and have come back a few times when I am downtown to grab a few beers. 

Nothing too special, but it's a good choice for downtown. The place was a tad rowdy last time I was there late night, if that's your style.

Ri-Ra is a lot of fun.  Nights when they have bands can be a blast!  Be warned, it may cost you a few bucks to get in...but it is usually worth it.  I have eaten here many times and it has always been consistently tasty and fresh.  I was so surprised that I loved the apple and goat cheese salad, it really was awesome.  I have taken many friends here while visiting Providence and no one is ever disappointed.  It is decorated in truly Irish flair and is warm and inviting.  I can't wait to get back to Providence so I can go here again!
Every time I've been to Ri Ra I've wondered why I didn't learn the last time.  It gets so crowded that you can't enjoy your beer, you can't enjoy the bands, and I wasn't impressed with the food.

The last time I was in Ri-Ra, it was MANY years ago, and I guess it's stayed pretty much the same over the years.  My wife and I grabbed a couple of burgers on a Saturday afternoon, and we basically had the place to ourselves (which is strange, because th

I really like this place!  I was in Providence, RI for about 2 1/2 days and I was at Ri Ra's on 2 of those days.  Great service (a few Irish girls!) and excellent beer selection.  

Both times I was there I sat outside on the patio and enjoyed the Providence scene.  If you are in the area...Ri Ra's is a MUST!
So, I did, in fact make it back to RiRa, for St. Pat's. They had a great live band and a large crowd. I had a ride this time, so not paying to park was nice. However, they did charge a $10 cover.

We went here for dinner on a Saturday night, and were able to get seated right away. The menu was okay, decent selection of 'Irish' dishes. While we ate, it became very very loud in the dining room due to the bar area which seemed to be the place to be. We stayed for a few drinks, but all in all the place it was just 'so-so'.

Typical pub - but great selection of lagers on tap.  The food is very typical pub fare and tasty after a few pints.    It can get a bit loud, but very fun.  The live music is always good and very friendly staff.    A good spot for a revist anytime.

So originally I wasn't going to write a review of this place because it's really just not my type of place and I didn't want my personal taste to dictate my review.

My boyfriend and I went here this past Saturday morning as it was the meeting place for an scavenger hunt/race called Urban Dare.
The staff was really friendly considering their restaurant had been taken over by a bunch of jocks and nerds who werent really buying anything. The place is pretty big, clean, and not too tacky (considering its a large 'irish' themed pub).

After the race the bar also acted as the finish line. We were in a really great mood from finishing much better then we'd expected to so we decided to celebrate with dinner. We both ordered the hummus wraps with fries and a Newport blueberry beer. Everything was yummy and decently priced and the service was great.
HERES THE PROBLEM.
I found not one, but two large olive pits in my sandwich!!! Luckily I bit into them and didn't choke. I was in such a good mood and pumped up on endorphins that I kind of dismissed it and simply wrote a note about them on a comment card.
When I got home last not, however, I found that my FRONT TOOTH IS CHIPPED!!!!
I am so unhappy.

So yeah, clean, good service, yummy food, but the kitchen staff really needs to be more aware of what they're giving the patrons.  These were big kalamata olive pits in a wrap. Not even something a person is eating with a fork and can pick around.
Thankfully I didn't choke, but now I have to have dental work?! (and I don't have dental insurance so this is no little thing)

AGHHHHHHHH!
I've been here a few times over the years. great place for a drink with friends. Average food and on the nights when they have live music not the best place to eat. I find the music way too loud.

The few times I've been to town on biz and eaten @ Rira it has been tasty. First time I had a scallop dish and this time I had the pub burger with smoked bacon and bleu cheese. Both dishes were quite tasty along with the guinness. The only complaint I have so far is the dam bar stools at the bar counter!!! you cant sit forward at the counter and most turn your knees sideways.  Great atomsphere, food and so on.

Only discovered this place late in my college career. I probably went five times and only recall having a really good time once. Parking is expensive in the area so, take the RIPTA if you can. I've never eaten here, but the drinks aren't anything special. The live music can be pretty cool, but the band also takes up a lot of room and makes things crowded. I've never been impressed with the crowd itself either...an odd mix that just never really struck me as fun.

business.full_address:
7663 New Hampshire Ave
Takoma Park, MD 20912
business.name: Rockville Motorsports

reviews.text: I bought a scooter here for $1000. About two months later it wouldn't start. I had to pay $310 to get it fixed and they wouldn't come to pick it up or drop it off even though you can't drive a broken scooter. They charge $75 each way for pick up and deliver even if it's a mile down the rode. And they sole my helmet. NEVER buy a scooter here. I have had several before and never dealt with such people.
Its a dress/children's store upstair but go downstairs and they have 20plus scooters in the basement. LOL only in Langley Park.

business.full_address:
600 S Lake Ave
Ste 303
Pasadena
Pasadena, CA 91106
business.name: CHIAO & WU, LLP - Attorneys at Law

reviews.text: I contacted Ching Chiao to help me with some issues i am having with my business lease, and he was a great help. He reviewed my lease and found several issues that needed to be addressed and saved me a ton of potential headache

I was referred by a friend to come here asd see sandy to get estate planning help. I never realized how much was involved with dealing with this touchy touchy subject growing up in an Asian american household. She was the nicest lawyer I've ever met and in sure anyone would agree after meeting her. I opted for a consultation for my specific case. This stuff us sooooo confusing, but that's why u came to them to make everything right.

I've worked with Ching in the past when I was purchasing a property.  He is very knowledgeable about real-estate laws and is very honest on his recommendations.  If you need any legal help, Ching Chiao is the lawyer to go to.

We've had some really bad experiences with attorney's in the past. Either they were dishonest or they didn't even do what they were paid to do. Some didn't even really care about our needs. We were looking for an attorney in the Pasadena or in the general San Gabriel Valley area. Good thing we saw these guys on Google and Yelp reviews (we have yet to be let down by the Yelp and Google reviews community!) It's really hard to find reliable, trustworthy and honest attorneys but we did just that with the Law Offices of Chiao & Wu. We got in contact with them for help with tax, real estate, and business law issues and Ching Chiao was very professional and thorough. Ching contacted us in a timely manner and was able to communicate effectively to us (which is really crucial). We really felt like we were taken care of and in really good hands. We would continue to do business with them again and again for all our lawyer needs and would recommend them to anyone.

Contacted Mr. Chiao about a real estate matter in the down economy. He was a blessing to work with. He was very knowledgeable and laid out all of our options, pros and cons, but also truly understood the background of which my husband and I were coming from. His reviews precede himself! We felt very comfortable the entire time. You could tell he was looking out for our best interests from the get-go. We would use his services again in the future!

I have worked with others, but Ching Chaio is THE lawyer for all the legal advice that I needed to get me out of a real estate fraud in which I was victimized.  He not only offered the most cost-effective solutions for the problems but also his sincere and honest personal advice which were very comforting and much needed to all of us during the most difficult time. As easygoing as Ching can be, his professionalism and defiant disposition surely delivers positive results.  We believe that we had the BEST lawyer for the case; and that's why I highly recommend Ching's sophisticated service and style to anyone who is in need of a genuine and brilliant lawyer.

I was in over my head with a commercial lease and I had no way of continuing; I was already way in the red and didn't know how I would survive another year. I tried a reach out to the management and come to some sort of compromise, but was ignored at every turned. I was at the end of my rope and then they sent a lawyer to represent them. I tried to work it out with the lawyer, but after being ignored for over a month, I got scared and started looking for a lawyer of my own. 

After lots of research and debate over whether I can even afford to see a lawyer for this, I found Ching through Yelp. He had a lot of amazing reviews and considering my pending situation, I had to just bite the bullet and pay the consultation fee. 

The consultation was definitely a nerve wrecking experience. I had no way of knowing if I was throwing more money away and no idea what to expect from the meeting. However, after all was said and done, I left the consultation feeling more at ease than I had in months. Ching was professional, understanding and he did more than his part to be utterly empathetic of my situation. Professional you expect, understanding you hope to get, but empathy is something very few people manage to provide. 

Ching was on top of my case despite the fact that it wasn't a winning case. He made sure I was taken care of and even if we weren't going to get the best settlement, at least we could make the other side compromise and actually come to the table. He was considerate of my financial situation and did more than he should have to get me a favorable outcome. Now that everything is over, I couldn't have hoped for a better lawyer to help me through that tough patch I didn't know if I could get through. 

If you need a lawyer, you need THIS lawyer. He is more than qualified and integrity you'll be hard press to find elsewhere. If I ever need legal advice, I would not hesitate to go back to Ching.

I will keep this simple. Chiao & Wu are the best in business. Their experience and knowledge is unparallel by any other attorney. Mr. Chiao reviewed several agreements for our company and he was thorough. His attention to detail was extraordinary and pointed out several clauses that needed attention and/or modification (and recommended language to protect our interest). I felt Mr. Chiao was direct, eloquent, skillful and extremely concerned about my financial and legal well-being. In addition, he is a skillful negotiator and communicator.

Quite honestly, I hear horror stories all the time about attorneys.  When I was going through my divorce, I had a small support group of other divorcees share stories about their own experiences with other attorneys.  Most of them went something like,  "they were horrible.  They dragged things out and only cared about making money."  

I found Chiao & Wu, LLP through a very close personal reference, and Sandy Wu represented me in the matter.  She was very professional and knowledgeable about the process, and answered every question I had.  She was very prompt in answering my emails regarding any matters I had.  Even as tough as a divorce can be, Sandy made the process bearable and stress-free in regards to the legal side of things.  

I was so impressed with Sandy Wu that I decided to recommend the firm to my parents in regards to some business matters.  Ching Chiao represented them in two matters in regards to possible civil lawsuits.  It was clear from the comments my parents made that he had their best interest in mind.  Especially given that my parents speak primarily Chinese, it was refreshing to see a professional handle things the way he did and not take advantage of them.   In the end, my parents were very happy with the conclusions of their matters.

Thank you Chiao & Wu, LLP for all the services you provided for our family.  I highly recommend them and will use them again in the future.

I don't usually have the time to write reviews for services.  I consider myself an true hustler without time to get boggled down with the goofy stuff in life. I generally have no respect for attorneys, real estate brokers. So, I was selling my business because my business partners and I ran into some tough times during the recesson.

We were about to lose it all, and my partner and I were fighting everyday because of the stress of losing our shirts. I needed help and googled for business law help. I was still doubtful, but as I was in the corner, I had to give it a shot.  I called these guys and I got to speak to the attorney right away.  He was generous with his time and spoke to me like a friend.  At first impression, he was upfront and didn't beat around the bush.

In the end, my partner and I went in for a consultation, and we made out BIG!  We ended up keeping our business and have been profitable using the suggestions attorney Ching Chiao gave us.

Will be using them call them and decide for yourself, you wont go wrong.  Good luck...

business.full_address:
2511 S Vermont Ave
South Los Angeles
Los Angeles, CA 90007
business.name: Jack In The Box

reviews.text: My very first taste of Jack In the Box I've been to.  Came to their grand opening (1967), and hamburgers were twenty two cents with their famous secret sauce!  Time sure has changed.  Not the very best location, but it does the job.
Its a fast food place that is close to usc, has cheap prices, and average food/service. Plus is its open until late so if you need a midnight snack its a good spot to stop.

business.full_address:
514 E Washington St
Downtown Ann Arbor
Ann Arbor, MI 48104
business.name: Name Brand Tattoo

reviews.text:
Got my first ever tattoo here on the recommendation of some trusted friends who've had quite a bit of work done. The atmosphere is great, clinical but friendly. I'm very happy with the work , I was somewhat vague in my instructions about placement but the artist couldn't have done better.

If/when I get another, Name Brand is the first place I'll call.  .

I love NB. The atmosphere is great and I have had work done there by Cole as well as a visiting artist and got touched up by Jen. Working with all three was a pleasure and I get compliments on the tattoos everywhere I go. The atmosphere is relaxed and clean and I cannot recommend Cole enough! He was great and I can't wait to work with him again.

I chose to get my first and only tattoo done here. Before I chose Name Brand, I did research online about other businesses but ultimately picked their location since it had good reviews across the web.

From the beginning, I was in contact with someone via email. The contact was very helpful and quick to respond about all my questions regarding the design that I had created. 

I had originally inquired about Jeff Zuck doing my tattoo but they directed me to another artist that had more experience with my type of design.  The tattoo parlor was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and Chad Hunt, the artist I had, did a great job. Before going in, I was a bit worried as to whether or not they would be able to get my design to look like it had been painted on to my skin, but he got the gradients just right and I was extremely satisfied. I would definitely go back to get a second tattoo.
I went in for my first tattoo. Jen sat down with me and talked about what I wanted to get. She was great, keep me calm well getting them done. I will be coming back for sure!

After much research I decided to get my very first tattoo at Name Brand. I was incredibly nervous, but they made the process easy. It was my first, so it was a very small, simple tattoo, just one word on my wrist. I wanted it to be perfect though, and it is. Jen did an excellent job, copying the font and size exactly. Everything is perfectly straight and looks beautiful. It's exactly as I pictured it, and I'm very picky. I highly recommend them to anyone.

I have been to other tattoo shops in the area but my experience at Name Brand was by far the best! Everyone at the shop made me feel welcome, were professional and overall just really cool to deal with! Cole did my work which was a black graphic key and I can't recommend him enough! He not only did an exceptional job with my tattoo but also answered every question I had and had a great outlook on everything about the process. I will be coming back and I highly recommend Name Brand to everyone and anyone that wants to get a tattoo!

Out of my three tattoos, the one I got inked at Name Brand was definitely the best.  I shopped around all over Ann Arbor to find the best place, and just judging by portfolios and professionalism, I have to say that Name Brand is DEFINITELY your best bet.  

My tattoo artist, Dawn, worked with me on my design.  She's extremely talented and has an awesome "bedside manner".  Her choice of lines and colors suited my design completely... her interpretation of my design came out perfectly the way I wanted.

I'm glad I waited until 32 to get a tattoo, because I put a heck of a lot of thought into what I wanted and who I wanted to do it.  I went to Name Brand on the recommendation of my sis-in-law who has many many tattoos and many friends who are artists.  Jeff Zuck is the owner--he did an excellent cover up on said sister in law and is just overall a cool dude.  I've also heard really good things about Dawn.  A guest artist wound up doing mine.  Overall, I found them to be clean, professional, fun, and serious about what they do.

I got my first tattoo at Name Brand today and the entire experience was easy and fun. Considering my rampant anxiety, the fact that I can say this shows something about the shop, its staff and professionalism. 

Having wanted to get tattooed since 14 I figured my 19 year wait was proof that I really wanted to do this. I had been playing with an idea but I can't draw - that didn't help my anxiety. 

Using the website I sent a general contact request where I provided basic info and a description of what I was thinking. A few days later I got a phone call from the shop, was asked a few questions and scheduled a consult. Based on what I wanted to have done, the shop set me up with Adam. 

Our consult was chill. I explained what I was thinking and provided a few pictures I'd printed that were kind of along the idea. We talked about a few different ideas, Adam said he would work on it and we scheduled a one o'clock appointment for today. 

From the consultation I knew NB was a good place for me. Adam was serious and knowledgable but also had a sense of humor and was chill about the whole thing. He was up front about the fact that what I had envisioned as design would not work with the size I wanted and took me through some options.
