Plus, the check engine light was off (and stayed off!)  We were so impressed we took it back again for some of the less urgent fixes.

Prices are fair, service is honest--you couldn't ask for a better car repair shop.

Dan Caloun and his garage provide the best service at the lowest possible price.  I have had numerous occassions over the years to use his service for small and large car damage.  I've always been very satisified with his work.

business.full_address:
999 E Green St
Pasadena
Pasadena, CA 91106
business.name: Beyond Hair

reviews.text:
I was really pleased to find this place.  $30 for a shampoo, haircut, and style in Pasadena?  Unheard of.  Most places I called wanted around $60, which is just crazy.  I went to Supercuts once when I first moved here, just for a trim, which was okay, but when I decided to do something different with my hair, there was no way I was going back there.  

I called Beyond Hair on a Saturday, and they were able to get me in that afternoon.  Chuck was at the front desk when I arrived.  He seems like a really cool guy, and I like the feel of the salon...kind of funky, cool music playing, relaxed vibe.  My stylist was Lisa, and I had a photo of me with the haircut that I used to have, and wanted again.  She did exactly what I asked for, and didn't rush, so she did a really good job.  I was totally satisfied and will return.

Molly G must not understand the vibe of this place. This is a family salon, where everyone knows each other. Chuck is more than a hair guy, he listens and gives real life recommendations for things to do, places to go in Pasadena and LA. I've referred more than one friend here for the solid Aveda quality salon, reasonable prices, and friendly atmosphere.

Ivy is a hair ninja. 

I adore her, her style, her humor and her desire to make you feel sassy and gorgeous. I had below-shoulder hair, and I trusted her to chop it short. If I had a nickle for every compliment I've gotten since? And with every follow up trim? I can retire now at the age of 30. 

She'll ask you what it is you're after and then make her suggestion. She's opened to critique after the cut if you feel that your cut can be shorter, or you want a section a little different, she'll work with you until you love it, as long as you COMMUNICATE what you want! 

Anyhoo.... no one else will be touching my hair as long as Ivy's around. Especially since she's banned me from going to "Asian Salons"... hahaha yeaaah... I'm Chinese but I don't want to look like every other Asian chick. (Some of you know exactly what I'm talking about!)

After a year of growing out my hair from the pixie cut of last summer to the shoulder length hair seen in more recent Yelp pictures, I figure it was time to get my hair cut. Not just a trim, none of that cut-off-half-an-inch-so-you-can't-tell-the-differen

I have to agree with the other reviewers, this shop is cute.  However there are some downsides: parking in this part of Pasadena is a nightmare (I'd recommend looking down a street) and the appointment was not very timely.  I arrived on time for my cut and my hair dresser (A woman) was busy with another client for 30 minutes into my scheduled appointment time.  She didn't offer apologies or seem concerned.  If you have something planned after, I would recommend telling them and perhaps skipping the style after your haircut.  

If you're looking for a stylist to create a cut for you, I'd try one of the other shops in Pasadena.  I tried to give her free rein to cut whatever off she wanted to but she seemed reluctant and kept asking what I wanted (something new and fresh).  I had to come up with ideas on my own and ask her to implement them.  The cut is very nice looking, so if you are prepared with a specific idea I think she could cut it very well.

Also, just as a warning for the squeamish: there were clumps of hair on the floor and combs were reused without any cleaning liquid.

I was there for a cut. Nothing fancy, no special challenges. Just a simple day-to-day cut. I even brought a picture of exactly what I wanted. 

The parking situation was a bit frustrating: No parking lot, only sparse street parking. Nevertheless, I went in with high hopes and Lisa was the stylist (the eldest of the three).

Yes, it's true, they don't have a receptionist, so sometimes they do run to get the phone or to collect service fee from clients. The three siblings seemed very nice, though Bonnie seemed the quiet type while Chuck was chatting up his client the whole time (Chuck is the middle one, and Bonnie the youngest).

While Lisa was very friendly, I really am not impressed with the cut I've received. I realize now you get what you pay for. And now I've got to find someone to fix this mess that's sitting on my head...

I have to say I've been debating about my review of this place for some time now.  I really wish I could give the shop one rating, and my hair stylist a separate rating, because to be honest the shop sucks.  It's in a cute little area with lots of charm, but the owner has no clue.  First off, if you go in on a weekend, there is hardly any seating, so if you have to wait, they make you sit in the back under a hairdryer while you wait for your hair stylist. They really need to rethink the layout of the front of the shop.  Second, if your there when it's busy, they tend to blow electrical fusses left and right.  Third, I can't believe Aveda would lower their standards, this place looks like it was thrown together with no thought, no time, and no style.  None of the furniture matches, you get the feeling the owner was trying to piece this place together as cheaply as possible.  Several of the wall posters are wrinkled, with cracked frames, and there are spackle marks all over the walls that need to be painted. Another thing that really bothered me, was that the first time I went in to the shop I requested someone I had never met, due to word of mouth.  When I got there they had given me to some other hair stylist.  I didn't find out until half way through my appointment, that the person doing my hair wasn't the same person I had requested. The only reason I went back for a second round is because while I was there, I met this other hairstylist, who seemed to know her stuff. I personally feel, that if I have to pay Aveda prices, the store should be held to higher standards. Don't get me wrong this place has potential.  Hopefully, the owner will catch on.  

As far as my stylist.  She's fantastic, I would five her 5 stars if I could.  Her name is Ivy.  I've only seen her a few times, so far, but every time she blows me away.  She is so up beat and fun to talk to, and she does a great job with hair color, cuts, and crazy frizzy curly hair.   She is the only reason I keep going back.

I've been getting haircuts here for about 4 years now.  You really can't find a better deal for a haircut at an Aveda salon in Pasadena, when haircuts can run you $75+ at other places.  If you just want straight up haircuts and nothing fancy, this is a great place.

Lisa usually cuts my hair, but she wasn't there the day I desperately needed my hair cut.  I made an appointment with Bonnie instead. Bonnie was very nice and we talked up a storm during my haircut, which is unusual for me (I usually just sit there quietly).  I didn't want anything fancy, just a straight up cut, and I walked away happy.

You can find parking on the streets, but if you anticipate to stay longer than an hour, you can always park at the Rite Aid up the street.

If you have hair on your head---do NOT come here to have it cut.  Do NOT come here to have your hair trimmed.  Only come here if you want your head shaved.  And they may even botch that.

I came here based on the yelp reviews and the proximity of the salon to my home.  I would normally only trust my hair in the hands of someone I know and trust but I only needed a bang trim and thought why not?  What could go wrong?  Let me tell you, friends.  ALOT can go wrong.

Lisa, one of the salon's veteran hair "stylists" greeted me very meekly.  I sat down in the chair and she asked what I wanted.  I said a bang trim...she looked at my hair and said I really needed a trim all over.  Which was true, I'm growing my hair out and haven't gotten a cut since January.  

After a half assed shampoo we go back to the chair.  She looks at my very obviously tangled hair and asks if I get alot of tangles.  Duh!  Yes.  So rather than going to grab some detangler she has me get up, walk back to the shampoo station, sprays my hair down there, and then walks me back to the chair.  Why she couldn't grab the bottle and bring it to her station...who freakin knows?  

As soon as she picked up the scissors, I knew I was screwed.  She seemed to have no idea what the fark she was doing.  I have some layers around my face and when she went into to trim those pieces she cut them very horizontally blunt.  Like an inverted staircase.  She spent almost no time on my bangs--most hair dressers spend at least 15 minutes meticulously trimming each hair.  Then to the blow dry.  It seemed like she had never done one before.  She used the worst brush possible for my type of hair (super straight) and it took forever.  Once she was finished and handed me the mirror I could see the horror.  I quickly paid and got out of there--unsure how or if I could demand a refund.  When I got home and brushed it straight I discovered the extent of the damage.  She missed whole sections of bangs leaving very long pieces mixed in with the shorter.  And then the layers.  It looked as if I let my five year old sister cut my hair.

I scoured the net and found that Sugar, a salon in Silverlake, was open on Sundays.  I had gotten my bangs trimmed there when I lived in the 'hood and thought they were great.  I got an appointment with Adriana and she fixed the hack job.  For free.  Adriana just got herself a lifetime customer.

I don't usually get my hair cut in salons.  I have long curly hair, so it's pretty easy to trim on my own.  I wanted to get bangs though, and I didn't trust myself to do it on my own.  My friends recommended this place, and I was definitely nervous because even they were a little shaky based on their experiences with Chuck.  Plus, being a salon novice, I didn't know what to expect.  Ivy cut my hair, and I can't believe my luck.  She was really nice and gave me exactly what I wanted.  Later, she cut my boyfriend's hair.  He grows it long in order to be able to donate it.  Both times, she's been really nice about the cost.  My boyfriend was surprised to find that it only cost $10 more than the haircut he used to get at Supercuts  I've also recommended friends to her, and they're really happy with her.  So if you want a reasonably priced hair cut that you'll be happy with, I recommend Ivy.

This place sucks. Lisa cut my hair, in between answering her cell and going in the back to talk with Bonnie. My cut is awful. It's way too short, uneven, and not what I asked for. I'm reduced to putting it in a ponytail every day until it grows out. Even my sweet mother-in-law admitted she didn't like it. 

If you go here, you only have yourself to blame.

My wife first met Chuck 10 years ago and has been going to him for hair styling and coloring ever since. The shop has a pretty cool, eclectic, Pasadena kind of feel. One thing alot of people like about this place is the Aveda products.  Sonoma also has a great reputation for specializing in black people's hair.  Great atmosphere and great people.

I have been getting my haircut here for about 2 years already. The reason why i came here was because the previous person who cut my hair left the shop and i was in a desperate need of a haircut. so my mom, and her boyfriend took me around pasadena. My mom said there are places on Green Street. so we weny past by. And i believe it was around 7 or 8? so most places were already closed. Me and my mom saw the light on still inside, so we pulled over so me and my mom walked in. And already i was welcomed.

The person who cut my hair (and still does) is Chuck. He's an awesome guy. he understood how i wanted my haircut to look like. He actually made a better cut! :]

Now its been i am guess 2 years, and am still going there. I trust him 100%. And the thing with me is am really picky about my haircuts and i love here. Its welcoming, the music is siiiiick! ;] It feels and looks like a high class place, but the prices arnt! The prices are fair and cheap.
As a guy, some guys wouldnt pay 30 for a haircut. But i would. My hair looks awesome everytime.

SO, overall. GO GET YOUR HAIR CUT HERE! :]
its pretty rad!

Still 4.5.... I guess I won't give a 5 until I don't even have to give Bonnie a single reminder about my hair.... I'm not trying to be mean, I guess I'm still used to my old stylist.  After the first time, I NEVER had to say a word about what to do with my hair.

But that aside, she still continues to do a good and consistent job.  This time we ended up talking most of the time about the upcoming election and the financial crisis we're going through with Indymac and WAMU.

Oh, but she got the wash and cut down to 30 minutes.  Let's see if she can keep that up, haha

"can you please get your hair cut?"

those were some of the last words my mom said to me when i was leaving my parents' house this last weekend.  indeed my hair had grown wild and was pretty much almost down to my bum at this point. 

on that note and with the yelp holiday-super-duper-party-bash-extravagaaaaanza soon under way this week, i felt it was a good time to do something about this head of hair of mine.

i've been coming to this salon for the past three years and i really luv this place.  the reason's why i luv'em? oh so many reasons!  

not only is it conveniently located within walking distance of me, but i can always make an appointment within a day or so.  it's a family owned shop  with brother chuck, and sisters bonnie and lisa.  there are other employees but i've always had my locks trimmed and styled by either of the two gals. 

the salon itself is quite inviting when you step in.  it's not a modern day salon where everything is white with state-of-the-art equipment, and as sterile as tom cruise, but it's a welcoming space.  it's an aveda salon so there are aveda products to browse as you please.  from hair, skin to make-up - they've got it. 

during your perusal, your ears can be entertained by some cool tunes - mostly alternative, good 80s, and some classic rock.  chuck is also a dj at "menage" in old town on the weekends so he has some good taste goin'.

but most importantly, what i luv the most about this place are the stylists.  bonnie and lisa are both great at what they do, cuz they do the 'do how i tell them to. every time i have left this salon i've always been extremely satisfied and happy.  they listen to every word and detail of how i want my hair cut.  and not only are they great listeners, but they're ever so friendly and sweet.  

and the cherry on top?  just 30 bucks for a shampoo, cut, and style.  giddyup!

I first found out about Beyond Hair when I badly needed someone to fix my hair because a previous hair stylist ruined my hair. My hair was layered in a terrible mess and grew into a wild lion's mane in about a month. It was terrible, and my hair looked awful! I thought my hair would never be the same again so I started searching for a good hair stylist. Once I found out about Beyond Hair, my search was over. I was so grateful that Chuck was able to fix my hair! Since then I've been returning to Beyond Hair for years. I always book Chuck to cut my hair. I usually ask him to layer my hair, and he does an excellent job. Even my friends love it! Chuck only charges only $30 for a haircut and shampoo in Pasadena. Where else will you find a better deal than that in Pasadena?
Chuck really knows hair. He knows exactly how hair should be cut and treated. He knows which products to use and which ones to avoid. You can ask him. For example, the Brazilian Blowout is a scam. Chuck is aware that there are unethical hair stylists out there who just want to make a quick buck, fool people, and end up damaging people's hair. Chuck is an ethical and honest hair stylist. He gives you exactly what you need. He will not charge outrageously high prices nor will he pressure you into caving in for additional unnecessary services. That's what I love about Chuck and the hair stylists of Beyond Hair. They are honest, hard-working hair stylists who are willing to do their best for their clients.

Be cautious about some of those one-star Yelp reviews here. Some of them are absolutely unreliable. Have you noticed that they don't even create a Yelp profile? They never leave reviews for any other businesses. Those one-time, one-star Yelpers purposely want to malign a business more than to leave an honest review which is very unfair and untruthful. They tend to be those nightmare customers that no hair salon would ever want to have as their client. Take it from me. Don't believe them for a second because there are two sides to every coin. Which reviews would you rather believe? A one-time impossible-to-please client or a long-time client who voices good reason on why she returns.

Here are more reasons why I love to go to Beyond Hair. Chuck is very sociable and fun to talk to. You can even friend him on Facebook. There's nothing dryer than a boring, mute hair stylist. I'm glad that Chuck is the complete opposite of that. Chuck is not only a hair stylist but also a DJ. He plays great music while he shampoos and cuts your hair. He's a great person to talk to if you're really into music. You can talk to him about all kinds of rock musicians and rock bands especially Queen which is one of his favorites. You can talk to Chuck about collectibles too. He'll give you advice on how to make money on collectibles and how to not get ripped off by expensive concert tickets. 
They don't just cut hair at Beyond Hair but they also dye hair too. They can also trim your bangs for free after you had your haircut a while ago with them. Beyond Hair really cares about their clients, and they go above and beyond with their customer service. What more can I say? I love Beyond Hair!

business.full_address:
1116 Westwood Blvd
Westwood
Los Angeles, CA 90024
business.name: The Stand

reviews.text: It is a decent place for burger and hotdog.  But price seems higher... of course westwood market would make it seem normal range.
A little overpriced for ordinary food.

I went down here thanks to my ultra cool free hot dog coupon I got for being in the "section of the game" at the UCLA Basketball game.  Anyway, I picked out a Chicago hot dog.  The staff looked a little frazzled, but they were efficient and quick (it was

Had to kill some time between tennis matches at UCLA so my friend and I trek through Westwood village in search of some sustenance.  My friend remembered having hot dogs for cheap at The Stand so we walked over and was saddened to find out the special pricing of $1.00 hot dogs and $2.50 "Loaded" dogs (specialty dogs) was only on Mondays between 5pm and 10pm.  No big deal, paying regular price makes me take my time and not gorge myself on getting "a good deal."

I ordered the Chicago dog which I found out later was featured on the cover of some L.A. magazine.  So one of the most popular items on the menu should be pretty good right?  Wrong... good would be an overstatement.  It wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special.  The Chicago dog has neon relish, tomatoes, peppers, onions, mustard and celery salt.    Thats all and good but its the dog itself that makes or breaks the whole meal and well The Stand's dog didn't break me it didn't make me really want to go back for what I paid.  It was average or Yelp rating would say A-OK.

Really, I would only recommend this place if you could make it to the Monday happy hour otherwise its not really worth the time or money.

I should add, my friend really liked his mushroom burger but they didn't even use fresh mushrooms, rather canned button mushrooms.  Oh and they do have root beer on tap... at $2.50 a pop.  I'll pass thank you.

I got the Philly Cheese Steak with a large order of sweet potato fries for about $14.  I was disappointed that they were out of their draft root beer which I've heard good things about.  It wasn't the best sandwich I ever had but it wasn't bad.  The fries were pretty good.  I think it would be a good idea to stick to their hot dogs which I hope to try next time!
Very good burgers and sides.  Had the bacon and egg burger, with an over easy egg and yummy bacon.  Wonderful sweet potato fries.

Still 3 stars, but I will add they have regular stand dogs for $1.00 after 5pm on mondays(?). 

The team and I ate here again not too long ago, I went for the patty melt. That was GOOOOD. Another reason why it's still 3 stars for me, they took long to delivery my order. Not too much of a problem, seems like the manager who was overlooking (cute white female) set everything straight. Thank you.

Customer service sucked! The first time I came the service wasn't that bad, but the second time I came here it sucked. There were only a few people ahead of me in line to order, but it took FOREVER because the lady at the cashier kept messing up their orders. Everyone had to repeat their orders more than 2 times to get it right. When it was my turn to order, I said what I wanted and then the lady looked at me and asked me again what I wanted to order...uhhhh! I said it again and asked for the sauce on the side and she even repeated it. When I looked at my receipt it didn't say anything about having the sauce on the side, so when my chicken burger came it had sauce inside! C'mon, is it really that difficult especially after you repeat my order correctly the second time?

DON'T ORDER THE PATTY MELT.  I did hoping that they know how to make one.  They don't.  The onions weren't caramelized.  Their burger patty was dry; they didn't even ask me how I wanted the burger cooked.  Plus, the sandwich was tasteless.  Lastly, the bread wasn't really rye bread.  It is basically wheat bread with grains on it.

DON'T ORDER THE PATTY MELT.  It came with fried chips.  Yum deep fried stuff!  It's not as good as Ruffles potato chips though.

DON'T ORDER THE PATTY MELT.  Do order the chili cheese fries though.  The chili itself is good.  The fries taste kinda odd though.  I say there are much better places you can get fries.  Not impressed.

DON'T ORDER THE PATTY MELT.  My wife ordered the BBQ beef brisket and that was pretty good.  Order that instead of the patty melt.
I like the poppy seed bun. Their regular hot dogs are average..but they add so many toppings that it's really filling! Service is really good..the people there are really friendly :)

today's hot dog was good n decent once again.  more sauce than before, barry nice..  but I was also starving.  I just wish they warmed / toasted the bun more.  that would make it so much better

I'm giving it one more star this time cause i got the fries and they were really good and plentiful (for the small) and not too 'spensive
ehh...nothing spectacular...as advertised...good for a quick lunch

Go on Mondays where they offer "dollar dogs" (regular hot dog w/ a choice of condiments) or 1/2 price classic dogs! 

Up for review: 
* Chili Cheese dog
* Chicago dog 
* Root Beer (on tap!) 

+/- Chili cheese was below average - mild taste, cheese wasn't            melted :( That's the part that I look forward to the most! 

+/-Chicago dog...well, what do you expect eating a Chicago style hot dog in California? Not much. It'll fulfill your craving because you can take the dog of Chicago, but you can't take the Chicago out of the dog.

++ Root beer was pretty good...will come back for that for sure! Not overly bubbly or too much sassafras! 

* I'm curious about the chips and fries looked awfully good. They also offer low carb options and burgers (but that seems so silly when The Counter does it so much better). 

Overall:
Food: Mehh...I'll pay my hot dog dues on Mondays when I'm in the neighborhood, but its not worth driving across town for. 

Atmosphere: I feel like a Barbershop Quartet is going to pop out at any moment...

Price: Can't beat the Monday prices or the "Happy Hour"  from 3-5pm

Overall: I'd rather go to Costco for the Polish Sausage (with drink included) for $1.50
I had the Downtown LA Dog and it was great! With tax it was only $5.41 but it came with chips, and the hot dog was loaded!

Looking for a great burger, we headed to The Stand in Westwood.  The food lived up to our expectations, especially the onion rings, but the service was all but non-existant.  I will admit that it was close to closing time and that there was only one cook and one guy at the counter, but with six of seven groups of diners waiting to be served, they fell flat on their bums!

When the food finally did arrive more than 15 minutes later, it was sans our milk shakes.  And when the shakes finally arrived 15 minutes after that, we had already finished our meal.

MIght be worth heading all the way to Santa Monica to The Counter next time we expect service with our food.

Ever had fries and booze for dinner? I HAVE!

My friend and I came to The Stand because we saw that they had a TV in there. It was meant to be a short sit down place so I can catch the Magic - Hawks game. One of the employees was nice enough to leave the Magic game on one of the TVs when the Lakers came on the tv. I could tell the cooks were disappointed since I was watching the only tv in their line of vision. Star for being nice to non-locals.

What started off as a beer and a basket of fries turned into 3 baskets of fries. The fries were hot and crispy and my mix of ketchup and tabasco sauce kept me happy and buzzed.

Overall a friendly place with good fries and booze. I only wished I tried one of their hotdogs.

Happy Hour Mondays!!

$1 for a stand dog with as many toppings as you want
$2.50 for a loaded dog with as many toppings as you want

they do not come with a side so you have to order that separately. but you do have a choice of beef or turkey dog and regular or poppyseed bun. the buns were soooo soft and the meats were grilled perfectly.

and the chili has no beans which is my favorite kind of chili...all meat. yum!

i'll definitely come back for happy hour.
Average hot dogs.
Had their regular hot dog. Stale bread, beef frank was just ok. Not worth repeating.
They have a special Monday night menu that makes it well worth it. Otherwise, the hot dogs are probably not worth the regular price. It is a nice place to go for somewhat expensive fast food though.

Parking: parking structures in Westwood probably is your best bet.

Hot dogs were expensive for what it is. But you can add toppings to it if you order the regular hot dogs, so make sure you look at what you are going to put on it before you order. 

I got the steak fries. Not worth it since I paid 6 bucks for it and it was really small and was lacking fries. My friend got the hot fries. Nastiest thing ever because it tasted like soggy cheetos.
THe food was decent. It tasted good, but nothing special. I had a BBQ sandwich and potato chips. I would recommend the fries over the chips though. Overall it was pretty good.
I've only been here for their hot dogs, it's pretty good since you get to add your choice of condiments. I've had the spicy polish with about all the condiments on it! Love it.

Westwood is where good restaurant ideas go to die. Chalk it up to the overwhelming cheap student population that frequents the 'wood, or the sub-par walk- and park-ability of the neighborhood, but in my 4 years living in Westwood and 2 living out of it, I've seen a lot of places come and go (recall: U-Dog, Charro Chicken, Olive Garden, Hawaii Ono, Boba World, and Marvin's Diner, to name a few (Source: http://westsidetoday.com/s3-404/westwood-restaurants-come-and.html)). Sadly, I foresee a similar future for The Stand.

To its benefit, The Stand has a few unique items. Its dogs hail from a variety of regions (Midtown, Chicago, Boston, LA (bacon-wrapped....mmmmm)), and there's an OK selection of sausages (Italian, Low-Fat Texas Turkey, Low-Fat Chicken Apple). Add to that a decent representation of American diner classics (Spinach Salad, Baked Beans, Tuna Melt, New York Cheesecake), a few foodie-friendly-ish items (Garlic Mushrooms, Knishes, Apple-Cranberry Cobbler, Stand Honey Blond Ale), and you've got yourself a C menu. Nothing terribly fancy, but there are certainly more boring menus out there.

For lunch today I had the Big Blue Dog, which is a grilled dog with bleu cheese, grilled onions, tomato, and a chipotle bbq sauce. I subbed fries for the chips, and ordered a cream soda.

My first disappointment was the cream soda. On the south wall of the restaurant there is a sign asking, "When was the last time you had cream soda ON TAP?" Well, my answer at 11:45 this morning was Never, and if you were to ask me that right now, it would still be, Never. I was handed a bottle of Thomas Kemper Vanilla Cream soda, and sent on my way. Never mind that it was a good Cream Soda...I felt only slightly deceived.

The dog was a mixed experience. The bun was too small and soft for the amount of ingredients that went into it. It might be more "traditional" to steam a standard-sized bun, but like a good pizza crust, the supporting cast is there to, well, support the star. Buns that are bigger and toasted would do these heavily-loaded dogs greater justice.

As for the main events, the onions were great, the dog itself had a satisfying snap, and the chipotle bbq sauce was so good I almost asked for some for my fries. The fries, however, were the low point of the meal. Undercooked and flacid from sitting under the dog, they were unseasoned and not hot. Both of these are easy problems to fix: fry longer, throw some salt in there, use bigger plates so that the stage isn't so crowded. But the fact that these issues haven't been addressed yet is troubling.

The service was good - the waiter approached us during our meal to ask if everything was OK - and the atmosphere is fun. The fact that they have a liquor license is to their advantage, maugre the restaurant's small size. To ensure that they stay afloat during these tough economic times, they're even doing Dollar Dogs on Monday nights, although I didn't notice any deals on alcohol.

Best of luck, The Stand. Here's to hoping that you don't go the way of Skews.

Will have to go back for the food but the drinks deals are amazing. Sign up for a free Stand Card and get $2 beers and $2 wines all the time. 

Huge assortment of gourmet burger, cheesesteaks, and hot dogs. My kind of place. Look forward to updating.

First of all, why are there 2 entries for The Stand's Westwood location?  Someone please fix this.

Now, I would actually rate The Stand 3 1/2 stars.  It's very cute in a yuppie sort of way, which is ok but not great.  Clean anyway.  As we're "when in Rome" kind of people we had the Stand Dogs.  They were pretty good, but unless you have a coupon, they're too expensive for hot dogs.  You do get chips, whether you really want them or not, which I don't consider a good thing since some of them were crispy, but some were soggy (the worst!) and some were part crispy-part soggy.  Ugh.  Plus they're just tempting unwanted calories daring you to stare at them but not eat.  Good luck.  I suppose they think they're 'giving' you something extra so they can charge you $4-5 for something that should really be $2.50.  Then what really ruined it for me was that I asked for yellow mustard (traditional hot dog stuff, right?) and my husband asked for deli mustard, in addition to the other toppings we each ordered, and yet mine came out with deli mustard and my hubby's with yellow.  This may not sound like a big deal to you, but we don't usually eat junk food, so this was a big foray for us, and I was trying to replicate a Chicago dog (didn't see that they actually have one on the menu) and yellow mustard is crucial.  As soon as I took a bite I said HEY! and looked closer and saw deli mustard.  And we couldn't just trade dogs because I had onions and hubby is allergic.  Either write it down or get it right, please!  We would have sent them back but we were using coupons and didn't want to be unduly demanding.   

So, cute, clean, pretty good food, but too pricey for such low brow fare.  If I want upscale I'm not going to a hot dog place.  If I want a hot dog, I want it good AND appropriately priced.

Amazing! The service is beyond great and the food is fabulous!! Best fries I have had in ages! I am so glad i found this place, it is that good.  I have no clue how it has only 3 stars!? Crazy!  Try it yourself, you will not regret it!

Used to go every month or so, their Monday night Dollar Dog deals were great

Until 2 weeks ago, when I went and they charged full price for all 5 dogs and both beers we ordered (minus 5% off for having my card, gee thanks).  Website still says they do Dollar Dogs on mondays, so I sent a message via their website, and haven't heard a peep.  Terrible customer service, and sadly that overwhelms the fare.

I love this place! I usually get the pastrami sandwich or ribeye sandwich, but this time I got the Chicken Club Sandwich....And I was not disappointed! The bacon is what makes the sandwich....I give this an 8 out of 10!

Been craving a bacon-wrapped hot dog. Imagine my thrill with this new Westwood venue; no need to drive all the way to other side of town for the real deal. 

Unfortunately, it's still the case. 

I ordered the "Downtown LA" dog -- and they forgot my bacon! I brought it up to the person up front and showed it to him. He didn't see it, but he still asked the cook who made it if he added the bacon. The cook said he did. I had to get a fork and move the bell peppers aside to convince the guy there was no bacon. 

The restaurant gets a star for giving me another Downtown LA dog with the key ingredient. But their verson is a skinny hot dog with overcooked bacon and serious condiment overdose. Ultimately became too squishy to eat. Disappointing....

Also bummed you have to pay extra for fries (the standard order comes with chips).

The other star is for cleanliness.

The standard cheese burger is good, fries are okay. Overall the meal was more expensive than I thought it would and should be. Hotdogs look okay, but the cashier told my friend that they were not the best thing to get, so I didn't end up satisfying that craving I had. The special burgers and sandwiches seemed like they would have been better choice.
I ordered a downtown dog and it was pretty good and the service was good.  Overall, the food is good but kinda pricey for a hot dog. :/

Big Red Chili Dog with Slaw: (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/_ewEvGkaCtNMzhqgg7STLA?select=7-sbzGXhxiyw45DHQhq1AA) Spicy beef sausage. Homemade chili. Cheddar cheese. Diced tomatoes.

Verdict: could've been better. Sausage had slight rubbery texture, lacked flavor. Chili was decent. Cheese not melted. Bun fell apart. Got soggy. Didn't try the slaw.

Mushroom Burger + Avocado with Chips: (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/_ewEvGkaCtNMzhqgg7STLA?select=7txt03TXUd1IdktlOv5wZw) Beef pattie. Garlic mushrooms. Swiss cheese. Sliced Tomato. Chipotle BBQ sauce on the side.

Verdict: OK. Mushrooms, cheese, and avocado were good. Burger lacked that char/grilled flavor. Minus points! Wasn't given any BBQ sauce. Homemade chips are always good.

What's the greatest thing about The Stand? They've got poppy seed buns. It sounds bizarre, but as a native Chicagoan, I'm always looking for poppy seed buns whereever I go, and can never find them. The owner (or manager) said they get all of their bread baked especially for their 3 stores, the newest one here in Westwood just opened this week.

A dog with chili, grilled peppers and onions, chips and a coke ran me $6 and change. They have good looking burgers as well, chicken and brisket sandwiches and also salads. But, sadly for the non-meateaters out there, there are no meatless sausages to be had at this joint.

I have a feeling I'll be hitting this place on occasion as it's not far from the office.

I've eaten here a few times and am only now deciding to review it. You can't really go wrong with the burgers, but The Stand has some pretty legit hot dogs and sandwiches as well. Today I ate The Rachel, which is a pastrami sandwich with cole slaw. The verdict: awesome. The bread struck a perfect balance between crispy and soaked-in-butter and the pastrami was just greasy enough to be delicious without being overwhelming. Truthfully, I've never been let down here. Potential downside for all you French fry lovers out there: all burgers are served with chips and not fries. Fries will cost ya extra. Eat it anyway.

I really liked this place.  I had a ABC (Avocado, Bacon, and Cheddar) Burger and fries.  The burger was juicy and well made, but not the best I've ever tasted.  The fries weren't too thick or too thin, and well prepared.  But best of all was the service.   At a place like this you usually don't expect good service, but everyone who worked there was very friendly and our food was brought out really quickly.  

It is a bit more expensive than other hamburger/hot dog places, but it's mostly worth it.  I'll definitely be back, next time I'll try a hot dog.
Probably the only burger I will eat without cheese on it. The quality and the taste of the meat is that good. Fries are excellent too.

Waited for a special night when I thought I could handle a huge calorie rush.  I wasn't disappointed.

My husband had an amazing BBQ burger, and I had one that came with avacado, bacon, and cheese (all my favorite things!).  Super, super, yummy!!  Not the best burger I've ever had, but definitely the best I've had in L.A.!

Service was middle of the road, but while eating this incredible food I didn't care.

We went for burgers today for lunch.  We picked the right spot.  I can't speak for the dogs or sandwiches and such; the fries are just okay.  But the burgers?  Solid.  I don't know what kind or cut of beef they use, but whatever it is, it's the right one.  Again, I can only speak for the burger.  The burger was excellent, (though I didn't get bacon on it because I was advised by the guy behind the counter it was more chewy than crunchy.  I demand crunchy bacon!  That's why we fought a revolution...).

3-10-09 Went back with friends for dinner.  We all had burgers.  It wasn't quite as good as the first time, but still one of the better burgers in town.  In fact, I'd go so far as to say it's a little better than The Counter.

I really struggled with what to give this place....three stars or four stars....three stars or four stars....which one??????

okay four stars

Why?? It is pretty cheap for food that will definitely fill you up and if you fill out a little frequent member
small dog, big price.

I had been craving a burger all week so naturally, my friends and I decided to come here to satisfy my cravings! 

I went and visited UCLA for the day, and my friends (despite going to UCLA), never had this place before. 

Vibe: Diner-esque with kind of a mom-and-pop feel to it with a touch of modern. My friends and I went on a Tuesday night, so there weren't that many people there, although there was a steady stream of traffic throughout our time there (a lot of people grab it to-go). 

The nice thing about this place is that you can place your order online, so it will be ready for you when you come pick it up. When we went there, their internet was down, but were still making it work. 

They have an extensive menu, and I saw that their hot dogs are HUGE from what other people ordered. All three of us went for the burgers, the two of them ordering the burger with fried eggs and egg spread (which they said was delicious) while I, having to stay true to my school, ordered the Berkeley burger (don't ask me why it's called that). My burger had bbq sauce and onion rings as the special added toppings, and it was pretty good to say the least. The burger was a pretty good size, and having a side of small fries with it definitely put me in a food coma. I wished that the fries came with the burger instead of having to order it on the side, and the fries itself wasn't made in the best way. It was still a little too potato-y and soft for my taste, and I wished they cooked it a little longer. 

One thing that is cool is that they have free pickles offered by the soda machine, which I happily grabbed and munched on with my friends as we were hanging out and eating. The fact that there were not too many people at the restaurant really allowed us to hang out and talk with each other, and not feel the pressure of having to leave in order for other people to sit. 

It was a cool place to try, but I don't think I'll come back here again. I don't go to LA very often, and there are too many other things to eat!

Not impressed and actually kind of disappointed.. I've heard great things about The Stand and it turned out to be just another skinny hot dog I could get from a boys scout fundraiser. But at least the atmosphere was fun and their baked chips and knish fries are salty and satsifying. The Stand has a cool retro checkerboard look and a lot of typography art. I ordered a Stand turkey dog with diced tomato, relish, Stand sauce, and onion for $4 minus some coins. You have the option of reguar or poppyseed buns and steamed or grilled dog. The restaurant was pretty packed today but the line moved quickly and service was good. 

I might consider trying one of their burgers next time but I will probably be tempted to just walk ten more steps and get a delicious panini from the cornery bakery instead..

Huge hamburgers that are tasty. My friend and I shared burgers so I got to try the stand and their mushroom burger. We both agreed the stand burger was amazing.

Their fries were also pretty good, the sweeet potato fries were a bit of the thin side.

I warn the reader the following recounted experience was from my drunken visit to this estab. last Friday. 

My weekly drinking buddy, his brother, the girlfriend and I swung into The Stand after consuming some cheap liters of beer at O'hara's up the street. It was only 8 PM and I was not amidst one of my proudest moments. I was craving Asian food, but my friend was hell bent on going here... whatever. 

So we roll in and I timidly approach the counter aghast at the size of the menu above the counter. My paper thin attention span and blurred vision did not serve me well in navigating the relatively fine print. The girls at the counter could likely sense and smell our stupor and pointed us to the much condensed specialty menu at eye level and larger print to the right of the counter. I just went for the first thing on it... apparently their specialty...some kind of bbq meat sandwich.  I really do not recall if it was pork or beef. 

We were then talked into draft beers which they claimed were only $1.50...I honestly have no clue if that was a lie or not...but the price listed for the beer was at least $3. More beer always seems like a great idea in these situations and I was as easy a sell as a spinster in a gigalo store. The beer was delicious by the way...their own honey wheat ale... i think... 

Now I normally can't resist giving women working behind counters a hard time... but put enough beer in me and give me an audience and I'll one up myself and lean a bit over the line. The girlfriend wasn't too amused and in an attempt to shut me up grabbed a plastic cup full of the self service sliced deli pickles for me to nibble on. This worked because if there's anything I love more than flirting it's garlic deli pickles...yummmmmmm. 

The food showed up not too long afterward. I felt like I was high with Dave Chappelle and Co. in the film HALF BAKED...the sandwich was HUGE, and overflowing with thick cut gourmet kettle cooked chips. I just ate and ate until there was nothing left. It was very good... even though I still don't remember what kind of meat I ate.  And of course I overate and completely regretted eating that volume of food. 

Will I go back... you bet!

That's one expensive wiener.  

Like most of you guys, I don't have much experience with wieners, save the occasional Costco Hot Dog special which is near and dear to my heart. 

I rolled in on Friday night after a text from a buzzed friend that simply stated "chili cheese dog".  As a first timer, I didn't know whether to order at the counter and then sit (which seems logical, cause after all it's a gd hot dog place), but they made us sit and have table service which of course means they want a tip. 

I ordered up the Southern Slaw Dog, which required a fork at the end. I will say that the slaw was very good.  I opted for the $1 extra fries, which were typcial. But fellas, $4.50 for just a hot dog? bleh. It's a cool joint, but I ain't going back until them bitches are $1 special. 

Oh and I had tummy ache rest of night.

So my co-worker and I go to pick up our phone order and come to a place where there are a bunch of blank stares from employees saying, "We don't have a phone order.  Are you sure you called the right place?  We do have one in Century City, ya know...".  My co-worker swears up & down she called this location so she calls the Century City "Stand" to check and the person on the phone tells her they do not have an order either.  Hmmm.  Something bizarre is going on here.

"Did you get the person's name?", I asked.
"No, but it was a guy's voice.", she replied.

Funny enough, all three of the male workers at this joint are acting as if they don't see us when there are only four people in the entire restaurant including me and her at 2:30pm.

What's up with the customer service?  An assistant manager is basically trying to compensate the loss of our lunch time by putting a "RUSH" to our order...which is probably why I ended up with a burger that had a very pink, almost bloody center - ew!  I like my burgers and steaks medium well, not rare!  I didn't want to call and complain because I'm sure my phone call would be non-existent.

Bottom line: food is subpar, overpriced and they really need to hire more honest employees.

When deciding to have a burger, there are certain caveats that go through my  mind, chief among them: 
Man, this is a lot of calories, so this better be good.

I've had Umami burger quite a few times, Comme ca a few times, Pie n Burger. Those are my LA faves. 

But i'm not a snob in this regard as I frankly love Big Macs when the mood strikes. Just make it tasty.

I can't put it more plainly: 
The Stand has one of the most bland and tasteless burgers I think I've ever had outside a school cafeteria. 

But don't associate it with cafeterias: the burger looks edible. It has its own sauce, cheese (not american, which is their first mistake), what appears to be fresh chuck, and grilled onions (my preference is raw, but I don't mind either).

What is missing is seasoning. If there is any, it completely missed the meat. I literally ate half the burger. My interest in the whole thing shut down after about the 3rd bite.

The fries are equally bland, and a bit too largely cut for my taste.

What elevates this to a two star and not a one star is the Big Red Chili Dog. The taste of the dog is spicy and has a nice pop. The chili is "meh, ok" and the bun almost certainly is store bought., But it's not a bad hot dog. I'd have it again, if I ever had to revisit this restaurant.

But it doesn't save the damage done from the burger. I would say it's a bad thing if I leave your restaurant regretting eating the burger, because now I'm still hankering for a burger, instead of being satisfied with the Stand.

Such is life, I suppose. If you eat here, enjoy the hot dogs. But you'll be unsatisfied with the burger.

If you don't enjoy your food here, I have a feeling you just don't know how to handle your hot dog. I like The Stand. I like the idea of hot dog stands even more than I like The Stand. One of my earliest memories was a dog at Nathan's and my dad explainin

Got the bbq brisket sandwich bar delivered to my work.  Though the yelp reviews were pretty mediocre, I decided that they were mostly for hotdog related incidences and plus everyone was craving a bbq pulled-meat style sandwich.

These totally hit the spot!  Everyone talked about how great they were all day (felt sorry for the one non-meat eater who couldn't partake), though a few people put in some solid time in the bathroom.  I, in my ever quest to be healthier, took my meat off the roll and wrapped it up in the big lettuce they include, and though the bread was obviously the yummier choice, the lettuce wrapped meat was super delicious!  My boss went for 'chip wraps' by scooping the meat off her sandwich with the homemade potato chips.  One dude ate his sandwich then parked at a bowl of chips and went to town.  He works out a lot. 

Anyway, our experience was fantastic and we will definitely be having these again, once we forget how heavy they were.  As for the hotdogs, one of my coworkers asked where we got these fabulous sandwiches and when I told her "The Stand", she said "oh yeah, the place with the crappy hot dogs." So maybe just go for the kick ass brisket sandwiches!

A no frills burger and hot dog joint with a diner feel.  Lots of options for toppings on both burgers and dogs, definitely a step above fast food for just about the same price.  An easy walk from UCLA, its a no brainer when you need a quick burger fix in Westwood.
Had the chicken apple sausage, which was okay.. I enjoyed the chips that came with it much more -- I love thick kettle-style chips! The fire fries were legit too. Prices are great for the area.

I'd been wanting to try the Stand ever since seeing some pictures a friend of mine had posted on Facebook. I finally got a chance to try it last week, and while I wasn't impressed, I wasn't too disappointed either.

They have a pretty large hot dog and burger menu, as well as allowing you to customize your dog anyway you want it. I ordered the DTLA dog, and I was a bit disappointed, as the dogs I'd gotten from street vendors BLEW the Stand out of the water. Additionally my dog was steamed when it was advertised to be grilled, which annoyed me. It was filling though, and their baked beans were pretty good as well. My girlfriend ordered a side of chips which seemed to be freshly prepared and well seasoned.

I'll likely be back as the Stand is relatively cheap and was a lot more filling than I had expected to be after eating just a hot dog. I'll be trying a chili dog or burger next!

What a great place! Great service, too.

Westwood doesn't seem to have too many offerings for budget-minded UCLA graduate students (and it seems like eveyone is budget-minded at UCLA these days, hardy har har.)

Eat more hot dogs.

In the midst of Westwood Village we find The Stand, right in between the UCLA campus and bustling Wilshire Blvd. corporate offices.  In a bridging-the-gap fashion, the primary clientele here are young professionals, some of whom are recent grads of UCLA.  The other diners (like myself) are UCLA staff and students.  The cost of the food here matches that demographic: a stand(ard) burger with fries and drink will set you back about $9 after tax, a significant jump from the In-and-Outs of fast food affair.

Nevertheless, the menu selection is vast and I'm tempted to try so many things on it.  Thus far, I have had many of the hot dogs and brats.  They are cooked well, and have a variety of toppings to go with them.  I'm a fan of the chili dog, it's nice and chunky and doesn't make too much of a mess in your tray.  The sauerkraut was disappointing, it tasted like wet cabbage to me.

On my last trip I ordered the turkey burger per Traci T.'s recommendation.  Normally I wouldn't dare try a non-beef burger but I was in an experimental mood.  Anyways, I was pleasantly surprised by it.  It was crispy on the outside and moist and flavorful on the inside, and not at all a dry turkey sandwich that I had envisioned.  I'll definitely consider ordering it next time.

The locale is best for people who work/live around the area, as Westwood parking is tough to find and expensive.  It's relatively small but I enjoy the many TVs with ESPN along the walls.  I haven't tried the specialty drinks and beers yet, so I'll have something to look forward to when I enter into corporate America.

Overall: I like the food, prices, ambiance, speed of service, and friendly service.

The Good:
  - chili dog
  - french fries (they're worth the extra dollar)
  - hamburgers (while I've never had one, the place was packed with customers chowing down on burgers, so I'm assuming it must be good)

The Okay:
  - homemade chips (that come standard with meals; they're a little too hard)

The Bad:
  - PARKING

Decent Food.
Decent Value.
Parking...Westwood. There's a parking structure on Broxton.

Used the $2 off coupon from the Student Dollar Stretcher to get the Stand's "ABC" Burger. Avocado bacon cheese (?) burger. Good stuff, cannot go wrong. Good size, probably either a third pound or a quarter pound patty. Plenty of avocado and bacon. 
I got the chips with it, which was decent but cold. Like baked potato chips, did not know why I did not know that when I was ordering. 
That came out to about $9.

The cashier gave me a sample of their root beer, which was cool.

Got lots of TVs. 

Like a higher-class version of Carl's Jr.

I don't eat hot dogs often, but I absolutely loved the Chicago Dog at The Stand. Although this combo is offered at many hot dog places, I can say this is one of the FRESHEST hot dog I've ever eaten. Maybe I'm used to knowing that hot dog places aren't known to be very healthy, but the onions, jalapenos, tomatoes, and green peppers were VERY fresh and crisp, that I almost forgot I was eating a hot dog for a sec. The poppyseed bun was amazing as well, and everything about the dog just complimented each other.

I got the sweet pot fries as well. A bit too fried for my taste, but I loved the potato itself.

Boyfriend got the DTLA dog which was pretty standard, and the buffalo hot fries. They were WAY too hot and definitely burned our tongues. Wouldn't recommend getting that.

Note: They have $1 hot dogs on Mondays!!
Had their bacon cheeseburger with a fried egg... awesome!  Would definelty stop by again when I'm in Westwood.

I was a little hesitant to go inside for dinner when I saw that I would be the only customer there, but I had been wanting to try this place since it opened, especially when I heard about the $1 happy hour hot dog special. 

Well, turns out that special only exists on Monday nights! So instead, 2 hot dogs and 1 soft drink costed $16! I would have gone to Chipotle if I knew I would be spending that much on a hot dog. For a new business trying to make it in a college town with an extremely high turnover rate, that's just plain expensive. I tried the Apple-turkey dog and tasted the chili dog, both of which were fine, but nothing I'd go back to have again. 

It was just good, not great. I don't see this place lasting more than a year in Westwood.

I had the Stand burger with fries. The meat was good quality, very juicy. I did not know that you had to ask for cheese, so I skimped but I think with the cheese the meal would be much more enjoyable. The fries were fried very well. I think I enjoyed the fries more. Its another burger joint, my only qualm was it was a little mediocre for the price that it was. I was expecting a more gourmet burger but it was good. The roll/bun on the burger was the best part. The bread soaked up all the juices of the burger and was still a little crunchy with soft breadiness. I enjoyed the roll very much, more so than the burger. I think if I were to eat another burger, the bread would outshine the other parts as well. Its also got an older feel, not so young and hip friendly as the other spots in Westwood, with some old burger joint feel, music was from the "oldies" era.

Oh, yes.  I've been trying for a while to get over to try this place and tonight was the big night.  I went for the chili dog and some tortilla soup.  Both were excellent!  I'm so excited to have this joint near home.  Next time, I'm saving room for dessert!

MONDAY MONDAY MONDAY!

The only day I'd go here. $2 for a beef dog + 3 premium toppings + unlimited regular toppings/sauce!!!! damn, can't hate on that.

I especially like the hefty serving of avocado they give you. 

I assumed this was a place that looked better than it was, but the monday deal was too good.

This place is not bad price for the quality of burger you get.

I tried the Patty Melt and was pleasantly surprised. It's kind of my thing to try Patty Melt's everywhere.

Well the reason for 4 stars is that my fresh chips were kind of on the chewy side. Half potato half Crisp, good if you're into that.

I believe they had really good iced tea which I am a fan of iced tea.

2$ off when you check in with Yelp, sweet.
Service is good and food comes out fast. I've never tried their hot dogs, but the ultimate egg burger (with bacon!) is pretty dang tasty and the steak fries were mmmmm delightful.

We came here after visiting a friend over at UCLA Medical Center.  We actually wanted to go to Noodle Planet next door, but saw the cash only sign and came in here instead.

I ordered the classic cheeseburger with fries and split an order of chili-cheese fries with the gang.  I have to say, the chili on the fries was actually very tasty.  My burger was served medium and it was okay (though I was never asked how I liked my burger served).  Nothing mind-blowing or extraordinary about it.  Also ordered a root beer that they serve on draft.  It was sweeter than most and lacked that bite I like in my root beer.

Overall, I found the food just average.

I work nearby and love visiting this place. I like the chicken sandwich and the sweet potato fries- not to mention the free pickles! They are fast and I am able to spend 10 minutes walking to and from and eat in the hour I have. Overall, one of my Westwood favs!

extremely overrated and overpriced hot dog. westwood could have used a good dog place but alas, no such luck. flavor-less and no contest to my fave dog place of all time -- top dog in berkeley!

full review: http://njeats.blogspot.com/2008/04/what-will-it-take-to-find-good-hot-dog.html
prefer the encino location  since this one seems dirty  and having a stand card only saves pennies on the food not drink  this location is convenient drive

$1 Mondays, you never fail me.  I went here tonight (thanks for putting this idea in my head, John M.  NOT!!) and bought 4 stand dogs with my STANDard (get it?) ketchup, mustard, and mayo (can you even have a hot dog without mayo?  Well, you can, but it's no good).

The little cashier girl was complaining to her coworker about how it's about to get crowded and sighed when people started walking in.  She turned to me and said, "Oh but we don't mind that you're here.  You're hot!"

Looks like I have yet another reason to come back...

First, I'll admit, this place is not really 5 stars, but I don't think it deserves the 3 stars it currently has on yelp, so my rating is a bit inflated. The family and I were stuck on Westwood on a Friday afternoon. If you know anything about LA, it is that freeways are toxic at this time of the day. So we decided to just hang out around the area and find dinner. A quick glance through yelp shows that this area is pretty weak as far as food goes. There was the typical fast food joint that we try to avoid, and there were some high end eateries but all in all nothing that really jumped out. Then we saw this place and found it only has three starts, but we figured how can you go wrong with burgrers , so we gave it a try. It did not disappoint. Aside from the great service that we go, I thought my burgers was great. I added chipoptle to it and was not too overpowering and all. The wife had a chicken burger with onion and avocado and was also great. It wasn't like the best burger and it was a bit on the expensive side but considering the location I'd said it was worth a visit. Then again maybe UCLA students just have high standard for food and that would explain all the bad reviews around Westwood, I guess I'll never know

I've always wanted to try one of those hot dogs you can get outside of clubs in the wee hours of the morning. You know, the ones that come wrapped in bacon and smothered in peppers and condiments. The Stand has made my dream come true.

The Stand offers a Downtown L.A. dog: beef or turkey (yay! I'll eat a turkey dog), bacon, peppers, onions, mustard, ketchup, and mayo(!). It comes with a side of incredible homemade potato chips. Good for you? No, but good. Very good with the draft root beer they offer.

I used to absolutely love the stand and my boyfriend and i would go there a few times a month!  they have good burgers, chicken sandwiches and sweet potato fries. things are well priced at under $10 per entree.

 if you had asked me a month ago, i would have given the stand 5 stars however on my most recent visit I ordered their southwest chicken salad and the lettuce was dirty!  like it was really dirty.  it looked like dirt had been sprinkled all over it.  i asked the cashier to come look because i wasn't sure what else to do and he kind of just brushed me off and said he didn't know and then he went and got the cook from the kitchen.  he also seemed apathetic towards talking to me and i felt bad so i asked if perhaps it was pepper or some other spice even though it was clearly dirt.  he said no and that it must be dirt but that they are supposed to wash their lettuce so he didn't know how it happened.  he didn't say they DID wash it, just that they were supposed to!!  

overall, it was just an awkward situation because neither the cook nor the cashier seemed at all concerned about the dirty lettuce and though they ended up replacing my salad with a sandwich i had lost my appetite and felt bad for complaining so overall 3 stars.  i would go back for a burger but not anytime soon probably and most likely not to this location.

i've ordered food for catering and also ate in for dinner. the service is great. when they delivered the food for a catered event, i think the manager came along to help deliver and gave us a bunch of plates, napkins, utensils, and huge buckets of sauce. we got the sandwich platters and they did as much as they could to make sure we were happy with our order.
when i sat in, i was so happy that we could specialize our burgers. i got a veggie burger, which i normally don't really like, but really enjoyed it here. their turkey sandwich is also amazing. but what blew my mind was the MAC N CHEESE. WOW. i got it as a side and thought it was life changing.

amazing place.

The first time I heard of the Stand was when a friend mentioned $1 hotdogs while walking down Broxton. We didn't go to the Stand that night but did try it out recently at lunch. We both ordered burgers with fries and tried the draft root beer. Everything was exceptional. The burger was done just right and tasted amazing. The fries are crisp and tasty. The root beer was very, very good as well. We were thoroughly impressed by the food here and the service was not far behind either.

The decor inside is very interesting and has that old school diner feel but with nice plasma screens that monitor the game-du-jour. 

We have since been back another time and this time we tried the shakes, root beer floats and some more of the draft root beer. Everything tasted amazing still which is why I am not a fan of the Stand!

A fun little place with a thousand customizable hot dogs. There's nothing I love more than chowing down on specialty hot dogs, but I didn't love their Chicago dog, and their Southern slaw dog was good, but not amazing. Their prices are good and the draft root beer is delicious, and I would eat here again if I was in the neighborhood, but it's not something I'm going to search out for. Which is a shame because I had really high hopes.

Well, the food at this place gets 3 stars, but what takes it up to 4 is the exemplary service. My sister and I came here today to grab a quick bite to eat for lunch. We had both been to the one in Encino and knew that we liked their food. I had a turkey burger which was really good. My sister ordered some sort of sausage. The food came out and was at our table very quickly. The guy from the counter remembered who ordered what and made sure to give us the correct items. As my sister bit into hers, she realized that as much as she wanted that sausage, she couldn't eat it. She has all kinds of stomach problems and sometimes, she just can't eat. So, she took it to the guy and explained the problem. She was totally shocked when he tried to give her her money back. I mean, it wasn't their fault in the least bit. But not satisfied with her not being able to eat, he asked if there was anything else he could get for her. Finally, he got her to accept some cut fruit which she was actually able to eat. The whole time Marcel was patient with her and helpful, something that you rarely find in these restaurants where you order from the counter. She has this problem all of the time when she tries to eat out, and she has encountered several really negative attitudes. She never asks for the money back, and this is one of the first times anyone has ever offered. We were very touched with the way they responded to her. Their attention to customer service was truly above and beyond.

It's fine as far as dogs and burgers go, but nothing stands out about this place. Been a couple times for some cheap honey blonde ale, but that's about it.  They do have some good deals, and I get emails also all the time about deals, which makes me think business isn't good...for a reason.  Probably won't go back here unless I'm dragged by some unknowing friend.
Pretty average food. Nothing special.

I always love me a good burger and burgers that are made to order are my absolute favorite. Combine a good selection of beers and some TVs for sports loving fans and you've got yourself the perfect spot for some beef and baseball. 

The Stand has got it all and more. With fast, friendly and efficient service where you order what you like and how you like it, you can come here for a good meal on the go. With a variety of ways to choose your burger, from the ABC (a burger with Avocado, bacon and Cheese) to your standard Stand style you'll be overwhelmed with choices to fill your stomach which will definitely start grumbling when you see this menu. Substitute a veggie burger or turkey burger (my new found favorite) into any of their concoctions. 

Even better, make your own! Start from scratch with your own choice of patty and add a multitude of things from their list, including different types of buns, good sauces, cheese, veggies and so much more. Mix up how you want your side from coleslaw to chips to of course French Fries! Pick out a soda drink and grab some of their delicious sliced pickles while your there to munch on as you wait the very short amount of time for them to bring your succulent patty, or add those slices to your bouncing burger when it arrives for an extra extra kick.

Choose one of their countless beers or even wines, to go with your mile high meal. From Heffewiezen and Blue Moon to New Castle and Fat TIre they've got you covered in the thirst department. Or maybe you're not into the whole hamburger phenomenon and want to go old school with a few pitchers, a few pitches and a few hot dogs. Feel like you're in the stadium with their many flat screen TVs that are positioned for all viewing angles as you munch on their wonder dogs. 

With a great selection of everything you could want out of a beef joint (TVS, beverages and of course MEATS, baby) you'll be truly satiated here. Oh, and did I mention...Cheap. Cheap and fantastic, what's more to love?

The food here is generally good. The service is a bit spotty though. I had the brat dog (if that is indeed the name)... bratwurst with sauerkraut. I had it come with chips and a root-beer float. There were two cashiers serving us. The one who served me left afterward and one guy stayed. The latter guy was kind of annoying.

The dogs took a bit long to come out but my friend's dog came incorrectly (i.e. split and without the veggies she asked for). We waited about 10-15 min for her dog though there was only one other ordering customer. Mine came out 5 min after. The guy came back 5 min later after giving mine with a smile on his face... obviously to hit on my friend. "OH! Did I get your order wrong..." Blah blah. My friend said it was fine and he said he'd bring another one even though she would eat what she had as she was pressed for time. All this time I still hadn't gotten my root beer float. (And Tina MAD, Tina SMASH when thirsty!) While he was asking her about the dog, giving all those cheesy smiles. Blech. I said I also hadn't gotten my root-beer float yet and he shot an ugly glance at me. Gee thanks, asshole! I just want what I paid for! Sorry to rain on your parade but your job should come first. Because of that this review is -1 star. 

I haven't had the burger yet but I'll try it sometime... hopefully that same guy won't be there. The food generally seems pretty good... the only thing that seemed kinda expensive were the shake and root-beer float (~$4 and ~$3.50 respectively... to put that in perspective the sausage/dog meal/sandwich was less than $5).

Oh. My. God. The veggie burgers here deserve that reaction. I really appreciate building my own burger and everything was fresh, yummy and cheap. I love having plenty of space, no rush from a waiter and $2 house ales. TWO. FREAKING. DOLLARS. 
I could certainly do without the throw-away style of the packaging for the food. Its VERY wasteful and useless, nonsensical. But you are cheap, maybe that's how. I wouldn't mind paying a buck or two more if you changed to reusable dishware, please.
Not one person had a complaint about their food or sides. I can't wait to drive all the way across town to dive into a big ol' veggie burger from here again.

Good Food at Reasonable Prices

The Stand is Hamburgers and Hot Dogs!  Though they also have salads and other sandwiches (sausage, brisket), it's all about the different Burgers and Dogs they can fix up.

The burgers are filling, though not the quality of say, In N Out.  The hot dogs are pretty good and they are creative in the types of prepared hot dogs you can order.  For example, the Chicago Dog and Downtown LA Dog come with some delicious toppings.

The fries are good and the loaded fries are better (chili and cheese).  Again, the food is not great but good for satisfying hunger.

I love the Stand and often go to the one in Encino. My friends and I happened to be in Westwood, so we decided to go to the Stand for dinner. It's Saturday night by the way, shouldn't this be one of their busier times?

We arrived and 4 people were in front of us waiting to order. There was 1 cashier and 1 person in the kitchen. THAT'S IT. it took 20 minutes just to ORDER. It was mind-boggling how understaffed they were. In fact, it was shameful. That's no way to run a business. Once we finally ordered, it took another 20 minutes at least to get the food. The food wasn't even brought out all at the same time. I was one of the first people to get my food and probably 15 minutes later, the last person received their food.

Everyone did enjoy their meal (thankfully) and hopefully it's not always like thisl

I have been in all the "best burgers" places in LA, like Apple Pan, Fathers Office, etc... and this is by far my favorite. The hamburgers and the fries are awesome. Seriously I do not understand why is not better rated.

I have friends that are absolutely obsessed with The Stand.  It's a burger/hot dog joint in Westwood village, very close to UCLA.

You can sign up for a free stand card which gives you some discounts (like $2 Honeyblonde beer--my favorite thing on their entire menu!)

Mondays are dollar dogs nights and very busy.  You can load hot dogs with lots of toppings.  They also have premade combinations of toppings, which are generally really good. They also have pretty tasty burgers as well.  The sides are a little on the expensive side but definitely make your mouth happy.  

I love the cobbler with ice cream, the small size was pretty filling, even though at first glance, it seemed like a small portion.

I used to be a big proponent of this place, especially because of my deep roots with the encino location. It took a while for this location to get it together, but now that my grace period is over, I can speak. The food is about as good as the other places, but it's a very crammed space. I could deal with it before, but now they just added table service. I was fine ordering in a line, even if I had to wait five minutes. Now, there's people roaming all over the place and it's very claustrophobic. Now, it's too noisy and too intrusive. I won't come back until they drop the waiters.
Awesome Burgers and Pastrami Place. Sweet potato fries please and Monday Night Dollar Dogs from 5pm-close FTW!

I measure a hot dog stand by the quality of their Chili Cheese dogs. I classify them into three categories, a destination dog, a local dog or a dirty dog.

In my book, it is the chili that sets the bar for a hot dog stand. I prefer the type of chili that is thick, full and meaty flavorful. You know, that type of chili that if you glance at the cute pup sitting a few tables down for a moment to long the chili starts to coagulate into a messy goodness.

I found the chili served at the Stand to be a shade to close to a tomato sauce in taste and there was really nothing hearty and meaty about it.  The size of the dog, the taste of the dog and the chili was underwhelming.

If you were in the area and craving a dog just because, then this place may be a good Stand in, clearly a local dog, but not a destination dog for me.
Best burgers around.  The fries are tasty.  The workers are cool.  Great vibe in this place.  Perfect for casual lunch.  Not a work lunch kind of place.  We all had great food.  I would go back.
Had the Southwest chicken salad for lunch - it was huge and I usually finish my plate, but didn't.  It was good.

It was first weekend free museums courtesy of Bank of America, so my husband and I decided to head over to the Westside to visit the Hammer -- a place neither of us had been to.  We were going to go early afternoon, but on the ride over, we started to realize we hadn't eaten anything since early yesterday, and it was time to fix our blood sugar levels.

That's when I uttered under my breath, "Oh, I wish there was a place like The Stand [in Encino], because i can really just use a good hot dog and some fries.  And some pickles."  Hmmm, maybe we should just Yelp?

So, we parked at the Hammer and proceeded to see what Yelp would take us.  And, just like it was the hand of God, fate presented us Westwood's The Stand, literally a block away.  I could not believe it.

Thinking it was too good to be true, on the walk over, I was half expecting the place to be closed for the weekend, or anything but open, but not only was it open, it was just the beginning of the lunch rush, so we got there at a perfect time.

We both shared a chili dog, a brat, and some fries.  YU-UUUUMMMM.  It was really all we needed, and the price was just what we needed, too.

And, the exhibit at the Hammer was tremendous, I'm glad we caught it while it was still open.  Altogether, it was a great day to hang out in Westwood.  I highly recommend!

Now, Tha Stand... you just gotta move closer to Burbank...... okay????

the stand was pretty delish to me. probably because it's a rarity since the bay area doesn't offer the stand.

i tried the classic burger my first time there. nothing special, but it was really good. i loved the grilled onions the chips were good but kinda on the burnt side. but im sure it would've been more satisfying if it was made correctly. 

i just love the simpleness of this fulfilling meal. good for big appetites.  i was a happy camper after i finished my meal.

i will definitely try to come back when i visit LA again.

I went here twice and had salads each time.  They *smother* your salad in dressing by default, which doesn't suit the tastes of many people, including my own.   The first time I went, they smothered my Caesar salad with dressing.   I think any decent establishment should always let the customer handle their own salad dressing as a matter of basic courtesy - this is how it's done at fast food places like Carl's Jr. and this is also how it's done at upscale restaurants. 

The second time I went, I made sure to tell them to put the dressing on the on the side and they did so.  The salad was about 4 times better when I was actually able to taste the salad components.

The staff is friendly and are happy to customize your food to order.  The place is extremely clean and the atmosphere is cozy.  I wouldn't bring a date there, but it's a good place to grab a burger with your buddies.

While I was surprised at the quality of the burgers (they were much better than I thought they were going to be).  However, I think that they're a bit overpriced for what you get.  

I'd go again- but it wouldn't be my first choice.

went to the stand for a late lunch with my friend today , It's really nice comfy environment,it's not one of the whole in the wall restaurant type places either, It's roomy. I'm a bit of a clean freak so I really liked the way everything was organized and clean.  I got the mushroom burgerI LOVEEE mushrooms so I found the burger delicious, couldn't finish it so I got it to go, it's a decent size, I can never finish anything to begin with, but I'm sure anyone else would be able to finish it. 

The cashier was super friendly, I really wanted a chicken apple sausage , but they ran out =( was a bit bummed, been dying to try it at this place.
Guess I'll have to go back next time

I first tried this place about 4 years ago and I was so excited to finally try it.  I felt a little disappointed, especially since a few of my coworkers ordered from here nearly daily.  The second time coming through here I took a coworker and he talked about how he's always wanted to eat here but he too was let down.  Some stuff was hit or miss and the chips were really hard, they tasted stale at one point.  
I don't know exactly what it is, but some of their stuff just doesn't taste good to me. 

I really wanted to like this place because all the staff were really nice friendly people. Maybe I'll try another dish and see how that goes.

It was rather difficult getting to this area because of all the traffic. I stumbled onto this place in search of a place to sit down before I went about my evening.

While inside: I enjoyed the ambiance; it reminded of my college days.

The Food: Decent enough. I'm a big fan of burgers and I was very much satisfied.

I've given this place way too many second chances.  First of all, let's get this straight, their food is bland and overpriced for how they taste.  I've had their burgers and hot dogs.  So they have this Monday $1 hot dog special.  A couple months back, it was really busy that Monday when I went in for the special.  I order a few hot dogs and ended up waiting for over 20 minutes for them.  So I walk up and ask where my order was.  Granted that it was busy, they obviously forgot.
