But what ticked me off was that the cashier was telling me how I shouldn't be waiting and should say something earlier next time.  No apology whatsoever and I expected one.  He turned it around and made it seem like it was my fault for waiting so long before speaking up.  Are you serious??  That stopped me from going there until recently.  I got tempted with the Monday special.

So today will be my last visit.  I'm ordering the $1 hot dog and saying what I wanted on it.  When I was almost done, I totally forgot one ingredient that I wanted on all of them and I apologized but the cashier totally gave me attitude like I just screwed up big time.  Sure I did but there was no one else waiting in line and the place was basically empty.  I was so close to calling her out on her attitude but I can totally see her purposely picking her nose when wrapping up my hot dogs, so I held myself.  In the end, their food is bland and customer service is non-existent.  Just plain rude people.  I don't care if I mess up my order 10 times, you still have to be courteous to me, the customer.  Ridiculous.

I would normally put a 5 star for this place, but they recently removed their special - chicken sandwich with fire-sause, blue cheese, cold slaw, and their home-made chips!  SERIOUSLY the BEST sandwich I've ever eaten and would go back twice a week if they had it still!!  I would pay more money than the price (if the sause cost is the issue). The fire-fries were amazing as well!
The guys there are so friendly and all say they love the sause and want it back as well.  I've heard that tons of people have been disappointed. 
BRING BACK THE SAUSE!  
loving customer.

My company usually orders from here about once every 2 weeks. I've had hotdogs, burgers & salads from this place.

Hot Dogs - VERY underwhelming .  I was kind of shocked. The meat just wasn't that great and it just felt like I was eating a heated up hebrew national (except not as good) 

Salad's - Pretty decent, the lettuce & veggies are always fresh . . . but who wants to have a salad at a hotdog place?

Burgers - They seem to have this going for them. Every burger I've had was cooked great. NOTE: If you like your burger medium, make sure to state that or else they will cook the s*** out of it.

Overall, I still eat at this place and it still satisfies me. If you want a REAL Hotdog. Drive down to Fab's Hotdogs in Tarzana, CA

turkey hot dog was whatevers. felt pretty healthy though
chicken tortilla soup was really good, but a little on the salty side

the decor i love, makes me think of old fashioned stuff because it's so sepia ish
More than decent prices on their house draft all day every day. A good variety of beers for casual to intermediate palates
Pretty good dog.They give you the option of either steamed or grilled,I like that. The toppings are numerous.Decent place,parking may be hard at times.

My opinion of hot dog consumption varies by the day - certain hot dog eating instances have me proclaiming that those packed-in tube sausages are merely hooves and snouts and three different meats all in one wrapped in skin. Granted, to some people that sounds like a five star meal. 

At other times, however, my secret carniverous junk-food loving foodie personality pops out and a hot dog stand turns into the gates of heaven. Who knows, I might have some gremlin living in my stomach and this could turn into a scene straight out of Aliens.

Regardless, during my first visit to The Stand, I left with the front doors glowing and angels singing. Gremlin was very happy. Culprit: Loaded Dog with cheddar cheese and mushrooms. It's all about the perfect combination here and I scored big time. The cheese came melted and gooey, and I kept wondering what the heck tasted like a glorious garlic wonderland? Ah - the mushrooms! Those sneaky menu writers never mentioned they were grilled in magic juice. droooollarrrghghhlll (aka - uncrontrollable drooling - post hot dog).

Yeah yeah it might be a bit pricey, but if you can get V to down a hot dog, want another, and dream about it ever since, it's worth every pretty penny.

This place has a great foursquare deal on burgers if you check-in, $2 off.

I really love the burgers and fries here with a variety of options. In'n Out is great, but if you're looking for something like a Chili Cheeseburger, this is the place.

Not just any sandwich would inspire me to write a review as soon as I went to eat, but just a few hours ago, I met (or rather, ate) such a sandwich. 

My colleague and friend, Diane insisted we go here because she loved this sandwich so much she wrote notes to the owner and emailed and called multiple times begging him to bring it back even if he had to charge more to make it profitable. So, when he finally brought it back, he emailed her this morning and given she was leaving for Costa Rica tomorrow, she had to go today. Here is where I come in. 

See the pics I post. But this was a "back by popular demand" sandwich on their special menu. The chicken buffalo sandwich, topped with coleslaw, blue cheese sauce and spicy tangy buffalo sauce and coleslaw and potato chips. I know this sounds weird, but it worked well! Keep in mind that this is probably the MESSIEST sandwich ever! So, don't order it if you want to be "dainty".  $8.99

I also recommend the fire fries. Same buffalo sauce but on the fries. So yummy! 

And, the dill pickles are a given. They're free to serve yourself and over on the side by the drink dispenser. 

SO GO!!! Delicious and who knows if they will take it off the menu again.

The stand honestly isn't deserving of a 3 star rating as mentioned by another yelper.  I honestly think it's more of a 4 star establishment. It would seem that this restaurant is yet again another victim of yelp bullies. Their food is tons better than fast food and way cheaper than all the other sit down restaurants in westwood.  

What I got
Cilantro lime chicken sandwich:
this sandwich was really good and what really made it was that freakin sauce!!! it was PHENOMENAL. like seriously crack to me!!   

Sure it was more expensive than the other chicken sandwiches, but hey I wanted something with FLAVOR! if I wanted something on the plain side, then I would've chosen their regular chicken sandwich.  But why would I do that?? It would be plain and it's not like  I could complain. I ordered it lol.  Obviously if you don't want something plain then you should order something that has more oomph.

On Monday nights The Stand has $1 hot dogs that are actually pretty good. They have all sorts of choices for toppings and you can't argue with the price. I haven't had anything else on the menu but this is an awesome deal.

Yes, they have an almost frighteningly large menu for what is seemingly just a hot dog joint -- dogs and burgers and sausages and protein platters and salads and then a bunch of amazing-looking desserts.  But this menu does practically demand you try something new -- that large menu would just seem like a waste otherwise.

I figured that, as I was at what is commonly viewed as a hot dog joint, I should get a hot dog.  But since my hot dog heart belongs to Dodger Dogs, I went healthy and got a low-fat turkey dog (you can choose from beef, turkey, kosher, or Big Red; you can also choose between beef and turkey for burgers).  Could I tell the difference?  No.  I got splashy with my toppings, though -- a Chicago dog.  Per the menu -- STEAMED DOG, PICKLES, DICED YELLOW ONIONS, DICED TOMATO, NEON RELISH, SPORT PEPPERS, MUSTARD & CELERY SALT.  In a word?  Delicious.  On a thick poppy seed bun, added ketchup, can't miss.  Comes with Stand Chips (just how I like em, thick and crunchy).  I added a healthy side -- fruit salad (standard melon and pineapple, still good).  With a Diet Coke, came in under ten bucks.

Allie got a Cheeseburger (turkey) and it looked amazing.  She got fries to go with it, and while the fries don't look impressive, the one I stole was delicious -- had a little extra kick to it.

We rounded it off by splitting a chocolate chip cookie, which was just about perfect.  

The help was really nice and very helpful.  We waited a little longer than I would have liked to get our food (but it was 9:15 and they seemed to be closing up slowly).  The booths are comfy and they have lots of tables.  The be-framed postered walls are a little silly, especially since everything is so new, but it's hard to not look up at one of the advertised items on the posters and not get a tingle in your tummy.

All in all, a solid bet.  Try it for lunch or a quick dinner in Westwood.

This place opened about a month ago in Westwood. Let's hope it'll survive because there tends to be a quick turnover rate at this particular address (it has sold Pho and Spaghetti in the past year & half). What I first noticed (besides that there was a new restaurant in Westwood) is how The Stand was decorated. It kind of has a 1950's feel...but with 3 or 4 flat screen t.v. Awesome. 

I had the Downtown L.A. dog. For like 6 bucks, you get a hot dog (you also have the option of getting a turkey dog instead), wrapped with bacon, and filled with bell peppers, onions, mayo, and ketchup and a side of chips. Um, the biggest heart attack you can imagine... but totally worth it!! Although, I definitely have had better hot dogs at a cheaper rate (San Francisco's street vendors on 24th and Mission) I think I'd go back to the Stand. At least I know the food is clean! The prices are average for Westwood and the menu is extensive enough  (also have burgers which my boyfriend actually quite enjoyed) to meet most people's likes and cravings. 

If you and your friends have left Maloney's a bit earlier on Thurs, try going to the Stand.

My kind of place.  Fresh root beer and Cream Soda on TAP, ya'll.  Yeah, I'm a freak like that.  Hot dogs, hamburgers, sandwiches and an old skool vibe with brown leather booths and checkered table cloths.  My hot dog was delish.  The service was nice.  The price was decent.  Now - if they would just take those damned tv's off the wall.  Do they think people can no longer enjoy themselves in restaurants unless a tv is showing the World Poker Championships?  Please.  Enough already.
Hit and miss service, but the ABC burger is outstanding.

The Stand is a nice place but gets overshadowed with a bunch of small shops like it in Westwood Village.  The food is good but I haven't tried any of the crazier things on the wall of menus.  Thumbs up to them for putting "draft" cream soda and root beer up as well as harder to find bottled sodas.  This place does get pretty packed from the "happy hour" monday nights starting at 8pm.  During this time regular hot dogs are only 1 dollar and the others come with a pretty hefty discount.  The decor has a nice old feel to it that goes well with its food.  Service here is a plus since they talk to you more like a friend than a customer.

Food was good, but not sure we'll be back due to the poor service. 

-Not enough staff for the number of diners. Waited in line for a solid 10-15 minutes to order (not peak meal time). 

-Out of veggie burgers

-Table was dirty and we had to ask to have it cleaned. 

-Got my order wrong (I asked for sauce on the side). Had to wait for them to re-make my order. 

-They took away our number and forgot about our dessert, until we reminded them twice.

For the Monday deals: can not beat those prices. Otherwise, buy a pack of dogs from trader joes around the corner and make your own for cheaper. Its a quick eat, especially good with groups and serves its purpose of feeding hungry college students like myself. Oh! surprise the dessert was very good!

Probably one of the better places that we've stumbled upon around Westwood Village.  It could be a little bit pricey if you tend to have a bigger appetite like me, (from running/biking/swimming all the time...) but a tasty meal.  We opted for sweet potato fries instead of their chips too which added $1.50 per meal.  Total for a burger and hot dog for me, and a veggie burger for my wife, one soda, and a $5 off coupon in the entertainment book and it still came out to almost $30.  

If you want to save a little, sign up for their "Stand" card.. You get 5% off.  They also have a deal on Mondays where their regular hot dogs are $1, and their special ones are like $2.50.  WAY cheaper.... I'm sure Mondays will be the days you see more college students.  

Monday nights we'll now have to choose between Lamonica's 2 for 1 deal, and this place.

If you are one of those people who needs to always go to the stand when you go out to eat with your friends, do them all a favor and start packing your lunch. This place is NOT that great!

Unfortunately I work with several of those people so I will say that if you do go, ask for the cobbler. It's not on the menu but it is really good and it will make that dry, drab chicken sandwich worth it. Sorta.

I love that here you can get a Dirty Dog (like the kind you used to find on the streets in DTLA on the carts)  without worrying about food poisoning.  

I love that homemade chips come with each order.

I love the crispy pickles served at the condiment bar.

I love the cheeky decor.

Rate this place for what it is.

A place where you can get $1 hot dogs and $2 beers.

That's pretty much all that needs to be said.

thought it was okay when i first tried. i was just glad they finally shut down that pasta place run by thai people who run noodle planet as well. (they were horrible by the way) 
i've tried ABC burger, brisket bbq sandwich - they were... hmm... okay. i can't think of any other words. price isn't so bad, service is whatever of course. i heard their hot dogs are pretty bad though. ironic, cuz they're supposed to be their specialty. 
I'd probably go back just cuz i like this old school diner atmosphere, and there are only very few better options for lunch in westwood. 
oh. their chips are just gross. awful. pay an extra dollar  and get the fries. slightly better.

What a super place. Great food, great prices, great ambiance. Finally a place that also plays real music. with great seating. A wonder full place for all ages. TV . for all those special games. A well thought out eatery. The menu has an incredible selection at reasonable prices for the quality of food that is offered. Also a good selection of beverages and deserts. 

2nd visit, well everything was great, but some idiot decided that nice music was not cool in Westwood. Now you can here the same crap that every other burger place plays to appease the kid's, what a shame, great food but the ambiance just went out the window.
I love the burgers and dogs. The burger was cooked just right. The portion is decent. They get an extra star because of the delicious pickles!
Love the big burgers!!

This is one of our "go to" places for lunch on the weekends with the kids.  The food is good, atmosphere is good, it's affordable, there is usually parking wiithin a block on the street.  We really like it.  I don't understand the negative reviews on Yelp.  We have never had a bad meal or bad experience here - after at least 15 lunches.  We are always very happy with it.
Make your own sandwich or burger...it's nothing too special.

my boyfriend loves this place so we go every monday for their special half price stand dogs.  and to be honest, i'm sick and tired of hot dogs. 

this place is pretty pricey at $4.50 per loaded dog.  but on mondays for stand card holders, they're only $2.
The only gourmet burger place in Westwood. Between 1145am - 1245 the line gets long so be smart. Beef fans? try ABC Burger or BBQ Burger.

I was kind of hopeful about this corny-looking place for a cheap burger, but it was a real letdown.  Stale, gray-colored buns, cold, greasy potato chips... and the veggie burger was the same gray color as the bun and tasted about the same.  The hot dog (turkey) itself was the best part of the meal, nice and snappy.  The service was not much better than the food.  If it were even a little better, I'd be willing to try it again, but that one experience was enough for me.  Anyone know a great place for a turkey dog?

It was alright.  Glad they had turkey dogs.  But the service was slow (granted, they just opened.)  They give you a buzzer with a small number on it.  It goes off, and then you have to hold it up while they walk around looking for your table.  Ours buzzed for 12 minutes and someone had to hold the thing in the air while it vibrated.  It's also really loud inside when only half full, couldn't easily hold a conversation.  Still, the food was pretty good, not too expensive, and probably the portion size I should be eating anyway.

***

Gave it another chance by bringing a veggie burger home.  When I picked it up, the bun crumbled into 6 pieces!  I asked my father, and he said the same thing happened to him when he ordered one.  The veggie patty was good (not the same generic Gardenburger you get everywhere), but plan on eating it with a knife and fork.

More like 2.5 stars.  I dislike the clusterfuck of toppings on the dogs, burgers and sandwiches.  A cut above many of the other shitty similar places like Pink's, Marty's, and Jeff's, but there is definitely something missing here.  If you order something simple like a hotdog with mustard and onions and some fries, you are not going to be disappointed.  A cold 22oz beer in a plastic cup is available on tap and there are some specials on Monday or game day or something.  Food in Westwood, with the exception of some wonderful Persian places, is not particularly noteworthy.  The Stand, therefore, is right at home here.

Ok, the only thing more neurotic than trying out a new restaurant twice in one week is writing a yelp review for aforementioned restaurant twice in one week.
Came back here for the dollar hot dogs, and I have to say I'm impressed.  $1 for a standard hot dog (onions, ketchup, relish, tomato, etc), or $2.50 for a "loaded" dog (chili cheese dog--yum!!!) was a great deal and totally delicious to boot.  It was also fun to see everyone else in the restaurant chowing down on hot dogs!

walked in on a private party. teens are so annoying... there was this one skinny "hot" girl who just had to block the entrance to the bathroom so she could stand next to the boy she liked while pretending not to notice him. it was funny though, because th

The thing about working in an office in Westwood is that you want to try new surrounding restaurants. That's how I stumbled into The Stand. The place is nicely decorated and feels clean. There are plasmas around the place so you can stop by to watch the game. 

My first trip there I got the Big Bleu Burger and it was a solid choice. The beef was delicious and the bun was crispy and soft. The fries were good, but nothing to rave about. The second time around, I got the mushroom burger and while it was not as good as the Big Bleu Burger, it still tasted amazing. 

If I had only eaten the hamburgers, this place would have gotten a 4, but alas, I had to try the hot dogs. I was not keen on spending so much on a hot dog so I came during their Monday dollar dogs. I ordered a stand dog and basically created a chili dog. It was decent, but for a burger and hotdog joint, I was expecting more. I ordered a $1 hot dog and that was OK. I almost prefer a costco dog over what I ate. 

If you want only a burger, this place gets a 4, otherwise you'll get a 3ish hot dog.

I had the "downtown LA dog", which came free with a side of chips (they appeared to be made fresh?).  You can get cole slaw instead of chips, too.  This was a pretty good meal for me and I paid about $6 with tip (after 5pm they have table service).  this wasn't as good as the street hotdogs, but was still an OK hotdog and came with cips.  being that i'm a ucla student, i'd be down to eat here semi regularly, the food is alright and the price is right.  i also tried some of my friend's knish. while it was pretty plain (i have the feeling that real knish from new york must be amazing) they were still somehow addicting
the best place in Westwood. Why don't more people go here?

I am the self proclaimed connoisseur of hot dogs.  I have eaten hot dogs in almost every variation and numerous location throughout the country, so I feel like I am an expert on the subject of meat in tube form.  

The Stand is a chain with numerous outlets around town.  What they offer is an uniform service throughout all locations, but each location having their specials that are specific to their operation.  The Stand that I will be reviewing is the location in Westwood, by UCLA.  

Hot dogs, do me is considered the All-American cuisine.  Everyone at one point or another have had a hot dog.  What The Stand offers is a huge variation of hot dogs.  Their standard dog is the Chili Dog, which they do very well.  The chili is complex and they use real shredded cheese rather than slices of American cheese that covered in chili.  Their Kraut Dog uses their homemade sauerkraut, combined with a spicy mustard that gives it a little kick that one is not expecting from a traditional kraut dog.  We had a special order of fries...the fire fries that is fries that is pre-soaked in buffalo sauce, and then deep fried, so rather than having your fries covered in the sauce, the essence of the buffalo sauce is ingrained in every bite of the fries.  It's a manageable spice yet, do yourself a favor and not have soda with it or else you'll suffer the same consequence as me and the heat of the fries then becomes unmanageable.

Overall, I hesitate to make this correlation, but I would consider The Stand to be the McDonald's of the hot dog business.  They do everything well, but don't do anything great.  However, if you're looking for a good hot dog and a relaxing dining experience, this is a great place for you.  It doesn't have the cache of a Pink's, but then it also doesn't have the lines associated with a Pink's.

Tried out the Stand on a whim. And now I don't want to go back.

I ordered the Stand Brat with chips. Drink was water. Should be pretty straightforward. But the prep time for a sausage in a hot dog bun took a long time. My friend who ordered a burger and fries about the same time was served first. And then I kept waiting. The restaurant wasn't very busy, and the kitchen seemed to be staffed with at least 4 people. But I just kept on waiting. When I finally got it, they gave me it in a to-go box even though I never said to-go.

The food itself was not horrid, about what I was expecting. But for the price and service, it's not worth it. Here's the big issue, which I haven't even gotten into yet. They give the customers pagers when upon ordering. This suggests the customers go pick up their own food. Okay. But then for whatever reason, they decide to do table service. Why have pagers then? Why not switch to numbers at the table? And the waiters have no clue what table to serve the food, aimlessly wandering the dining area. Is it this table? No. That table? No. That's something out of a Kitchen Nightmares episode.

So no, I do not plan on coming back. I think the concept could totally work in the Westwood Village area, but the Stand needs to get its act together.

This is pretty good for what it is--hot dogs and hamburgers. They have a lot of different combinations and options on their menu (almost too many!!) and they are all very filling. I got a hotdog with ketchup and jalapeños and I was FULL for the rest of the night. Also, their chips are homemade and are great with chili.

It seemed like there was some buzz about this place so I went in for lunch one day.  It was super busy - long lines, few tables.  My lettuce-wrapped mushroom burger with cole slaw tasted fine but not exactly $8 worth.  My friend's beef was undercooked and the fudge on our brownie sundae tasted burnt.  All in all, despite cute decor, it's not somewhere I'd go again.

Sandwiches are A-OK, not bad, not best ever. Its a good bet for a cheap meal that is a few steps above fast food. AND they have $2 beers. All in all is not a bad way grab some grub with friends on a budget.

Meh.  Would not spend the money to come here again.  Place charges like ten bucks a burger and it is not even that good.  I ended up getting the chili cheese burger and there was like no chili on the thing.  Moreover, their chili cheese fries were a bust too as the chili was simply crap and at $5+ for a large it was pretty bad.  All in all this place is just an overpriced, horrible burger shop.

Not a good visit this time. Girl taking our order looked lost plus we couldn't hear her. Our order did not come out at the same time (there were 4 of us) and they got our order wrong. Grrr. My chicken apple sausage looked so unappetizing, it was gray and tiny. I'm hoping this was just an off night for them. Too bad as we brought another couple to try it for the first time.

Previous review has been slightly modified so that my comments regarding an unpleasant experience with an employee during my visit do not to come off as a "personal attack". Please note that the person in question severely impaired my enjoyment of my dining experience and at this point I will not be returning to this establishment and will be canceling a planned UYE. The person DID somehow find me on facebook and then proceeded to contact a mutual friend (I had no idea who this person was or that we even shared any similar acquaintances, not to mention that my facebook profile is private to anyone who is not listed as a "friend" ) to complain about my review. I do not feel comfortable ever returning to this location for fear of retaliation and further negative behavior from this person.

It's interesting that she even knew that the review was about her unless she is completely aware of the fact that she should be WORKING while at work and not flirting with and annoying all of the customers who are just trying to enjoy a meal. That was my whole point of the story. She was making my dining experience intolerable (a sentiment shared by others at my table as well as at other tables as I noted in my review)

Potential diners should be aware of anyone or anything that might make their experience unpleasant and the owner/manager should be aware of employees who turn people off from returning.

Looking for an LA replacement for my beloved Top Dog in Berkeley.  The Stand is not it, nor is Pink, but at least at The Stand you don't wait an hour to figure that out.

I had the Spicy Polish Dog (topped with grilled onions and deli mutard)with Fries an

I take my guys out here every time we find ourselves in west l.a. 

I skip the food court at the century city mall sometimes and stop over by The Stand and grab a Chicago Dog or even a custom burger with one of their beers on tap.

It's a great place to hang out and have lunch...

There are a bunch of executive types that wander in sometimes and it's always amusing to see them stuff napkins over their suits before diving into a messy chili dog.

Came here before my main goal= Diddy Reise cookies!! and decided to have a hot dog.

I like the look of the place. Standard ALL American eatery with beers AND root beers on tap!??!!!! Plus, ESPN on the flat screen.

It didn't take me long to order, I got the Dwntwn LA Dog.
Waited less than 10mins and it came to my table.

Nothing great about it except I can see this place being a cool hang out. Total $5.43 w/ no drink.

Hey wait I can get a bacon wrapped for $4 standing on the street corner!! lol!! blah! I'd rather save hot dogs for those drunken moments! But would grab a drink here IF i went to UCLA!!

The Stand is a snazzy place off of Westwood which feels like a new aged rustic restraunt. Its one of those places where it tries to push the "we've been here forever, so we must be good." They have not been there forever though. A little misleading if you ask me, but I do like the style. 

The service was the most lacking of anything. Maybe it was a combination of eating there while it was lunch hour and the food inspector watching over them, but there were plenty of angry people. Lets just say, I have worked in food service and when somebody walks past me and acts like I am looking at them with an inquisative look on my face for no reason, then I tend to get upset. I should not have to put myself directly in your line of path in order to get your attention. My advice: go during off hours. 

The food was not the best thing in town, but that is probably because it was not hot off the skillet, but luke warm. Although, I didn't get a brat or a hotdog, which is apparently their forte. I love how they have a healthy option ("Veggie"), which is why I will probably go back in the future. 

Overall: Its not the best spot in town, but it is far better choice then the same ol' fast food options.

Monday Hot Dog night is awesome and you can't beat the price.  Please try it you won't be disappointed.  I really wanted to give 4 stars but man when I call in a lunch order I always get put on hold and the dude is often borderline rude.  Anyway, I put in my burger order and twice I have had to abandon picking it up because there is no pick up section and the line is long. I waited like ten minutes and had to bounce back to work! The next week the same thing pretty much happened. What is the point of ordering to pick up if you can't pick up your food?! Dinner is much calmer and you can watch a game and get pretty good service.  Give it a shot for a pretty good burger just know that lunch time the place is really understaffed or something...

Not really impressed. I heard some good things about this place, so I thought It was going to be money. When I got there, I stood in line for about 15 minutes. Is that why they call it "The Stand"? Anyways, my girlfriend's burger was way underdone, and my hot link was cold. Plus, when I ordered it, I said I wanted it "loaded", which is an option. Loaded to me means, everything. Loaded baked potato, loaded salad, etc. The guy at the counter starts rattling off 30 different items, and since I could see the other people in line, who also had been "standing", getting jittery, I just said "deli mustard and onions". Very uncomfortable. Boo.
I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt however, for two reasons. 
1. Brand new, I've opened a restaurant so I know it can be hectic.
2. While I was ordering, a lady came up to the counter to complain. The guy gave her a $30 gift cert to use next time she came in. Not too shabby, I can tell they are trying.

Great burgers, great chicken sandwiches, great beverages, a great location, and great fries!

Every time I've gone to The Stand, I've left needing a bed and a nap.  The customer service is good, you just walk up, place your order, get  a number, and sit down.  Then the server brings over your food.  The burgers are cooked to order and you can get a nice medium rawr burger if that's what you're feeling!  You can also get delicious fries, but their sweet potato fries are reallllllllly good.  I also like their cole slaw, and their chicken sandwich has hit the spot when I've been eating lighter.  So why, why did it only get 4 stars when this is a 5 star review?  I've been there 5 or 6 times and only once did they actually have the root beer on tap!  I want that root beer, the one time I had it my mouth was engorged in amazing flavor ecstasy, and to have it taken away from me more than once after that was enough to make me drop a star.  I don't know what they need to do, but they need to have that root beer to compliment those amazing burgers!  As soon as the sign for draft root beer catches your eye, it's really all you want, and I just felt it a cop out to not be able to get it all the time.  But even though my lust for root beer hasn't been satiated, the hunger has been and I can sleep at night knowing that The Stand makes awesome food!

PS:  I worked in Westwood for a little over 6 months and food in Westwood really isn't good, and The Stand, really stands out as a place with potential!  Keep up the awesome food!

Tried The Stand with some co-workers the other day, and was really happy with what I got.  I kind of don''t see the point in paying $5 for a hot dog, and most reviewers didn't seem the like the hot dogs here anyways.  But there was a cilantro lime chicken sandwich on the special menu, and it totally sounded worth getting.  

Our food came out quickly, and was very nice.  My sandwich had grilled chicken with red onion, avocado, a creamy cilantro dressing that wasn't too strong on a warmed bun.  Delicious!!!  Instead of fries, I got the homemade potato chips, and they were quite good.

They serve homemade pickle slices that I should have tried, because apparently they are quite good.  But I definitely liked the self-service drinks & the TVs that were playing Golf Channel, so I will be back for sure!

I'm a UCLA student and out of all the places to eat in Westwood Village I feel the The Stand will be facing it's "Last Stand" in the near future. I've been there for $1 dogs on Monday nights and for $1 you get what you pay for because their hot dogs are sub par. Their buns are always hard and the dogs are not as tasty or flavorful as Great LA landmarks like PINK'S. Now there is a dog worth standing an hour to get. 

I went on a Saturday night for dinner with a friend who wanted burgers and beer so I figured that this would be the perfect place. 

We got there at 7p.m. and the place was empty and no one was at the register. My friend smiled at the kitchen who looked surprised to see us and yelled "CUSTOMER" to the back. A server then showed up. 

We both ordered burgers and the server suggested we try a turkey burger on a wheat bun. I decided to try it out while my friend got the Big Blue Burger with fries and a Stella. I went a healthier route since I was already doing a Turkey Burger on Wheat bun. I asked if I can get a salad with that since most place gladly substitute salad for like $1 more. They said I couldn't and it's $4 for a small dinner salad. They said I should try the The Stand Ale they had on Special so I did. The meal came out to like $30. 

An interesting feature is you can see the food being made in the kitchen through a pixie glass like an In N Out burger Drive thru. We sat at a table across from the kitchen but my friend wanted to move soon after because the kitchen keep waiving at her and smiling like if there never seen a women before. Talk about uncomfortable. My friend asked the server there and she said that the kitchen is pretty bad about that kind of thing and how she even hates being left alone with them. No women is safe at The Stand. 

At that point I just wanted our beers which weren't served yet. I had to remind the cashier and she apologized and said she will be right out with them. We moved over to the comfy booth in the front. Food took a while but the cashier said it takes awhile to cook the Turkey burger. My friend was enjoying her Stella as I wasn't that pleased with the The Stand Ale. It tasted like a bad mouth wash to tell you the truth. 

My friends burger looked good although she didn't care for the fries. She said they were super hard. My turkey Burger kept deteriorating cause of the weak wheat burger bun. The worst part was my salad was browning and wilting. The saddest salad I EVER have eaten. Joke was on me for trying to eat healthy at a place that serves hot dogs wrapped in bacon. 

I was still hungry and gave up on the healthy alternative and wanted a New York cheesecake. The Cashier said they are no longer serving that item, yet it was still displayed on the menu. At that point I was done and me and my friend went down the street for some Dee Dee Reese instead for dessert. 

Like the review below... The STAND won't STAND in Westwood much longer. There are so many other better places to go. Good for $1 dogs but I can't see how they can really profit from that.

Overpriced "American" food that tastes average. The Stand is your typical hamburger/hot dog restaurant, but being located in Westwood gives them (and probably forces them) to charge more that your typical joint. I would note that the staff is friendly and helpful; they make it a point to say hello and goodbye! Monday's are hot dog happy hour. That might have bumped The Stand up another star if their hot dogs tasted better than your run-of-the-mill grocery dogs. Would only come back if the nearby In and Out somehow went out of business.

I LIVE for The Stand's veggie burgers!  Their Westside Veggie Burger is absolutely phenomenal!  I could eat that thing almost every day.  For real.
Their specials are really good, too.  I took my bf here not too long ago and they had a burger with goat cheese and arugula - he got beef and I got a veggie one - they were awesome too.  Their fries are also really good - sweet potato fries are amazing!
I've been wanting to try a cobbler, it's one of my favorite foods of all time.  But I haven't gotten around to it.  Let you know whenever I get here again, because I will definitely be getting it next time!
And I haven't had the milkshakes myself, but a couple of my friends got them once when we all went to The Stand together, and they looked REALLY good.
Note: one of those restaurants where you pay, take a number and then pick out your own table. And you get your own drinks.

My son had a kid's meal and I had a turkey burger with cheese. Both were really good.  They forgot to give me cheese (misheard my order, I think) but fixed it right away.  We like the endless supply of pickles.  Reasonable prices, good service, nice atmosphere.

I got the Stand Burger. The sauce wasn't that special. It tasted like BBQ sauce. It would be a 2.5  but the service was very nice. So yeah, just an average burger. Maybe the hotdogs are what makes it famous?

Good thing it was pretty cheap.

I figured since it's now 1 business removed from East West Sandwich (bye bye Pastaghetti and all), I can give the new place a shot. New eats in Westwood after all.

It's a marvel what they've done to the place - it seems twice as big as I remember the location being and they sure can use this conjured up space because it's packed with seating and the butts of nearby officeworkers (for some reason, it was lacking in apparent students when I was there). But any new place in Westwood will be like that.

The more interesting question is whether it has legs. I have to say... maybe. The idea is fine: upscale burgers and hot dogs with a lot of atmosphere. The execution, though, was somewhat lacking. The burger I had was very mediocre, and my companion had a similar impression of the hot dog. And the chips, which they tout on their menu as the 2nd coming, were just plain awful. Maybe we got a bad batch, but they were overcooked to the point of bitterness. Hard to chew bitterness.

On the plus side, the prices were great, and as mentioned it's a fun place to eat. I'm hoping that things will settle down in the months to come, but from what I've tasted so far, it doesn't look like this is going to be a regular spot for me.

I checked out this place for lunch and when I walked in, I thought to myself that this place is like The Counter but for hotdogs instead of burgers.  I liked it better than Pink's also.  Just because it feels less.....dirty.
Good food and service but a bit pricey for a student living on a budget. The decor is very vintage in style and inviting. I would recommend it to others

I've always ilked the Stand, esp. on their Mon $1 hot dog nights.

Anyhow, went here this afternoon for a late lunch and to use my Groupon.

The cashier was extremely friendly and helped me use up all $16.

I got a burger, which was good.  I also had a side of the mac and cheese which was pretty tasty.  Additionally, I had a side of the fruit salad which just hit the spot especially since I was eating a lot of not super healthy food so it was just perfect.  To top it off, I got a small order of fries and a root beer float.  It's not easy to spend $16 there but I did it and had leftovers for dinner to boot

This is a good place for burgers. I would recommend the burgers over the hot dogs and chili, but that may be a personal preference. The meal comes with chips (which I am not impressed with), but I recommend opting for the regular or sweet potato fries. The beer is cheap and good, they brew it themselves. This a great place to watch a football, basketball, or soccer game with the several flat screens. I like the ambiance, and the service is generally quick, but make sure you get an order number from them or your order may get lost among the other orders. UCLA student and members receive discounts.

My fiance and I had high hopes for this joint since we crave turkey burgers once in a while and the only place we can find a decent one is in the Valley.

The menu sounded good, we ordered fairly promptly, but we didn't know we were considered INVISIBLE CUSTOMERS.

Apparently their computer system had issues with two orders: ours and the family that came in before us.  After waiting about 10-15 minutes, the owner, who was entertaining some friends, came over and asked the family what they ordered and to see what was wrong.  Apparently the kids were getting cranky because of hunger.  Hmmm... so were we.
The owner found out that the order didn't make it to the kitchen and got their food going immediately and brought them cookies to tide the kids over.

We kept on waiting.

Several more couples and groups came in and sat down.  I'd say three groups of tables received their food BEFORE us, so I knew they were fast at making burgers.  The entire staff started flitting around trying to figure out why certain orders weren't making it to the kitchen.  Not one time did anyone ask us if we were all right since it was coming on 20 minutes.  Finally I said something and they figured out we were also on the sh*t list.  They hastily listened to my order again and I went to sit down.

Finally the food came.

We had ordered two mushroom turkey burgers.  Mine had a wheat bun, avocado and chips.  Eric ordered a plain bun with chips.

What we got were two regular burgers on plain buns, one with chips and the other with fries.

We said we didn't get what we ordered and they apologized for their computer system and that it was the third day of business, but not for putting in the wrong order.  They gave me my money back in cash but I realized I stupidly gave them a tip on the credit card receipt, so I didn't get that back.

What drove the terrible experience home for me is that the staff and owner were going around to all of the tables to make sure customers were getting their food and that they were having an enjoyable experience... even the guy sweeping up the floor was asking customers!  Not once did they come to our table!!!!  The sweeper asked the table next to us, passed us over and went to another table.  

So we left.  We took our money and coupon for two free burgers and walked out the door.

I think it would take a miracle to get Eric to go back there.  And hopefully they have a good IT manager to rely on.

Props for a good menu, fast service when computers are working, decent staff when things are going right

Cons for staff members rushing to make orders instead of listening properly for the correct order, ignoring us

This is a good place if you're craving a burger. This place is good because there's a lot of customization that can go into the burger you order..which is great. The downside, however, is that burgers come with potato chips, but you can upgrade to fries for a buck or two.

Decent food.  I had the Italian Sausage with mac n cheese and a beer.  My friends had a regular/boring hot dog and a burger with fries.  The fries are pretty good.  The food wasn't necessarily memorable, but not horrible either.  I'd go back to try some other varieties, but wouldn't really put it in my rotation.  

The decor kind of reminds me of Jerry's Famous Deli - except the frames on the wall give you descriptions of all their different types of burgers and dogs, versus celebrities at JFD.  

The restaurant is smack in "college town", so you're going to run into students out for a quick meal.  It seemed like there were specials if you were part of The Stand club or something, which I can see would be very beneficial to starving college kids.  

All in all...not bad..not great.

I have to warn if you order the cobb salad make sure u check if it has blue cheese. I ordered the same thing twice and they forgot to add the blue cheese in both occasions.  I also tried their BBQ sandwich. After a few bites I started losing my appetite. Yeah! It's that bad.  I do like their sweet potato fries.

Great hamburger joint.  Great Sweet Potato Fries, better even than the regular fries.  Yummy sodas on tap.

Great dill pickle chips, and its fun to snack on them.  It's self-serve pickles, all you can eat.   

My guests had the bbq chicken salad and loved it.

Decent burgers (I had the mushroom burger) and fries if you're in Westwood village and refuse, for whatever reason, to go to In-N-out. Well, I guess there's more variety here: hot dogs, toppings, sandwiches, etc. But just over in Brentwood is Barney's Burgers, which I think is better, and parking is actually (relatively) easier. The only times I've eaten here are when others in the group have suggested or insisted; somehow, I always forget this place exists.
It's a nice little place. Good food.

I got the special burger that has goat cheese and it was great. It's kind of annoying though how you have to order fries separately, I know it's subtle but it makes the meal slightly more expensive than it should be.

I'd definitely go back if I were in Westwood and wanted a burger.

1 dollar hot dogs on Mondays after 5pm, or a 3 dollar kids meal always fills me right up (their kids sized burgers are pretty big actually), comes with soft drink and fries!

Totally nummy

Update:  I went back and had their hamburger and it was really bad.  Just overly greasy and blech.   It seriously tastes like McDonald's Angus Burger, except WORSE!  
And the meat was undercooked: salmonella alert!



Dunno about anything else on the menu, but the Chicago dog i had was pretty good!  The potato chips however, were a little bad and stale(ugh, i know..)  

And, I'm not sure if it was their food that did it or not, but the next morning i had very bad stomach pains.  =P 

Prices are decent.  Especially compared to places like Pink's.

I had the stand cheeseburger.  it was a "B" burger not too bad.  The grilled onions had a stange taste mixed with the "stand" sauce and the meat was a little dry...my biggest complaint is "if you dont know how to cook a burger at medium then dont offer it.  Nothing worse than getting a burger well done when wanting it cooked medium.  I would eat here again, but definitely would not be my first choice.

I had a fantastic hot dog in Boston and it was because it had a snap as I bit into it. I think that's because its in natural casing. Well, The Stand's dogs have that awesome quality! I only get the dogs here, but they're good every time.
I love burgers..cheeseburgers especially.. I just wasn't completely satisfied.. I would much rather prefer the houston's burger or even the island's one to the stands..

The S tand provides solid, good burger and friend for the cheap at heart. This place is all about value. Occasionally they run specials for 1 for 1 burgers. I think this is the best burger in Westwood. The staff is always very nice and helpful, although sometimes overwhelmed. It is generally busy for lunch and empty at dinner...

If I'm craving pastrami and I'm on foot in Westwood, I will come here.  It's nothing spectacular but I refuse to give a penny more to Jerry's deli.  I will give them an extra star for a decent burger and CHEAP beer though.

So I got this really cool voucher from Munchonme.com for a free hot dog from The Stand after 3pm.  It expired on 8/25/11.  

I came in on 8/25/11 at 6:45pm.  They wouldn't honor my voucher.  I asked why...the guy at the counter said "you're the 3rd person today that brought that in.  we don't accept that anymore."  I asked if it's because today was the expiration date, and he just said they stopped taking it.  That sucks! 

So I just ordered small sweet potato fries.  The guy must have been new because it took forever for him to enter my order (then he had to ask again if I wanted small or large) , then it took forever for him to count my change.  

I give this place 2 stars.   The 2 stars are just for the fries only.

I like the hot dogs that they serve at this stand it reminds me of one summer that I spent in Boston with my family. They have some of the best hot dogs that you have ever tasted in that city. But this stand does in fact compete with those hot dogs that one summer. Nathan's hot dogs, from what I have been told is actually a Jewish kosher dog.

Amazing food and even better customer service.  The draft root beer and the fire fries are definite must haves.  I love this place and on a Monday, the deals are kickin.  Come here at least once a week.  I brought my dog once and I had to eat outside, they accidently served me a beer (which you can't have outside) they comped me a root beer and told me they'd get me back next time.  Always amazes me how friendly they are here.  Very progressive as well.  The fact that on a Monday, I was able to get a beer, loaded dog and special fries for under 8 bucks, makes me smile.  In tough times, nothing beats the stand.  Hands down.

Also recommend the chili.

Ever since Udog closed, Westwood has been seriously lacking in quality hot dogs. I desperately wish there was something like Top Dog around Berkeley in Westwood. The Stand certainly looks impressive from the decor, but the food is absolutely repulsive. 

Food: I tried the "Loaded" Stand dog (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VyR84b3N4OnpH2U53D1xJQ?select=tyrESk8AuBQx8htfHX8Q3g) and the Downtown LA dog (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VyR84b3N4OnpH2U53D1xJQ?select=bIZuSw1rFky5X91RqvS6Cw). Neither were as tantalizing as the description made them sound, primarily because they were drenched in mayo or substandard toppings. The "Loaded" Stand dog has several options for toppings and it doesn't cost you extra to order them all, which is basically what I did. Big mistake. Bell peppers are good alone. Sweet relish is good alone. Onions are good with bell peppers. But add everything together and it's disasterous. The Downtown LA dog is probably trying to mimic a Dodger dog, but it's covered in low quality mayo and mustard that make eating it a soggy and unappetizing experience. Not even the chips were good; they were overly fried and tasteless. I felt so bad throwing it away... so wasteful. 

Atmosphere: This is the one saving aspect of The Stand. The inside is decorated with a 50s theme, very retro chic. The walls are plastered with giant advertisements for each of the different hot dogs so that you can't help but salivate once you enter. They did a really good job with the design here. 

Service: I ordered from the cash register and ate my stuff at home. Nothing unusual to report here. 

Synopsis: At ~$4.50 per dog, The Stand is not a bad deal but still not as great as the former Udog. Unfortunately, the hot dogs themselves are absolutely disgusting. I hope they figure out how to make a better dog at some point because otherwise there's no way I'm ever coming back here.
The hot dog meat is really small and didn't live up to the impression you get from the name. At least the fries were good. Also, a little overpriced.

I'm really not sure why this place only gets 3 stars.  I had a wonderful experience.  The guy at the counter (w/ beard) was SUPER friendly and helpful.  My food came out correct and timely.  The food was way better than I would have thought considering the reviews.  I had mushroom swiss burger w/ fries.  We did go on sleepy Sunday in summer so not much happening in Westwood.  
How bad can it be?  They give out free pickles!

Sure it's not a Chicago dog (best in the world - sorry New Yorkers); and sure it's not even the overrated Pink's Hot Dog; but The Stand was on point with me!

Don't let the naysayers ruin your concentration; the long standing line  through your front door is just a test of patience (it's also not a bad thing to have in this economy). Whatever it is, never change your Sausage menu - Kosher Dog, Big Red Dog, Brat, Texas Polish, and the Chicken Apple, which I have yet to try.  However:

My buddy got the chicken apple sausage and I couldn't take my eyes off of it. I mean, she was so fine.... loaded with all the right toppings, you were a beautiful specimen. Just like chocolate & oysters, chicken apple sausage - the next unknown aphrodisiac, I'm calling it out now.

And someone else wrote a review about your $1.00 Mondays? You are so money you don't even know it.  Remember that time when Peter Griffin got a job at the Pawtucket Brewery? Money!

I actually had a Tuna Salad and it wasn't bad. Loaded with an over-sized scoop of tuna and a healthy portion of veggies.

This is a somewhat upscale and creative hot dog and burger restaurant that originated in Encino and has enjoyed enough success to open locations in West LA. 

French Fry Review: 

Both french fries and fresh potato chips are offered. The fries are fresh and have a very small amount of skin on them. The fries are too large and undercooked and unfortunately mushy in the middle. The potato chips, in contrast are so thin and crispy that they are difficult to distinguish from the potato chips you might get in a bag in the supermarket. They serve the chips with ranch dressing and are willing to provide other sauces (like barbecue) in addition. The fries and chips are reasonably priced and you get a larger portion for $2 than you get at McDonald's.

Ravenous after an evening class, I stopped on by - accompanied by classmates. I ordered a veggie burger (I'm not a vegetarian) because the cashier (also a flesh-eater) insisted that their's is very good. 

We were able to grab a booth - speaking of which, the decor of this place is pretty darn fun - and I munched on crunchy pickles (all-you-can-eat) as I waited for my order to arrive. Food came quickly (woot-woot), and I totally dug the disposable packaging (wasteful, but sanitary). My veggie burger was ginormous. Not bad, not bad. But the chips that accompanied it? I don't know... they looked better than they tasted. (Falafel King's are better). 

An overall happy experience. I left full and satisfied, but the next time I'm craving a burger, I think I have to go for the flesh. And ooh, at In-and-Out.

PEACE!

a solid 3 stars, mostly for monday hot dog deals....

so i'm still on a quest for the best burger ever and this place doesn't really deliver. the food is WAAAYYYY oversalted and makes me feel fatter than i already am...lol  in terms of burgers, i've only had the gourmet burger and don' t get me wrong, it tastes pretty good, but the bun's not fresh and it just leaves you feeling gross.

as for hot dog specials: the big red is extra but the kick of the slight spiciness really adds to the hot dog. however, beware of the ends without bun or toppings cuz it gets unbearably salty pretty quickly.  the bleu cheese dog isn't that great either cuz they glop on too much...however, since you can customize your hotdog, do whatever you want =) the ingredients are that fresh but it is cheap =)

since the nba finals are on, i feel it's prudent to warn you guys that while there are a few tvs, the screens aren't that big. however, if you don't want to feel like a sardine in a bar at barney's...=D

UCLA charges for parking 24/7, that should tell you something about this neighborhood. It's exclusive. It's expensive. And yet The Stand offers some amazing deals as well as tasty, good quality food, great beer and wine selection and a clean, comfortable atmosphere. 

There's a lot to choose from and unlike many similar places, you can customize your sandwich or burger to get exactly what you want. I had the Patty Melt, which was delicious, and not too greasy. The bread was crispy and the burger was done just right. The fries are thick home style. I also had a salad which was fresh and really good. 

I liked the food and the ambiance far better than the delis in the area. It feels young and hip, exactly the kind of place a college neighborhood should have. If I lived around here, I would come to The Stand all the time. Drinks were up in a few minutes. Food took a little longer but was hot -- brought out right when it was ready.

The Stand claims they have never had any health violations, but then I don't see why a member of the Health Department would tell us that they went and inspected the place and found things (I believe one of the things he said was that the grills were not hot enough) if they didn't..  Even if that individual did misreport things to us, the way the Stand's staff treated us when we were just trying to warn them is completely unacceptable.  A simple "thank you.  we'll look into that" would have been fine.  A surly response and being accused of lying by the staff (and now the manager)? Not fine.  Hopefully, a down economy weeds out businesses like this with crappy customer service.

Never really one to crave hot dogs, I came here with couple of my frat bros for Monday's $1 dog deals. $1 gets you a dog and bun and just your choice of sauces, but to really make it worth your meal, you can upgrade to the $2.50 dog and add 3 of the "Loaded" toppings. You  need a Stand card to take advantage of the deal, but it's free to sign up and you can do it before you order.

The dog itself was nothing special, the toppings made it a more wholesome meal but nothing terribly filling. I was definitely still hungry after my dog, and I didn't really feel like getting another one. 

A mediocre review for a mediocre place.

If there's one thing that can ruin a hamburger, it's a cheap bun that disintegrates as your eating it. Not more than three bites into an "ABC" (avocado, bacon, cheddar + the optional garlic mushrooms), the bun gave up the ghost. The meat itself was so-so, a little dry and lacking on flavor. Minus points as well for their claim of "goes great with beer" when they actually had NO beer available when I was there for whatever reason (bad timing I guess). My friend ordered their version of the "danger dog" called the Downtown Dog and they forgot to include the key ingredient that makes it such: bacon. To their credit, they gave us a new complete dog. As a compromise, I ordered a root beer on tap, which was okay but a little on the warm side. I've had way better burgers for $8 (25 Degress in Hollywood comes to mind). I don't think I could "stand" another visit to the...uh, never mind.

Super yummy and cheap! I love this place... They have turkey dogs with healthy toppings, served on a poppy seed bun... yum! They should have a better selection of sides but the chips you get with your meal work. The staff is usually really great and they have beer if you dine in... When its nice you can sit outside (no beer, but still nice.) They double charged my card one time and handled it right away and gave me a gift certificate for the accident... very professional!

Great food, great service, great prices, and a great atmosphere!

I love this place. When you go inside it looks like a cute old fashioned burger joint. Checkered tablecloths and all. The staff is friendly and attentive. And the food comes out pretty quickly.

Prices are pretty standard. Definitely reasonable for the quality and amount of food you're getting.

This place has some of the best onion rings I have ever had in my life, and I've had A LOT of onion rings because they're like my favorite food. The milkshakes are also top notch. Now for the burgers. I had the mushroom burger. It was incredible. Cooked perfectly and delicious. My boyfriend has the fried egg burger. I don't even like eggs, but it looked so good I wanted to eat it too! We also split an order of the steak fries which a super yummy chipotle lime sauce! I'm not sure if they are a permanent menu item though - they might be a temporary special. So go as soon as you can and try them!

The Stand is also a great to-go place. They have convenient online ordering and it's always ready quick. The only drawback is the parking (as is pretty much every other restaurant in Westwood Village) as it is not plenty and ALWAYS costs money no matter what unless you go later at night.

You gotta try it! It's a Westwood favorite!

Finally tried the hot dogs here, on there $1 Mondays. It was really mediocre. I guess that's what hot dogs are...mediocre. I had the poppy seed bun, and it was warm, but I wish it were toastier on the outside. Chipotle chili sauce on top was flavorful. Well, I did get what I paid for... $1... and I would not pay anything more.

I had an incident a few weeks ago and Murray Wishengrad took the time to personally email me to get to the bottom of things. They do want to hear what their customers have to say so they can make the dining experience better for everyone.

I paid $10 for a salad mostly consisting of spinach.  The service was fast, though I would have preferred a $3 salad from Trader Joe's, or even the salad bar at Whole Foods.  If you're short on time and working within a one-block radius, The Stand isn't a bad choice.

this place is pretty good, not amazing but the bleu cheese burger is pretty tasty. It kinda sucks taht you have to pay extra for fries as opposed to the not so great potato chips. Their fried potato knish dealie is pretty tasty but in my opinion the prices are too high for the quality. If you want a good burger i would go to the counter instead. Honestly its more a of a 3.5 star place but i'm being nice

So...I'm going up the elevator in my apartment building, then walking down my floor to my apartment.  THEN SUDDENLY, I'm drifting, DRIFTIN' in an heavenly aura of BACON FRAGRANCE...And that led me to her with the lust for a bacon-wrapped tube of pureed pork parts...

...and what a disappointing tease she was.

I ordered the "BIG RED DOG: Our 1/4 lb. spicy beef dog served grilled" with their fancy-shmancy "LOADED" condiment feature.  I paid an extra $2 for bacon on top of that.

For being grilled, the hotdog was barely warm.  The bread served cold out of the bag.  Their "fresh" chips were disgusting. You could taste the age of the oil they fried them in.

ANNND...my freakin' "BACON" was a little ketchup cup of dried, cold bacon bits.  Go to Pink's and get the soft, JUUUUICEH, drippy pig fat you deserve.

I don't care much for this place. The food is okay. The drinks are okay. Everything is just okay.

I do recommend this place for a good, cheap manly meal if you're young and in college. I wouldn't close a business deal in this place.

I guess I would go h

Had the Monday $1 Hot Dogs: Kraut Dog (sauerkraut, deli mustard) & Loaded Dog (garlic mushroom, avocado, swiss cheese). 

At first, it wasn't so bad. My Loaded Dog was quite delicious, except the avocado was unripe and there was way too much bun. Those garlic mushrooms were the business though. Yum. I had to stop eating the Kraut Dog halfway through because the sauerkraut was horrible (not fermented at all) and the deli mustard made me sick. It also had way too much bun / bread or was the weiner too small? [That's what she said.] 

Now I'm laying on my couch in a horrible fetus position, asking myself what the hell did I eat tonight? I would rather spend a little more, and get a decent hot dog. Ugh ugh ugh ugh. Service was quick and kind. And would only come back to try something else + $2.00 beer/wine. But right now, my stomach is hating me... And I'm hating those hot dogs.

TIP: Also, it's really not $1 hotdogs... it's $2.50 for a hotdog with three toppings and $2.50 for any classic dog. And trust me, with those hotdogs, you NEED those toppings.     

Overall concensus at my table: Costco hot dogs is way better (and way cheaper) than Stand hot dogs.

If you want really good service, this is the place to go. Yes, the food is good, but the whole appeal of this place for me is that I know I will leave satisfied. One time I came here with a friend and ordered something I didn't end up particularly liking. One of the staff members told me that they'd be more than happy to change it for another menu item for me at no charge. I thought that was really awesome, and I ended up loving the chicken sandwich I traded it for. 

They have great hot dogs and burgers, and great deals if you have a Stand Card, which is free :) I also love the location, nearby a lot of cool little shops, etc. 

I will definitely be back when I'm in the area :)

4 stars for the only thing I've ever ordered and will always order:

The Rachel!

Pastrami, swiss cheese, coleslaw, 1000 island dressing, on grilled rye bread. For ~$9, you get a pretty filling sandwich + chips (or fries).  It's really good... the pastrami is not lean at all, sometimes a little bit chewy but whatever, it's still yumm.

I tried the sweet potato fries - they were ok, but a little too soggy for take-out.  Their menu is kind of overwhelming, so I don't think I will venture far from my tried and true.  But trust - the Rachel is hella good!

Service has always been really nice.  Overall, I recommend stopping by if you're in the neighborhood.

Tip: Sign up for their frequent buyer card... you save some change every time you order and can buy a pint of their house brew for real cheap (like $2? I think).  That reminds me, you can't drink beer at the tables outside the restaurant =(

Great decor and atmosphere. I've been here a few times and the burgers are good if not a little high priced on a student budget. But its not Mickey D's so you pay for what you get. 

Service is fine. Nothing too special. 
Complimentary pickles, condiments, and water.
Great location in Westwood- good place to get lunch and go out and explore the city.

Overall a good burger joint. Get the philly cheese steak.

ROOT BEER ON TAP.

but...kind of expensive. The idea is great for a college town, the prices not so much. Put this restaurant on the Miracle Mile or WeHo adjacent, and there'd be tons of folks flocking to this hot dog haven.

I've passed by this place several times in my past 4 years at UCLA, but I've never tried it. So, taking advantage of our "Bruins Night Out," my friends and I came here to try something new.
And boy, were we glad we came! 
My friends got the Mushroom Burger and ABC burger, while I got the chicken club sandwich. It was more like a grilled chicken burger- 2 pieces of grilled chicken, crispy bacon, avocado, lettuce, and tomato between a toasted burger bun. Hold the mayo please!
I was very satisfied with my meal, and my friends liked theirs' too. It wasn't overly messy, and the toasted bun helped it not get soggy.
I tried the sweet potato fries, but they were nothing special.. Some were soft and soggy, others crispy. Inconsistent to say the least

It's one of those places where you walk in and order, then they deliver your food to wherever you're seated. The staff was helpful, as they watched out for any tables we could sit at since they were all taken after we had ordered. They even rushed to the table once the customers left so we could be seated promptly!

It was a good place to try, but it probably wouldn't be a place I'd frequent because there's so many other places just like it. 

They do have an extensive menu though, but I'd probably only come back if there were another Bruins Night Out to get that 30% off

This place is the 5-star of 3-star joints, so I gave it 4-stars. It's a standard burger and dog joint. Prices are reasonable but become outstanding on Mondays (during their dollar dog promotion). The inside is clean and the staff is very friendly. Parking in Westwood always blows, but if you're in the area and sick of Chipotle, it's a great place to grab a quick, affordable bite to eat.

business.full_address:
8879 Villa La Jolla Dr
La Jolla, CA 92037
business.name: Landmark Theatre La Jolla Village Cinema

reviews.text: I've seen so many good foreign and indie films in this theater it's hard to give it a bad rating. The staff is always and the snack bar has a good assortment of tasty treats. However, the theater is due for a makeover. The seats are uncomfortable and all in all the place feels like it's not in very good shape. But, for the most part, their selection of films are great.
I love this theater for the movie selection.  It certainly can use some updating, but the independent movies that are offered are great!!

Old, small and slightly scary after 10 p.m.  The seats are also uncomfortable and the rows too close together.  But where else are you going to find those great non-mainstream films that big theaters only pick up AFTER they win an Oscar?

I LOVE Landmark Theaters; this particular one has been my favorite for years and years. Number one, I just like moves that are a little deeper than a lot of the mindless nonsense that plays on the big screen in most multiplexes. Landmark reminds me of movie theaters when I was a kid; the new places feel so generic. The staff are knowledgeable about film which is always nice. I also love the Ken (I'll write a separate review later).

I just saw a film today there and it was good; not great, but that's the thing about the movies at Landmark, I never feel like I wasted my time.  And, life is too short to waste, you know?

A really shitty theater but this is the only place that was showing Black Swan.  I guess the only perk about this place is paying $8 to watch movies but this was around 5:15PM so I'm not sure if it's even cheaper at earlier times or if the price gets higher after 5PM.

This place is super old and kinda creepy.  Not sure if I'll be back here again. . .

It's probably not the best place to watch a movie/film, but it is one of the few places in SD that shows great non-mainstream films and foreign films, so maaaad bonus stars for that.

It's never really crowded there either, so noise and dealing with people isn't a problem.

They take student discounts and have matinée prices at certain times.

business.full_address:
9834 Genesee Ave Ste 328
La Jolla, CA 92037
business.name: Wittgrove Bariatric Center

reviews.text:
Dr. Alan Wittgrove saved my life!  His team, Tracy, are all remarkable people!  This Bariatric Center is only place you can come & not be told "Sorry we don't know what is wrong with you"  go for another test, and another test.  This Dr. can take you into surgery, fix someones mistake, put you back together the right way!  PLUS, the support group once month is FREE, they do this as part of living & leading a  righteous life.  Following the change of life, changed my life & I am over 10 years, doing well, & so thankful for Dr. Wittgrove & Tracy for saving my life!
Loreen
Dr. Wittgrove and his team are the best.  They have been very helpful and wonderful during my weight loss journey.

business.full_address:
25 N Pleasant St
Amherst, MA 01002
business.name: Rolando's

reviews.text: That fried nothingness they call "falafel" is a MISTAKE

This is perhaps the most schizophrenic restaurant concept I've ever seen, the name and the Latino music playing suggest a burrito place, but the menu offers roast beef, burgers, sliders, and (surprise dark horse item) falafel.  

Roast Beef is from natural, hormone-free beef, which is nice, but strangely burgers are not.  Consistency here would be helpful.  Both are good - I'm not much of a roast beef guy, but like what they do here better than I usually do.  Burgers are quite nice, and make me wish they served beer and had a little better ambiance.  They do a blue cheese burger that is quite good, sliders are tasty too.  The menu has some real bargains if you are looking for a small bite.  Both sliders and falafel pockets are comparable in price to a slice of pizza at Antonio's and it's nice to have an alternative when you are looking for a quick bite but not a full meal.

And, I really like the falafel here.  Flavors are nice.  Not the best I've ever had, but definitely good and given the lack of other options for falafel in the area, I'm glad it's on the menu and order it a lot.  

I never see a lot of people in there.  The food is good, the people are nice, and the prices are fair, so I hope these guys can get enough business to stick around.  If you haven't tried them yet, stop in and check them out.

Brooke's review kinda bites because Rolando's roast beef is so far beyond Hardee's, it's ridiculous.  You could hold all of the sauces and be golden.  But while Rolando's markets itself as a roast beef joint, it really should spotlight the falafel.  This pita is simple, delicious, and cheap.  This is exactly what Amherst needed to complement Bueno y Sano (natch, same owners).  The fries are frozen but accompany the falafel well.  Bottomless drinks and friendly service.

Rolando's just opened recently in the former location of Fatzo's (may it rest in peace).  You can get one of three items: roast beef, falafel, or a salad.  That's ok though, because the roast beef sandwiches are good, and remind me of Hardee's/Carl's Jr.  There is a whole list of things to put on them, horseradish and cheese being my favorites, and you can also 'upgrade' to the onion roll if you so choose.

The fries are good and diner-y, so one star just for that.  Not very big inside, but it's a nice place to grab lunch downtown.

business.full_address:
1017 Monterey St
San Luis Obispo, CA 93401
business.name: 2 Dogs Coffee Co & Internet Cafe

reviews.text: Stopped by on 3/30 and it appears to be out-of-business.

Although I don't drink coffee, I do recommend this place because they offer a variety of different types of drinks. Plus they buy their beans direct from the growers and roast them themselves. Rumored to be the best coffee in town.

The atmosphere has really improved since they first opened.

business.full_address:
380 Brown St
West Lafayette, IN 47906
business.name: Jl Records

reviews.text:
It's hard to find a good music store like this anymore. Calling it just a music store though would be a lie.

Before I started getting all my music online if I wanted something I couldn't find elsewhere I knew I could find it here. Tons and tons of CDs with a huge selection of vinyl as well.

They have a large selection of movies as well. DVDs, blu ray, VHS, and tv box sets.

A big reason I come here is I collect older video games. They have a large selection of uses games and consoles. Anything from original Nintendo to Xbox 360.

Good prices and a vast selection are why every time I am in the area I stop by for a look.

If you like music, this is your store.

I can't tell you the number of new bands I've found while either wandering the aisles of CDs, or by talking to the owner/employees. 

I'm going to describe the physical store first, but that's not what's important here. 

You enter the store, and you have a huge whoomph swath of CD's from left to right, it *seems* like as far as the eye can see, but that may be a slight exaggeration =)  Directly ahead of you to the left is a good section of Motown/oldies - to the right are Soundtracks, up and to the right are local bands/electronic music.  The largest section is rock/pop - I've rarely come away not finding a band represented, more commonly I found a few CDs to choose from.

To the left down the ramp is 'other' stuff. Comedy, Jazz, Blues, and a few other niche genres.  Up the stairs lives the vinyl, and all along the walls are tons of autographed guitars.  Lower than those are the used Videos and DVD's.  

If you don't find what you're looking for and its in print, they'll order it for you. If it's not in print, they'll try to find it for you.  

The owner is a huge Tom Waits fan (I just thought I'd put that out there) and he's slowly steering me through his body of work.  

See, that's the kind of thing you don't find at big box stores.  You can't go up to the front and ask what they're playing and have someone get EXCITED about the music.  They just 'have' to play it usually because they're told by corporate that they have to promote this or that CD or band.

But if you hear Rickie Lee Jones on vinyl, by God it's because the person working there really wanted to play it, and they're hummin' and tappin' to it.

Conversations about music are important, and leads you to experience new bands. The owner and employees all very honestly love music.  If you want a recommendation, they have one.  If they're not sure, they'll give you one that they like and let you see if you want to buy and experience it.

Go to JL Records and support something good.  Ok, you'll still buy some stuff electronically - I do sometimes too.  But buy something you can hold in your hand and hug too.  Take time to talk to the guy behind the counter too.  You both may learn something =)

business.full_address:
212 W Main St
Carrboro, NC 27510
business.name: NC Crafts Gallery

reviews.text: Lovely gorgeous blown glass and pottery of all sorts of shapes and sizes.  So many pieces to adorn your home, apartment or office.  If you want an oceanic experience, pick up the beautiful and colorful fish or some other sea urchin from the blown glass selections.  You have metal options, jewelry, vases and hand woven baskets.  This is a retail shop, as well as, a gallery to showcase the works of area artist.

I was unaware that I had such a love for blown glass work.  I'm a little taken aback by it, actually, it's one of those things that I feel like I shouldn't enjoy.  But I do.

The stuff here is really cool, especially the animal type pieces.  It's entirely dispensable knick-knack type of art, space fillers, but excepting that dubious honor they're very beautiful.  There's pottery as well, but it's not nearly as well done on the whole.  It's mostly done by local artists, which anyone can appreciate.

The one real problem I have with the place is the lack of diversity... You're either going to like almost everything here or nothing at all, there's very little middle ground to appeal to buyers not interested in these specific types of glass and pottery.

business.full_address:
6504 America Blvd
Ste 105
Hyattsville, MD 20782
business.name: Tokyo Sushi

reviews.text:
My friend and I decided to check out this place for dinner last night. 

Our verdict? Awful. 

I'd been eyeing this place since it opened and had high expectations. They used to have three signs over top of the store, advertising that they were an all you can eat sushi, Chinese, and Mongolian grill buffet. Personally, all I saw was Chinese, and the only sign they have left says "Tokyo sushi". It was hard to figure out exactly what the place was called; everyone around where I live calls it "that Chinese place by the movie theatre", and I swear I've seen signs with various names for it all around the area. 

I was very excited when I grabbed my plate though. Personally, my favorite Chinese appetizer is crab rangoon, so I grabbed a bunch, along with a some sweet and sour sauce, a spring roll and chicken on a stick. The crab rangoon looked funny when I broke it open...but I was hungry so I dove in anyways. If not for the sweet and sour sauce, it would have tasted like cream cheese with a bit of onion powder mixed in-- shameful, I tell you. To mess up crab rangoon, you've committed a great sin. The spring roll tasted like nothing, so I drowned it in soy sauce. The chicken on a stick was fine, flavorless, but fine, though I'm not too sure how possible it is to mess that up.
